41001010	And immediately , upon ascending from the water , he saw the heavens opened and the Spirit , like a dove , descending , and remaining with him .
41001011	And there was a voice from heaven : “ You are my beloved Son ; in you I am well pleased . ”

41001013	And he was in the desert for forty days and forty nights . And he was tempted by Satan . And he was with the wild animals , and the Angels ministered to him .

41001015	and saying : “ For the time has been fulfilled and the kingdom of God has drawn near . Repent and believe in the Gospel . ”

41001017	And Jesus said to them , “ Come after me , and I will make you fishers of men . ”
41001018	And at once abandoning their nets , they followed him .

41001042	And after he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
41001043	And he admonished him , and he promptly sent him away .

41002001	And after some days , he again entered into Capernaum .

41002016	And the scribes and the Pharisees , seeing that he ate with tax collectors and sinners , said to his disciples , “ Why does your Teacher eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners ? ”

41002018	And the disciples of John , and the Pharisees , were fasting . And they arrived and said to him , “ Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but your disciples do not fast ? ”
41002019	And Jesus said to them : “ How can the sons of the wedding fast while the groom is still with them ? During whatever time they have the groom with them , they are not able to fast .
41002020	But the days will arrive when the groom will be taken away from them , and then they shall fast , in those days .
41002021	No one sews a patch of new cloth onto an old garment . Otherwise , the new addition pulls away from the old , and the tear becomes worse .
41002022	And no one puts new wine into old wineskins . Otherwise , the wine will burst the wineskins , and the wine will pour out , and the wineskins will be lost . Instead , new wine must be put into new wineskins . ”
41002023	And again , while the Lord was walking through the ripe grain on the Sabbath , his disciples , as they advanced , began to separate the ears of grains .
41002024	But the Pharisees said to him , “ Behold , why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbaths ? ”

41002026	How he went into the house of God , under the high priest Abiathar , and ate the bread of the Presence , which it was not lawful to eat , except for the priests , and how he gave it to those who were with him ? ”
41002027	And he said to them : “ The Sabbath was made for man , and not man for the Sabbath .
41002028	And so , the Son of man is Lord , even of the Sabbath . ”
41003001	And again , he entered into the synagogue . And there was a man there who had a withered hand .

41003005	And looking around at them with anger , being very saddened over the blindness of their hearts , he said to the man , “ Extend your hand . ” And he extended it , and his hand was restored to him .
41003006	Then the Pharisees , going out , immediately took counsel with the Herodians against him , as to how they might destroy him .
41003007	But Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea . And a great crowd followed him from Galilee and Judea ,
41003008	and from Jerusalem , and from Idumea and across the Jordan . And those around Tyre and Sidon , upon hearing what he was doing , came to him in a great multitude .
41003009	And he told his disciples that a small boat would be useful to him , because of the crowd , lest they press upon him .
41003010	For he healed so many , that as many of them as had wounds would rush toward him in order to touch him .
41003011	And the unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell prostrate before him . And they cried out , saying ,
41003012	“ You are the Son of God . ” And he strongly admonished them , lest they make him known .
41003013	And ascending onto a mountain , he called to himself those whom he willed , and they came to him .
41003014	And he acted so that the twelve would be with him , and so that he might send them out to preach .
41003015	And he gave them authority to cure infirmities , and to cast out demons :
41003016	and he imposed on Simon the name Peter ;
41003017	and also he imposed on James of Zebedee , and John the brother of James , the name ‘ Boanerges , ’ that is , ‘ Sons of Thunder ; ’
41003018	and Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James of Alphaeus , and Thaddeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
41003019	and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
41003020	And they went to a house , and the crowd gathered together again , so much so that they were not even able to eat bread .
41003021	And when his own had heard of it , they went out to take hold of him . For they said : “ Because he has gone mad . ”
41003022	And the scribes who had descended from Jerusalem said , “ Because he has Beelzebub , and because by the prince of demons does he cast out demons . ”
41003023	And having called them together , he spoke to them in parables : “ How can Satan cast out Satan ?
41003024	For if a kingdom is divided against itself , that kingdom is not able to stand .
41003025	And if a house is divided against itself , that house is not able to stand .
41003026	And if Satan has risen up against himself , he would be divided , and he would not be able to stand ; instead he reaches the end .
41003027	No one is able to plunder the goods of a strong man , having entered into the house , unless he first binds the strong man , and then he shall plunder his house .
41003028	Amen I say to you , that all sins will be forgiven the sons of men , and the blasphemies by which they will have blasphemed .
41003029	But he who will have blasphemed against the Holy Spirit shall not have forgiveness in eternity ; instead he shall be guilty of an eternal offense . ”
41003030	For they said : “ He has an unclean spirit . ”
41003031	And his mother and brothers arrived . And standing outside , they sent to him , calling him .
41003032	And the crowd was sitting around him . And they said to him , “ Behold , your mother and your brothers are outside , seeking you . ”
41003033	And responding to them , he said , “ Who is my mother and my brothers ? ”
41003034	And looking around at those who were sitting all around him , he said : “ Behold , my mother and my brothers .
41003035	For whoever has done the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister and mother . ”
41004001	And again , he began to teach by the sea . And a great crowd was gathered to him , so much so that , climbing into a boat , he was seated on the sea . And the entire crowd was on the land along the sea .
41004002	And he taught them many things in parables , and he said to them , in his doctrine :
41004003	“ Listen . Behold , the sower went out to sow .
41004004	And while he was sowing , some fell along the way , and the birds of the air came and ate it .
41004005	Yet truly , others fell upon stony ground , where it did not have much soil . And it rose up quickly , because it had no depth of soil .
41004006	And when the sun was risen , it was scorched . And because it had no root , it withered away .
41004007	And some fell among thorns . And the thorns grew up and suffocated it , and it did not produce fruit .
41004008	And some fell on good soil . And it brought forth fruit that grew up , and increased , and yielded : some thirty , some sixty , and some one hundred . ”
41004009	And he said , “ Whoever has ears to hear , let him hear . ”
41004010	And when he was alone , the twelve , who were with him , questioned him about the parable .
41004011	And he said to them : “ To you , it has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God . But to those who are outside , everything is presented in parables :
41004012	‘ so that , seeing , they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing , they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they may be converted , and their sins would be forgiven them . ’ ”
41004013	And he said to them : “ Do you not understand this parable ? And so , how will you understand all the parables ?
41004014	He who sows , sows the word .
41004015	Now there are those who are along the way , where the word is sown . And when they have heard it , Satan quickly comes and takes away the word , which was sown in their hearts .
41004016	And similarly , there are those who were sown upon stony ground . These , when they have heard the word , immediately accept it with gladness .
41004017	But they have no root in themselves , and so they are for a limited time . And when next tribulation and persecution arises because of the word , they quickly fall away .
41004018	And there are others who are sown among thorns . These are those who hear the word ,
41004019	but worldly tasks , and the deception of riches , and desires about other things enter in and suffocate the word , and it is effectively without fruit .
41004020	And there are those who are sown upon good soil , who hear the word and accept it ; and these bear fruit : some thirty , some sixty , and some one hundred . ”
41004021	And he said to them : “ Would someone enter with a lamp in order to place it under a basket or under a bed ? Would it not be placed upon a lampstand ?
41004022	For there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed . Neither was anything done in secret , except that it may be made public .
41004023	If anyone has ears to hear , let him hear . ”
41004024	And he said to them : “ Consider what you hear . With whatever measure you have measured out , it shall be measured back to you , and more shall be added to you .
41004025	For whoever has , to him it shall be given . And whoever has not , from him even what he has shall be taken away . ”
41004026	And he said : “ The kingdom of God is like this : it is as if a man were to cast seed on the land .
41004027	And he sleeps and he arises , night and day . And the seed germinates and grows , though he does not know it .
41004028	For the earth bears fruit readily : first the plant , then the ear , next the full grain in the ear .
41004029	And when the fruit has been produced , immediately he sends out the sickle , because the harvest has arrived . ”
41004030	And he said : “ To what should we compare the kingdom of God ? Or to what parable should we compare it ?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard seed which , when it has been sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds which are in the earth .
41004032	And when it is sown , it grows up and becomes greater than all the plants , and it produces great branches , so much so that the birds of the air are able to live under its shadow . ”
41004033	And with many such parables he spoke the word to them , as much as they were able to hear .
41004034	But he did not speak to them without a parable . Yet separately , he explained all things to his disciples .
41004035	And on that day , when evening had arrived , he said to them , “ Let us cross over . ”
41004036	And dismissing the crowd , they brought him , so that he was in one boat , and other boats were with him .
41004037	And a great wind storm occurred , and the waves broke over the boat , so that the boat was being filled .
41004038	And he was in the stern of the boat , sleeping on a pillow . And they woke him and said to him , “ Teacher , does it not concern you that we are perishing ? ”
41004039	And rising up , he rebuked the wind , and he said to the sea : “ Silence . Be stilled . ” And the wind ceased . And a great tranquility occurred .
41004040	And he said to them : “ Why are you afraid ? Do you still lack faith ? ”
41004041	And they were struck with a great fear . And they said to one another , “ Who do you think this is , that both wind and sea obey him ? ”
41005001	And they went across the strait of the sea into the region of the Gerasenes .
41005002	And as he was departing from the boat , he was immediately met , from among the tombs , by a man with an unclean spirit ,
41005003	who had his dwelling place with the tombs ; neither had anyone been able to bind him , even with chains .
41005004	For having been bound often with shackles and chains , he had broken the chains and smashed the shackles ; and no one had been able to tame him .
41005005	And he was always , day and night , among the tombs , or in the mountains , crying out and cutting himself with stones .
41005006	And seeing Jesus from afar , he ran and adored him .
41005007	And crying out with a loud voice , he said : “ What am I to you , Jesus , the Son of the Most High God ? I beseech you by God , that you not torment me . ”
41005008	For he said to him , “ Depart from the man , you unclean spirit . ”
41005009	And he questioned him : “ What is your name ? ” And he said to him , “ My name is Legion , for we are many . ”
41005010	And he entreated him greatly , so that he would not expel him from the region .
41005011	And in that place , near the mountain , there was a great herd of swine , feeding .
41005012	And the spirits entreated him , saying : “ Send us into the swine , so that we may enter into them . ”
41005013	And Jesus promptly gave them permission . And the unclean spirits , departing , entered into the swine . And the herd of about two thousand rushed down with great force into the sea , and they were drowned in the sea .
41005014	Then those who pastured them fled , and they reported it in the city and in the countryside . And they all went out to see what was happening .
41005015	And they came to Jesus . And they saw the man who had been troubled by the demon , sitting , clothed and with a sane mind , and they were afraid .
41005016	And those who had seen it explained to them how he had dealt with the man who had the demon , and about the swine .
41005017	And they began to petition him , so that he would withdraw from their borders .
41005018	And as he was climbing into the boat , the man who had been troubled by the demons began to beg him , so that he might be with him .
41005019	And he did not permit him , but he said to him , “ Go to your own people , in your own house , and announce to them how great are the things that Lord has done for you , and how he has taken pity on you . ”
41005020	And he went away and began to preach in the Ten Cities , how great were the things that Jesus had done for him . And everyone wondered .
41005021	And when Jesus had crossed in the boat , over the strait again , a great crowd came together before him . And he was near the sea .
41005022	And one of the rulers of the synagogue , named Jairus , approached . And seeing him , he fell prostrate at his feet .
41005023	And he beseeched him greatly , saying : “ For my daughter is near the end . Come and lay your hand on her , so that she may be healthy and may live . ”
41005024	And he went with him . And a great crowd followed him , and they pressed upon him .
41005025	And there was a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years .
41005026	And she had endured much from several physicians , and she had spent everything she owned with no benefit at all , but instead she became worse .
41005027	Then , when she had heard of Jesus , she approached through the crowd behind him , and she touched his garment .
41005028	For she said : “ Because if I touch even his garment , I will be saved . ”
41005029	And immediately , the source of her bleeding was dried up , and she sensed in her body that she had been healed from the wound .
41005030	And immediately Jesus , realizing within himself that power that had gone out from him , turning to the crowd , said , “ Who touched my garments ? ”
41005031	And his disciples said to him , “ You see that the crowd presses around you , and yet you say , ‘ Who touched me ? ’ ”
41005032	And he looked around to see the woman who had done this .
41005033	Yet truly , the woman , in fear and trembling , knowing what had happened within her , went and fell prostrate before him , and she told him the whole truth .
41005034	And he said to her : “ Daughter , your faith has saved you . Go in peace , and be healed from your wound . ”
41005035	While he was still speaking , they arrived from the ruler of the synagogue , saying : “ Your daughter is dead . Why trouble the Teacher any further ? ”
41005036	But Jesus , having heard the word that was spoken , said to the ruler of the synagogue : “ Do not be afraid . You need only believe . ”
41005037	And he would not permit anyone to follow him , except Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
41005038	And they went to the house of the ruler of the synagogue . And he saw a tumult , and weeping , and much wailing .
41005039	And entering , he said to them : “ Why are you disturbed and weeping ? The girl is not dead , but is asleep . ”
41005040	And they derided him . Yet truly , having put them all out , he took the father and mother of the girl , and those who were with him , and he entered to where the girl was lying .
41005041	And taking the girl by the hand , he said to her , “ Talitha koumi , ” which means , “ Little girl , ( I say to you ) arise .
41005042	And immediately the young girl rose up and walked . Now she was twelve years old . And they were suddenly struck with a great astonishment .
41005043	And he instructed them sternly , so that no one would know about it . And he told them to give her something to eat .
41006001	And departing from there , he went away to his own country ; and his disciples followed him .
41006002	And when the Sabbath arrived , he began to teach in the synagogue . And many , upon hearing him , were amazed at his doctrine , saying : “ Where did this one get all these things ? ” and , “ What is this wisdom , which has been given to him ? ” and , “ Such powerful deeds , which are wrought by his hands ! ”
41006003	“ Is this not the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joseph , and Jude , and Simon ? Are not his sisters also here with us ? ” And they took great offense at him .
41006004	And Jesus said to them , “ A prophet is not without honor , except in his own country , and in his own house , and among his own kindred . ”
41006005	And he was not able to perform any miracles there , except that he cured a few of the infirm by laying his hands on them .
41006006	And he wondered , because of their unbelief , and he traveled around in the villages , teaching .
41006007	And he called the twelve . And he began to send them out in twos , and he gave them authority over unclean spirits .
41006008	And he instructed them not to take anything for the journey , except a staff : no traveling bag , no bread , and no money belt ,
41006009	but to wear sandals , and not to wear two tunics .
41006010	And he said to them : “ Whenever you have entered into a house , stay there until you depart from that place .
41006011	And whoever will neither receive you , nor listen to you , as you go away from there , shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against them . ”
41006012	And going out , they were preaching , so that people would repent .
41006013	And they cast out many demons , and they anointed many of the sick with oil and healed them .
41006014	And king Herod heard of it , ( for his name had become well-known ) and he said : “ John the Baptist has risen again from the dead , and because of this , miracles are at work in him . ”
41006015	But others were saying , “ Because it is Elijah . ” Still others were saying , “ Because he is a prophet , like one of the prophets . ”
41006016	When Herod had heard it , he said , “ John whom I beheaded , the same has risen again from the dead . ”
41006017	For Herod himself had sent to capture John , and had chained him in prison , because of Herodias , the wife of his brother Philip ; for he had married her .
41006018	For John was saying to Herod , “ It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife . ”
41006019	Now Herodias was devising treachery against him ; and she wanted to kill him , but she was unable .
41006020	For Herod was apprehensive of John , knowing him to be a just and holy man , and so he guarded him . And he heard that he was accomplishing many things , and so he listened to him willingly .
41006021	And when an opportune time had arrived , Herod held a feast on his birthday , with the leaders , and the tribunes , and the first rulers of Galilee .
41006022	And when the daughter of the same Herodias had entered , and danced , and pleased Herod , along with those who were at table with him , the king said to the girl , “ Request from me whatever you want , and I will give it to you . ”
41006023	And he swore to her , “ Anything that you request , I will give to you , even up to half my kingdom . ”
41006024	And when she had gone out , she said to her mother , “ What shall I request ? ” But her mother said , “ The head of John the Baptist . ”
41006025	And immediately , when she had entered with haste to the king , she petitioned him , saying : “ I want you to give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter . ”
41006026	And the king was greatly saddened . But because of his oath , and because of those who were sitting with him at table , he was not willing to disappoint her .
41006027	So , having sent an executioner , he instructed that his head be brought on a platter .
41006028	And he beheaded him in prison , and he brought his head on a platter . And he gave it to the girl , and the girl gave it her mother .
41006029	When his disciples heard about it , they came and took his body , and they placed it in a tomb .
41006030	And the Apostles , returning to Jesus , reported to him everything that they had done and taught .
41006031	And he said to them , “ Go out alone , into a deserted place , and rest for a little while . ” For there were so many who were coming and going , that they did not even have time to eat .
41006032	And climbing into a boat , they went away to a deserted place alone .
41006033	And they saw them going away , and many knew about it . And together they ran by foot from all the cities , and they arrived before them .
41006034	And Jesus , going out , saw a great multitude . And he took pity on them , because they were like sheep without a shepherd , and he began to teach them many things .
41006035	And when many hours had now passed , his disciples drew near to him , saying : “ This is a deserted place , and the hour is now late .
41006036	Send them away , so that by going out to nearby villages and towns , they might buy provisions for themselves to eat . ”
41006037	And responding , he said to them , “ Give them something to eat yourselves . ” And they said to him , “ Let us go out and buy bread for two hundred denarii , and then we will give them something to eat . ”
41006038	And he said to them : “ How many loaves do you have ? Go and see . ” And when they had found out , they said , “ Five , and two fish . ”
41006039	And he instructed them to make them all sit down in groups on the green grass .
41006040	And they sat down in divisions by hundreds and by fifties .
41006041	And having received the five loaves and the two fish , gazing up to heaven , he blessed and broke the bread , and he gave it to his disciples to set before them . And the two fish he divided among them all .
41006042	And they all ate and were satisfied .
41006043	And they brought together the remainder : twelve baskets full of fragments and of fish .
41006044	Now those who ate were five thousand men .
41006045	And without delay he urged his disciples to climb into the boat , so that they might precede him across the sea to Bethsaida , while he dismissed the people .
41006046	And when he had dismissed them , he went to the mountain to pray .
41006047	And when it was late , the boat was in the midst of the sea , and he was alone on the land .
41006048	And seeing them struggling to row , ( for the wind was against them , ) and about the fourth watch of the night , he came to them , walking upon the sea . And he intended to pass by them .
41006049	But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they thought it was an apparition , and they cried out .
41006050	For they all saw him , and they were very disturbed . And immediately he spoke with them , and he said to them : “ Be strengthened in faith . It is I . Do not be afraid . ”
41006051	And he climbed into the boat with them , and the wind ceased . And they became even more astonished within themselves .
41006052	For they did not understand about the bread . For their heart had been blinded .
41006053	And when they had crossed over , they arrived in the land of Genesaret , and they reached the shore .
41006054	And when they had disembarked from the boat , the people immediately recognized him .
41006055	And running throughout that entire region , they began to carry on beds those who had maladies , to where they heard that he would be .
41006056	And in whichever place he entered , in towns or villages or cities , they placed the infirm in the main streets , and they pleaded with him that they might touch even the hem of his garment . And as many as touched him were made healthy .
41007001	And the Pharisees and some of the scribes , arriving from Jerusalem , gathered together before him .
41007002	And when they had seen certain ones from his disciples eating bread with common hands , that is , with unwashed hands , they disparaged them .
41007003	For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , do not eat without repeatedly washing their hands , holding to the tradition of the elders .
41007004	And when returning from the market , unless they wash , they do not eat . And there are many other things which have been handed down to them to observe : the washings of cups , and pitchers , and bronze containers , and beds .
41007005	And so the Pharisees and the scribes questioned him : “ Why do your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders , but they eat bread with common hands ? ”
41007006	But in response , he said to them : “ So well did Isaiah prophesy about you hypocrites , just as it has been written : ‘ This people honors me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
41007007	And in vain do they worship me , teaching the doctrines and precepts of men . ’
41007008	For abandoning the commandment of God , you hold to the tradition of men , to the washing of pitchers and cups . And you do many other things similar to these . ”
41007009	And he said to them : “ You effectively nullify the precept of God , so that you may observe your own tradition .
41007010	For Moses said : ‘ Honor your father and your mother , ’ and , ‘ Whoever will have cursed father or mother , let him die a death . ’
41007011	But you say , ‘ If a man will have said to his father or mother : Korban , ( which is a gift ) whatever is from me will be to your benefit , ’
41007012	then you do not release him to do anything for his father or mother ,
41007013	rescinding the word of God through your tradition , which you have handed down . And you do many other similar things in this way . ”
41007014	And again , calling the crowd to him , he said to them : “ Listen to me , all of you , and understand .
41007015	There is nothing from outside a man which , by entering into him , is able to defile him . But the things which procede from a man , these are what pollute a man .
41007016	Whoever has ears to hear , let him hear . ”
41007017	And when he had entered into the house , away from the crowd , his disciples questioned him about the parable .
41007018	And he said to them : “ So , are you also without prudence ? Do you not understand that everything entering to a man from outside is not able to pollute him ?
41007019	For it does not enter into his heart , but into the gut , and it exits into the sewer , purging all foods . ”
41007020	“ But , ” he said “ the things which go out from a man , these pollute a man .
41007021	For from within , from the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
41007022	thefts , avarice , wickedness , deceitfulness , homosexuality , an evil eye , blasphemy , self-exaltation , foolishness .
41007023	All these evils procede from within and pollute a man . ”
41007024	And rising up , he went from there to the area of Tyre and Sidon . And entering into a house , he intended no one to know about it , but he was not able to remain hidden .
41007025	For a woman whose daughter had an unclean spirit , as soon as she heard about him , entered and fell prostrate at his feet .
41007026	For the woman was a Gentile , by birth a Syro-Phoenician . And she petitioned him , so that he would cast the demon from her daughter .
41007027	And he said to her : “ First allow the sons to have their fill . For it is not good to take away the bread of the sons and throw it to the dogs . ”
41007028	But she responded by saying to him : “ Certainly , Lord . Yet the young dogs also eat , under the table , from the crumbs of the children . ”
41007029	And he said to her , “ Because of this saying , go ; the demon has gone out of your daughter . ”
41007030	And when she had gone to her house , she found the girl lying on the bed ; and the demon had gone away .
41007031	And again , departing from the borders of Tyre , he went by way of Sidon to the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the area of the Ten Cities .
41007032	And they brought someone who was deaf and mute to him . And they begged him , so that he would lay his hand upon him .
41007033	And taking him away from the crowd , he put his fingers into his ears ; and spitting , he touched his tongue .
41007034	And gazing up to heaven , he groaned and said to him : “ Ephphatha , ” which is , “ Be opened . ”
41007035	And immediately his ears were opened , and the impediment of his tongue was released , and he spoke correctly .
41007036	And he instructed them not to tell anyone . But as much as he instructed them , so much more did they preach about it .
41007037	And so much more did they wonder , saying : “ He has done all things well . He has caused both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak . ”
41008001	In those days , again , when there was a great crowd , and they did not have anything to eat , calling together his disciples , he said to them :
41008002	“ I have compassion for the multitude , because , behold , they have persevered with me now for three days , and they do not have anything to eat .
41008003	And if I were to send them away fasting to their home , they might faint on the way . ” For some of them came from far away .
41008004	And his disciples answered him , “ From where would anyone be able to obtain enough bread for them in the wilderness ? ”
41008005	And he questioned them , “ How many loaves do you have ? ” And they said , “ Seven . ”
41008006	And he instructed the crowd to sit down to eat on the ground . And taking the seven loaves , giving thanks , he broke and gave it to his disciples in order to place before them . And they placed these before the crowd .
41008007	And they had a few small fish . And he blessed them , and he ordered them to be placed before them .
41008008	And they ate and were satisfied . And they took up what had been leftover from the fragments : seven baskets .
