44007034	Certainly , I have seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt , and I have heard their groaning . And so , I am coming down to free them . And now , go forth and I will send you into Egypt . ’
44007035	This Moses , whom they rejected by saying , ‘ Who has appointed you as leader and judge ? ’ is the one God sent to be leader and redeemer , by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush .
44007036	This man led them out , accomplishing signs and wonders in the land of Egypt , and at the Red Sea , and in the desert , for forty years .
44007037	This is Moses , who said to the sons of Israel : ‘ God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your own brothers . You shall listen to him . ’
44007038	This is he who was in the Church in the wilderness , with the Angel who was speaking to him on Mount Sinai , and with our fathers . It is he who received the words of life to give to us .
44007039	It is he whom our fathers were not willing to obey . Instead , they rejected him , and in their hearts they turned away toward Egypt ,
44007040	saying to Aaron : ‘ Make gods for us , which may go before us . For this Moses , who led us away from the land of Egypt , we do not know what has happened to him . ’
44007041	And so they fashioned a calf in those days , and they offered sacrifices to an idol , and they rejoiced in the works of their own hands .
44007042	Then God turned , and he handed them over , to subservience to the armies of heaven , just as it was written in the Book of the Prophets : ‘ Did you not offer victims and sacrifices to me for forty years in the desert , O house of Israel ?
44007043	And yet you took up for yourselves the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan , figures which you yourselves formed in order to adore them . And so I will carry you away , beyond Babylon . ’
44007044	The tabernacle of the testimony was with our fathers in the desert , just as God ordained for them , speaking to Moses , so that he would make it according to the form that he had seen .
44007045	But our fathers , receiving it , also brought it , with Joshua , into the land of the Gentiles , whom God expelled before the face of our fathers , even until the days of David ,
44007046	who found grace before God and who asked that he might obtain a tabernacle for the God of Jacob .
44007047	But it was Solomon who built a house for him .
44007048	Yet the Most High does not live in houses built by hands , just as he said through the prophet :
44007049	‘ Heaven is my throne , and the earth is my footstool . What kind of house would you build for me ? says the Lord . And which is my resting place ?
44007050	Has not my hand made all these things ? ’
44007051	Stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears , you ever resist the Holy Spirit . Just as your fathers did , so also do you do .
44007052	Which of the Prophets have your fathers not persecuted ? And they killed those who foretold the advent of the Just One . And you have now become the betrayers and murderers of him .
44007053	You received the law by the actions of Angels , and yet you have not kept it . ”
44007054	Then , upon hearing these things , they were deeply wounded in their hearts , and they gnashed their teeth at him .
44007055	But he , being filled with the Holy Spirit , and gazing intently toward heaven , saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God .
44007056	And he said , “ Behold , I see the heavens opened , and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God . ”
44007057	Then they , crying out with a loud voice , blocked their ears and , with one accord , rushed violently toward him .
44007058	And driving him out , beyond the city , they stoned him . And witnesses placed their garments beside the feet of a youth , who was called Saul .
44007059	And as they were stoning Stephen , he called out and said , “ Lord Jesus , receive my spirit . ”
44007060	Then , having been brought to his knees , he cried out with a loud voice , saying , “ Lord , do not hold this sin against them . ” And when he had said this , he fell asleep in the Lord . And Saul was consenting to his murder .
44008001	Now in those days , there occurred a great persecution against the Church at Jerusalem . And they were all dispersed throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria , except the Apostles .
44008002	But God-fearing men arranged for Stephen’s funeral , and they made a great mourning over him .
44008003	Then Saul was laying waste to the Church by entering throughout the houses , and dragging away men and women , and committing them to prison .
44008004	Therefore , those who had been dispersed were traveling around , evangelizing the Word of God .
44008005	Now Philip , descending to a city of Samaria , was preaching Christ to them .
44008006	And the crowd was listening intently and with one accord to those things which were being said by Philip , and they were watching the signs which he was accomplishing .
44008007	For many of them had unclean spirits , and , crying out with a loud voice , these departed from them .
44008008	And many of the paralytics and the lame were cured .
44008009	Therefore , there was great gladness in that city . Now there was a certain man named Simon , who formerly had been a magician in that city , seducing the people of Samaria , claiming himself to be someone great .
44008010	And to all those who would listen , from the least even to the greatest , he was saying : “ Here is the power of God , which is called great . ”
44008011	And they were attentive to him because , for a long time , he had deluded them with his magic .
44008012	Yet truly , once they had believed Philip , who was evangelizing the kingdom of God , both men and women were baptized in the name of Jesus Christ .
44008013	Then Simon himself also believed and , when he had been baptized , he adhered to Philip . And now , seeing also the greatest signs and miracles being wrought , he was amazed and stupefied .
44008014	Now when the Apostles who were in Jerusalem had heard that Samaria had received the Word of God , they sent Peter and John to them .
44008015	And when they had arrived , they prayed for them , so that they might receive the Holy Spirit .
44008016	For he had not yet come to any among them , since they were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44008017	Then they laid their hands on them , and they received the Holy Spirit .
44008018	But when Simon had seen that , by the imposition of the hands of the Apostles , the Holy Spirit was given , he offered them money ,
44008019	saying , “ Give this power to me also , so that on whomever I will lay my hands , he may receive the Holy Spirit . ” But Peter said to him :
44008020	“ Let your money be with you in perdition , for you have supposed that a gift of God might be possessed by money .
44008021	There is no part or place for you in this matter . For your heart is not upright in the sight of God .
44008022	And so , repent from this , your wickedness , and beg God , so that perhaps this plan of your heart might be forgiven you .
44008023	For I perceive you to be in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity . ”
44008024	Then Simon responded by saying , “ Pray for me to the Lord , so that nothing of what you have said may happen to me . ”
44008025	And indeed , after testifying and speaking the Word of the Lord , they returned to Jerusalem , and they evangelized the many regions of the Samaritans .
44008026	Now an Angel of the Lord spoke to Philip , saying , “ Rise up and go toward the south , to the way which descends from Jerusalem into Gaza , where there is a desert . ”
44008027	And rising up , he went . And behold , an Ethiopian man , a eunuch , powerful under Candace , the queen of the Ethiopians , who was over all her treasures , had arrived in Jerusalem to worship .
44008028	And while returning , he was sitting upon his chariot and reading from the prophet Isaiah .
44008029	Then the Spirit said to Philip , “ Draw near and join yourself to this chariot . ”
44008030	And Philip , hurrying , heard him reading from the prophet Isaiah , and he said , “ Do you think that you understand what you are reading ? ”
44008031	And he said , “ But how can I , unless someone will have revealed it to me ? ” And he asked Philip to climb up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the place in Scripture that he was reading was this : “ Like a sheep he was led to the slaughter . And like a lamb silent before his shearer , so he opened not his mouth .
44008033	He endured his judgment with humility . Who of his generation shall describe how his life was taken away from the earth ? ”
44008034	Then the eunuch responded to Philip , saying : “ I beg you , about whom is the prophet saying this ? About himself , or about someone else ? ”
44008035	Then Philip , opening his mouth and beginning from this Scripture , evangelized Jesus to him .
44008036	And while they were going along the way , they arrived at a certain water source . And the eunuch said : “ There is water . What would prevent me from being baptized ? ”
44008037	Then Philip said , “ If you believe from your whole heart , it is permitted . ” And he responded by saying , “ I believe the Son of God to be Jesus the Christ . ”
44008038	And he ordered the chariot to stand still . And both Philip and the eunuch descended into the water . And he baptized him .
44008039	And when they had ascended from the water , the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away , and the eunuch did not see him anymore . Then he went on his way , rejoicing .
44008040	Now Philip was found in Azotus . And continuing on , he evangelized all the cities , until he arrived in Caesarea .
44009001	Now Saul , still breathing threats and beatings against the disciples of the Lord , went to the high priest ,
44009002	and he petitioned him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus , so that , if he found any men or women belonging to this Way , he could lead them as prisoners to Jerusalem .
44009003	And as he made the journey , it happened that he was approaching Damascus . And suddenly , a light from heaven shone around him .
44009004	And falling to the ground , he heard a voice saying to him , “ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ”
44009005	And he said , “ Who are you , Lord ? ” And he : “ I am Jesus , whom you are persecuting . It is hard for you to kick against the goad . ”
44009006	And he , trembling and astonished , said , “ Lord , what do you want me to do ? ”
44009007	And the Lord said to him , “ Rise up and go into the city , and there you will be told what you ought to do . ” Now the men who were accompanying him were standing stupefied , hearing indeed a voice , but seeing no one .
44009008	Then Saul rose up from the ground . And upon opening his eyes , he saw nothing . So leading him by the hand , they brought him into Damascus .
44009009	And in that place , he was without sight for three days , and he neither ate nor drank .
44009010	Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus , named Ananias . And the Lord said to him in a vision , “ Ananias ! ” And he said , “ Here I am , Lord . ”
44009011	And the Lord said to him : “ Rise up and go into the street that is called Straight , and seek , in the house of Judas , the one named Saul of Tarsus . For behold , he is praying . ”
44009012	( And Paul saw a man named Ananias entering and imposing hands upon him , so that he might receive his sight . )
44009013	But Ananias responded : “ Lord , I have heard from many about this man , how much harm he has done to your saints in Jerusalem .
44009014	And he has authority here from the leaders of the priests to bind all who invoke your name . ”
44009015	Then the Lord said to him : “ Go , for this one is an instrument chosen by me to convey my name before nations and kings and the sons of Israel .
44009016	For I will reveal to him how much he must suffer on behalf of my name . ”
44009017	And Ananias departed . And he entered the house . And laying his hands upon him , he said : “ Brother Saul , the Lord Jesus , he who appeared to you on the way by which you arrived , sent me so that you would receive your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit . ”
44009018	And immediately , it was as if scales had fallen from his eyes , and he received his sight . And rising up , he was baptized .
44009019	And when he had taken a meal , he was strengthened . Now he was with the disciples who were at Damascus for some days .
44009020	And he was continuously preaching Jesus in the synagogues : that he is the Son of God .
44009021	And all who heard him were astonished , and they said , “ Is this not the one who , in Jerusalem , was fighting against those invoking this name , and who came here for this : so that he might lead them away to the leaders of the priests ? ”
44009022	But Saul was increasing to a greater extent in ability , and so he was confounding the Jews who lived at Damascus , by affirming that he is the Christ .
44009023	And when many days were completed , the Jews took counsel as one , so that they might put him to death .
44009024	But their treachery became known to Saul . Now they were also watching the gates , day and night , so that they might put him to death .
44009025	But the disciples , taking him away by night , sent him over the wall by letting him down in a basket .
44009026	And when he had arrived in Jerusalem , he attempted to join himself to the disciples . And they were all afraid of him , not believing that he was a disciple .
44009027	But Barnabas took him aside and led him to the Apostles . And he explained to them how he had seen the Lord , and that he had spoken to him , and how , in Damascus , he had acted faithfully in the name of Jesus .
44009028	And he was with them , entering and departing Jerusalem , and acting faithfully in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He also was speaking with the Gentiles and disputing with the Greeks . But they were seeking to kill him .
44009030	And when the brothers had realized this , they brought him to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus .
44009031	Certainly , the Church had peace throughout all of Judea and Galilee and Samaria , and it was being built up , while walking in the fear of the Lord , and it was being filled with the consolation of the Holy Spirit .
44009032	Then it happened that Peter , as he traveled around everywhere , came to the saints who were living at Lydda .
44009033	But he found there a certain man , named Aeneas , who was a paralytic , who had lain in bed for eight years .
44009034	And Peter said to him : “ Aeneas , the Lord Jesus Christ heals you . Rise up and arrange your bed . ” And immediately he rose up .
44009035	And all who were living in Lydda and Sharon saw him , and they were converted to the Lord .
44009036	Now in Joppa there was a certain disciple named Tabitha , which in translation is called Dorcas . She was filled with the good works and almsgiving that she was accomplishing .
44009037	And it happened that , in those days , she became ill and died . And when they had washed her , they laid her in an upper room .
44009038	Now since Lydda was close to Joppa , the disciples , upon hearing that Peter was there , sent two men to him , asking him : “ Do not be slow in coming to us . ”
44009039	Then Peter , rising up , went with them . And when he had arrived , they led him to an upper room . And all the widows were standing around him , weeping and showing him the tunics and garments that Dorcas had made for them .
44009040	And when they had all been sent outside , Peter , kneeling down , prayed . And turning to the body , he said : “ Tabitha , arise . ” And she opened her eyes and , upon seeing Peter , sat up again .
44009041	And offering her his hand , he lifted her up . And when he had called in the saints and the widows , he presented her alive .
44009042	Now this became known throughout all of Joppa . And many believed in the Lord .
44009043	And it happened that he resided for many days in Joppa , with a certain Simon , a tanner .
44010001	Now there was a certain man in Caesarea , named Cornelius , a centurion of the cohort which is called Italian ,
44010002	a devout man , fearing God with all his house , giving many alms to the people , and praying to God continually .
44010003	This man saw in a vision clearly , at about the ninth hour of the day , the Angel of God entering to him and saying to him : “ Cornelius ! ”
44010004	And he , gazing at him , was seized by fear , and he said , “ What is it , lord ? ” And he said to him : “ Your prayers and your almsgiving have ascended as a memorial in the sight of God .
44010005	And now , send men to Joppa and summon a certain Simon , who is surnamed Peter .
44010006	This man is a guest with a certain Simon , a tanner , whose house is beside the sea . He will tell you what you must do . ”
44010007	And when the Angel who was speaking to him had departed , he called , out of those who were subject to him , two of his household servants and a soldier who feared the Lord .
44010008	And when he had explained everything to them , he sent them to Joppa .
44010009	Then , on the following day , while they were making the journey and approaching the city , Peter ascended to the upper rooms , so that he might pray , at about the sixth hour .
44010010	And since he was hungry , he wanted to enjoy some food . Then , as they were preparing it , an ecstasy of mind fell over him .
44010011	And he saw heaven opened , and a certain container descending , as if a great linen sheet were let down , by its four corners , from heaven to earth ,
44010012	on which were all four-footed beasts , and the crawling things of the earth and the flying things of the air .
44010013	And a voice came to him : “ Rise up , Peter ! Kill and eat . ”
44010014	But Peter said : “ Far be it from me , lord . For I have never eaten anything common or unclean . ”
44010015	And the voice , again a second time to him : “ What God has purified , you shall not call common . ”
44010016	Now this was done three times . And immediately the container was taken up to heaven .
44010017	Now while Peter was still hesitant within himself as to what the vision , which he had seen , might mean , behold , the men who had been sent from Cornelius stood at the gate , inquiring about Simon’s house .
44010018	And when they had called out , they asked if Simon , who is surnamed Peter , was a guest in that place .
44010019	Then , as Peter was thinking about the vision , the Spirit said to him , “ Behold , three men seek you .
44010020	And so , rise up , descend , and go with them , doubting nothing . For I have sent them . ”
44010021	Then Peter , descending to the men , said : “ Behold , I am the one whom you seek . What is the reason for which you have arrived ? ”
44010022	And they said : “ Cornelius , a centurion , a just and God-fearing man , who has good testimony from the entire nation of the Jews , received a message from a holy Angel to summon you to his house and to listen to words from you . ”
44010023	Therefore , leading them in , he received them as guests . Then , on following the day , rising up , he set out with them . And some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him .
44010024	And on the next day , he entered Caesarea . And truly , Cornelius was waiting for them , having called together his family and closest friends .
44010025	And it happened that , when Peter had entered , Cornelius went to meet him . And falling before his feet , he reverenced .
44010026	Yet truly , Peter , lifting him up , said : “ Rise up , for I also am only a man . ”
44010027	And speaking with him , he entered , and he found many who had gathered together .
44010028	And he said to them : “ You know how abominable it would be for a Jewish man to be joined with , or to be added to , a foreign people . But God has revealed to me to call no man common or unclean .
44010029	Because of this and without doubt , I came when summoned . Therefore , I ask you , for what reason have you summoned me ? ”
44010030	And Cornelius said : “ It is now the fourth day , to this very hour , since I was praying in my house at the ninth hour , and behold , a man stood before me in a white vestment , and he said :
44010031	‘ Cornelius , your prayer has been heard and your almsgiving has been remembered in the sight of God .
44010032	Therefore , send to Joppa and summon Simon , who is surnamed Peter . This man is a guest in the house of Simon , a tanner , near the sea . ’
44010033	And so , I promptly sent for you . And you have done well in coming here . Therefore , all of us are now present in your sight to hear all the things that were taught to you by the Lord . ”
44010034	Then , Peter , opening his mouth , said : “ I have concluded in truth that God is not a respecter of persons .
44010035	But within every nation , whoever fears him and works justice is acceptable to him .
44010036	God sent the Word to the sons of Israel , announcing the peace through Jesus Christ , for he is the Lord of all .
44010037	You know that the Word has been made known throughout all Judea . For beginning from Galilee , after the baptism which John preached ,
44010038	Jesus of Nazareth , whom God anointed with the Holy Spirit and with power , traveled around doing good and healing all those oppressed by the devil . For God was with him .
44010039	And we are witnesses of all that he did in the region of Judea and in Jerusalem , he whom they killed by hanging him on a tree .
44010040	God raised him up on the third day and permitted him to be made manifest ,
44010041	not to all the people , but to the witnesses preordained by God , to those of us who ate and drank with him after he rose again from the dead .
44010042	And he instructed us to preach to the people , and to testify that he is the One who was appointed by God to be the judge of the living and of the dead .
44010043	To him all the Prophets offer testimony that through his name all who believe in him receive the remission of sins . ”
44010044	While Peter was still speaking these words , the Holy Spirit fell over all of those who were listening to the Word .
44010045	And the faithful of the circumcision , who had arrived with Peter , were astonished that the grace of the Holy Spirit was also poured out upon the Gentiles .
44010046	For they heard them speaking in tongues and magnifying God .
44010047	Then Peter responded , “ How could anyone prohibit water , so that those who have received the Holy Spirit would not be baptized , just as we also have been ? ”
44010048	And he ordered them to be baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ . Then they begged him to remain with them for some days .
44011001	Now the Apostles and brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the Word of God .
44011002	Then , when Peter had gone up to Jerusalem , those who were of the circumcision argued against him ,
44011003	saying , “ Why did you enter to uncircumcised men , and why did you eat with them ? ”
44011004	And Peter began to explain to them , in an orderly manner , saying :
44011005	“ I was in the city of Joppa praying , and I saw , in an ecstasy of mind , a vision : a certain container descending , like a great linen sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners . And it drew near to me .
44011006	And looking into it , I considered and saw the four-footed beasts of the earth , and the wild beasts , and the reptiles , and the flying things of the air .
44011007	Then I also heard a voice saying to me : ‘ Rise up , Peter . Kill and eat . ’
44011008	But I said : ‘ Never , lord ! For what is common or unclean has never entered into my mouth . ’
44011009	Then the voice responded a second time from heaven , ‘ What God has cleansed , you shall not call common . ’
44011010	Now this was done three times . And then everything was taken up again into heaven .
44011011	And behold , immediately there were three men standing near the house where I was , having been sent to me from Caesarea .
44011012	Then the Spirit told me that I should go with them , doubting nothing . And these six brothers went with me also . And we entered into the house of the man .
44011013	And he described for us how he had seen an Angel in his house , standing and saying to him : ‘ Send to Joppa and summon Simon , who is surnamed Peter .
44011014	And he shall speak to you words , by which you shall be saved with your whole house . ’
44011015	And when I had begun to speak , the Holy Spirit fell upon them , just as upon us also , in the beginning .
44011016	Then I remembered the words of the Lord , just as he himself said : ‘ John , indeed , baptized with water , but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	Therefore , if God gave them the same grace , as also to us , who have believed in the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I , that I would be able to prohibit God ? ”
44011018	Having heard these things , they were silent . And they glorified God , saying : “ So has God also given to the Gentiles repentance unto life . ”
44011019	And some of them , having been dispersed by the persecution that had occurred under Stephen , traveled around , even to Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch , speaking the Word to no one , except to Jews only .
44011020	But some of these men from Cyprus and Cyrene , when they had entered into Antioch , were speaking also to the Greeks , announcing the Lord Jesus .
44011021	And the hand of the Lord was with them . And a great number believed and were converted to the Lord .
44011022	Now the news came to the ears of the Church at Jerusalem about these things , and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch .
44011023	And when he had arrived there and had seen the grace of God , he was gladdened . And he exhorted them all to continue in the Lord with a resolute heart .
44011024	For he was a good man , and he was filled with the Holy Spirit and with faith . And a great multitude was added to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas set out for Tarsus , so that he might seek Saul . And when he had found him , he brought him to Antioch .
44011026	And they were conversing there in the Church for an entire year . And they taught such a great multitude , that it was at Antioch that the disciples were first known by the name of Christian .
44011027	Now in these days , prophets from Jerusalem went over to Antioch .
44011028	And one of them , named Agabus , rising up , signified through the Spirit that there was going to be a great famine over the entire world , which did happen under Claudius .
44011029	Then the disciples declared , according to what each one possessed , what they would offer to be sent to the brothers living in Judea .
44011030	And so they did , sending it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	Now at the same time , king Herod extended his hand , in order to afflict some from the Church .
44012002	Then he killed James , the brother of John , with the sword .
44012003	And seeing that it pleased the Jews , he set out next to apprehend Peter also . Now it was the days of Unleavened Bread .
44012004	So when he had apprehended him , he sent him into prison , handing him over into the custody of four groups of four soldiers , intending to produce him to the people after the Passover .
44012005	And so Peter was detained in prison . But prayers were being made without ceasing , by the Church , to God on his behalf .
44012006	And when Herod was ready to produce him , in that same night , Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , and was bound with two chains . And there were guards in front of the door , guarding the prison .
44012007	And behold , an Angel of the Lord stood near , and a light shined forth in the cell . And tapping Peter on the side , he awakened him , saying , “ Rise up , quickly . ” And the chains fell from his hands .
44012008	Then the Angel said to him : “ Dress yourself , and put on your boots . ” And he did so . And he said to him , “ Wrap your garment around yourself and follow me . ”
44012009	And going out , he followed him . And he did not know this truth : that this was being done by an Angel . For he thought that he was seeing a vision .
44012010	And passing by the first and second guards , they came to the iron gate which leads into the city ; and it opened for them by itself . And departing , they continued on along a certain side street . And suddenly the Angel withdrew from him .
44012011	And Peter , returning to himself , said : “ Now I know , truly , that the Lord sent his Angel , and that he rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the people of the Jews were anticipating . ”
44012012	And as he was considering this , he arrived at the house of Mary , the mother of John , who was surnamed Mark , where many were gathered and were praying .
44012013	Then , as he knocked at the door of the gate , a girl went out to answer , whose name was Rhoda .
44012014	And when she recognized the voice of Peter , out of joy , she did not open the gate , but instead , running in , she reported that Peter stood before the gate .
44012015	But they said to her , “ You are crazy . ” But she reaffirmed that this was so . Then they were saying , “ It is his angel . ”
44012016	But Peter was persevering in knocking . And when they had opened , they saw him and were astonished .
44012017	But motioning to them with his hand to be silent , he explained how the Lord had led him away from prison . And he said , “ Inform James and those brothers . ” And going out , he went away to another place .
44012018	Then , when daylight came , there was no small commotion among the soldiers , as to what had happened concerning Peter .
44012019	And when Herod had requested him and did not obtain him , having had the guards interrogated , he ordered them led away . And descending from Judea into Caesarea , he lodged there .
44012020	Now he was angry with those of Tyre and Sidon . But they came to him with one accord , and , having persuaded Blastus , who was over the bedchamber of the king , they petitioned for peace , because their regions were supplied with food by him .
44012021	Then , on the appointed day , Herod was clothed in kingly apparel , and he sat in the judgment seat , and he gave a speech to them .
44012022	Then the people were crying out , “ The voice of a god , and not of a man ! ”
44012023	And immediately , an Angel of the Lord struck him down , because he had not given honor to God . And having been consumed by worms , he expired .
44012024	But the word of the Lord was increasing and multiplying .
44012025	Then Barnabas and Saul , having completed the ministry , returned from Jerusalem , bringing with them John , who was surnamed Mark .
44013001	Now there were , in the Church at Antioch , prophets and teachers , among whom were Barnabas , and Simon , who was called the Black , and Lucius of Cyrene , and Manahen , who was the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch , and Saul .
44013002	Now as they were ministering for the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said to them : “ Separate Saul and Barnabas for me , for the work for which I have selected them . ”
44013003	Then , fasting and praying and imposing their hands upon them , they sent them away .
44013004	And having been sent by the Holy Spirit , they went to Seleucia . And from there they sailed to Cyprus .
44013005	And when they had arrived at Salamis , they were preaching the Word of God in the synagogues of the Jews . And they also had John in the ministry .
44013006	And when they had traveled throughout the entire island , even to Paphos , they found a certain man , a magician , a false prophet , a Jew , whose name was Bar-Jesu .
44013007	And he was with the proconsul , Sergius Paulus , a prudent man . This man , summoning Barnabas and Saul , wanted to hear the Word of God .
44013008	But Elymas the magician ( for so his name is translated ) stood against them , seeking to turn the proconsul away from the Faith .
44013009	Then Saul , who is also called Paul , having been filled with the Holy Spirit , looked intently at him ,
44013010	and he said : “ So full of every deceit and of all falsehoods , son of the devil , enemy of all justice , you never cease to subvert the righteous ways of the Lord !
44013011	And now , behold , the hand of the Lord is upon you . And you will be blinded , not seeing the sun for a length of time . ” And immediately a fog and a darkness fell over him . And wandering around , he was seeking someone who might lead him by the hand .
44013012	Then the proconsul , when he had seen what was done , believed , being in wonder over the doctrine of the Lord .
44013013	And when Paul and those who were with him had sailed from Paphos , they arrived at Perga in Pamphylia . Then John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	Yet truly , they , traveling on from Perga , arrived at Antioch in Pisidia . And upon entering the synagogue on the Sabbath day , they sat down .
44013015	Then , after the reading from the Law and the Prophets , the leaders of the synagogue sent to them , saying : “ Noble brothers , if there is in you any word of exhortation to the people , speak . ”
44013016	Then Paul , rising up and motioning for silence with his hand , said : “ Men of Israel and you who fear God , listen closely .
44013017	The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers , and exalted the people , when they were settlers in the land of Egypt . And with an exalted arm , he led them away from there .
44013018	And throughout a time of forty years , he endured their behavior in the desert .
44013019	And by destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan , he divided their land among them by lot ,
44013020	after about four hundred and fifty years . And after these things , he gave them judges , even until the prophet Samuel .
44013021	And later on , they petitioned for a king . And God gave them Saul , the son of Kish , a man from the tribe of Benjamin , for forty years .
44013022	And having removed him , he raised up for them king David . And offering testimony about him , he said , ‘ I have found David , the son of Jesse , to be a man according to my own heart , who will accomplish all that I will . ’
44013023	From his offspring , according to the Promise , God has brought Jesus the Savior to Israel .
44013024	John was preaching , before the face of his advent , a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .
44013025	Then , when John completed his course , he was saying : ‘ I am not the one you consider me to be . For behold , one arrives after me , the shoes of whose feet I am not worthy to loosen . ’
44013026	Noble brothers , sons of the stock of Abraham , and those among you who fear God , it is to you the Word of this salvation has been sent .
44013027	For those who were living in Jerusalem , and its rulers , heeding neither him , nor the voices of the Prophets that are read on every Sabbath , fulfilled these by judging him .
44013028	And although they found no case for death against him , they petitioned Pilate , so that they might put him to death .
44013029	And when they had fulfilled everything that had been written about him , taking him down from the tree , they placed him in a tomb .
44013030	Yet truly , God raised him up from the dead on the third day .
44013031	And he was seen for many days by those who went up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who even now are his witnesses to the people .
44013032	And we are announcing to you that the Promise , which was made to our fathers ,
44013033	has been fulfilled by God for our children by raising up Jesus , just as it has been written in the second Psalm also : ‘ You are my Son . This day I have begotten you . ’
44013034	Now , since he raised him from the dead , so as to no longer return to corruption , he has said this : ‘ I will give to you the holy things of David , the faithful one . ’
44013035	And also then , in another place , he says : ‘ You will not allow your Holy One to see corruption . ’
44013036	For David , when he had ministered to his generation in accordance with the will of God , fell asleep , and he was placed next to his fathers , and he saw corruption .
44013037	Yet truly , he whom God has raised from the dead has not seen corruption .
44013038	Therefore , let it be known to you , noble brothers , that through him is announced to you remission from sins and from everything by which you were not able to be justified in the law of Moses .
44013039	In him , all who believe are justified .
44013040	Therefore , be careful , lest what was said by the Prophets may overwhelm you :
44013041	‘ You despisers ! Look , and wonder , and be scattered ! For I am working a deed in your days , a deed which you would not believe , even if someone were to explain it to you . ’ ”
44013042	Then , as they were departing , they asked them if , on the following Sabbath , they might speak these words to them .
44013043	And when the synagogue had been dismissed , many among the Jews and the new worshipers were following Paul and Barnabas . And they , speaking to them , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	Yet truly , on the following Sabbath , nearly the entire city came together to hear the Word of God .
44013045	Then the Jews , seeing the crowds , were filled with envy , and they , blaspheming , contradicted the things that were being said by Paul .
44013046	Then Paul and Barnabas said firmly : “ It was necessary to speak the Word of God first to you . But because you reject it , and so judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life , behold , we turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	For so has the Lord instructed us : ‘ I have set you as a light to the Gentiles , so that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth . ’ ”
44013048	Then the Gentiles , upon hearing this , were gladdened , and they were glorifying the Word of the Lord . And as many as believed were preordained to eternal life .
44013049	Now the word of the Lord was disseminated throughout the entire region .
44013050	But the Jews incited some devout and honest women , and the leaders of the city . And they stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas . And they drove them away from their parts .
44013051	But they , shaking the dust from their feet against them , went on to Iconium .
44013052	The disciples were likewise filled with gladness and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	Now it happened in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews , and they spoke in such a way that a copious multitude of both Jews and Greeks believed .
44014002	Yet truly , the Jews who were unbelieving had incited and enflamed the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers .
44014003	And so , they remained for a long time , acting faithfully in the Lord , offering testimony to the Word of his grace , providing signs and wonders done by their hands .
44014004	Then the multitude of the city was divided . And certainly , some were with the Jews , yet truly others were with the Apostles .
44014005	Now when an assault had been planned by the Gentiles and the Jews with their leaders , so that they might treat them with contempt and stone them ,
44014006	they , realizing this , fled together to Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and to the entire surrounding region .
44014007	And they were evangelizing in that place .
44014008	And a certain man was sitting at Lystra , disabled in his feet , lame from his mother’s womb , who had never walked .
44014009	This man heard Paul speaking . And Paul , gazing at him intently , and perceiving that he had faith , so that he might be healed ,
44014010	said with a loud voice , “ Stand upright upon your feet ! ” And he leaped up and walked around .
44014011	But when the crowds had seen what Paul had done , they lifted up their voice in the Lycaonian language , saying , “ The gods , having taken the likenesses of men , have descended to us ! ”
44014012	And they called Barnabas , ‘ Jupiter , ’ yet truly they called Paul , ‘ Mercury , ’ because he was the lead speaker .
44014013	Also , the priest of Jupiter , who was outside the city , in front of the gate , bringing in oxen and garlands , was willing to offer sacrifice with the people .
44014014	And as soon as the Apostles , Barnabas and Paul , had heard this , tearing their tunics , they leapt into the crowd , crying out
44014015	and saying : “ Men , why would you do this ? We also are mortals , men like yourselves , preaching to you to be converted , from these vain things , to the living God , who made heaven and earth and the sea and all that is in them .
44014016	In previous generations , he permitted all nations to walk in their own ways .
44014017	But certainly , he did not leave himself without testimony , doing good from heaven , giving rains and fruitful seasons , filling their hearts with food and gladness . ”
44014018	And by saying these things , they were barely able to restrain the crowds from immolating to them .
44014019	Now certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium arrived there . And having persuaded the crowd , they stoned Paul and dragged him outside of the city , thinking him to be dead .
44014020	But as the disciples were standing around him , he got up and entered the city . And the next day , he set out with Barnabas for Derbe .
44014021	And when they had evangelized that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch ,
44014022	strengthening the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them that they should remain always in the faith , and that it is necessary for us to enter into the kingdom of God through many tribulations .
44014023	And when they had established priests for them in each church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , in whom they believed .
44014024	And traveling by way of Pisidia , they arrived in Pamphylia .
44014025	And having spoken the word of the Lord in Perga , they went down into Attalia .
44014026	And from there , they sailed to Antioch , where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had now accomplished .
44014027	And when they had arrived and had gathered together the church , they related what great things God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles .
44014028	And they remained for no small amount of time with the disciples .
44015001	And certain ones , descending from Judea , were teaching the brothers , “ Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses , you cannot be saved . ”
44015002	Therefore , when Paul and Barnabas made no small uprising against them , they decided that Paul and Barnabas , and some from the opposing side , should go up to the Apostles and priests in Jerusalem concerning this question .
44015003	Therefore , being led by the church , they traveled through Phoenicia and Samaria , describing the conversion of the Gentiles . And they caused great joy among all the brothers .
44015004	And when they had arrived in Jerusalem , they were received by the church and the Apostles and the elders , reporting what great things God had done with them .
44015005	But some from the sect of the Pharisees , those who were believers , rose up saying , “ It is necessary for them to be circumcised and to be instructed to keep the Law of Moses . ”
44015006	And the Apostles and elders came together to take care of this matter .
44015007	And after a great contention had taken place , Peter rose up and said to them : “ Noble brothers , you know that , in recent days , God has chosen from among us , by my mouth , Gentiles to hear the word of the Gospel and to believe .
44015008	And God , who knows hearts , offered testimony , by giving the Holy Spirit to them , just as to us .
44015009	And he distinguished nothing between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
44015010	Now therefore , why do you tempt God to impose a yoke upon the necks of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear ?
44015011	But by the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ , we believe in order to be saved , in the same manner also as them . ”
44015012	Then the entire multitude was silent . And they were listening to Barnabas and Paul , describing what great signs and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	And after they had been silent , James responded by saying : “ Noble brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simon has explained in what manner God first visited , so as to take from the Gentiles a people to his name .
44015015	And the words of the Prophets are in agreement with this , just as it was written :
44015016	‘ After these things , I will return , and I will rebuild the tabernacle of David , which has fallen down . And I will rebuild its ruins , and I will raise it up ,
44015017	so that the rest of men may seek the Lord , along with all the nations over whom my name has been invoked , says the Lord , who does these things . ’
44015018	To the Lord , his own work has been known from eternity .
44015019	Because of this , I judge that those who were converted to God from among the Gentiles are not to be disturbed ,
44015020	but instead that we write to them , that they should keep themselves from the defilement of idols , and from fornication , and from whatever has been suffocated , and from blood .
44015021	For Moses , from ancient times , has had in each city those who preach him in the synagogues , where he is read on every Sabbath . ”
44015022	Then it pleased the Apostles and elders , with the whole Church , to choose men from among them , and to send to Antioch , with Paul and Barnabas , and Judas , who was surnamed Barsabbas , and Silas , preeminent men among the brothers ,
44015023	what was written by their own hands : “ The Apostles and elders , brothers , to those who are at Antioch and Syria and Cilicia , brothers from the Gentiles , greetings .
44015024	Since we have heard that some , going out from among us , have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , to whom we gave no commandment ,
44015025	it pleased us , being assembled as one , to choose men and to send them to you , with our most beloved Barnabas and Paul :
44015026	men who have handed over their lives on behalf of the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	Therefore , we have sent Judas and Silas , who themselves also will , with the spoken word , reaffirm to you the same things .
44015028	For it has seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to impose no further burden upon you , other than these necessary things :
44015029	that you abstain from things immolated to idols , and from blood , and from what has been suffocated , and from fornication . You will do well to keep yourselves from these things . Farewell . ”
44015030	And so , having been dismissed , they went down to Antioch . And gathering the multitude together , they delivered the epistle .
44015031	And when they had read it , they were gladdened by this consolation .
44015032	But Judas and Silas , being also prophets themselves , consoled the brothers with many words , and they were strengthened .
44015033	Then , after spending some more time there , they were dismissed with peace , by the brothers , to those who had sent them .
44015034	But it seemed good to Silas to remain there . So Judas alone departed to Jerusalem .
44015035	And Paul and Barnabas remained at Antioch , with many others , teaching and evangelizing the Word of the Lord .
44015036	Then , after some days , Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let us return to visit the brothers throughout all the cities in which we have preached the Word of the Lord , to see how they are . ”
44015037	And Barnabas wanted to take John , who was surnamed Mark , with them also .
44015038	But Paul was saying that he ought not to be received , since he withdrew from them at Pamphylia , and he had not gone with them in the work .
44015039	And there occurred a dissension , to such an extent that they departed from one another . And Barnabas , indeed taking Mark , sailed to Cyprus .
44015040	Yet truly , Paul , choosing Silas , set out , being delivered by the brothers to the grace of God .
44015041	And he traveled through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the Churches , instructing them to keep the precepts of the Apostles and the elders .
44016001	Then he arrived at Derbe and Lystra . And behold , a certain disciple named Timothy was there , the son of a faithful Jewish woman , his father a Gentile .
44016002	The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium rendered good testimony to him .
44016003	Paul wanted this man to travel with him , and taking him , he circumcised him , because of the Jews who were in those places . For they all knew that his father was a Gentile .
44016004	And as they were traveling through the cities , they delivered to them the dogmas to be kept , which were decreed by the Apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem .
44016005	And certainly , the Churches were being strengthened in faith and were increasing in number every day .
44016006	Then , while crossing through Phrygia and the region of Galatia , they were prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the Word in Asia .
44016007	But when they had arrived in Mysia , they attempted to go into Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus would not permit them .
44016008	Then , when they had crossed through Mysia , they descended to Troas .
44016009	And a vision in the night was revealed to Paul of a certain man of Macedonia , standing and pleading with him , and saying : “ Cross into Macedonia and help us ! ”
44016010	Then , after he saw the vision , immediately we sought to set out for Macedonia , having been assured that God had called us to evangelize to them .
44016011	And sailing from Troas , taking a direct path , we arrived at Samothrace , and on the following day , at Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there to Philippi , which is the preeminent city in the area of Macedonia , a colony . Now we were in this city some days , conferring together .
44016013	Then , on the Sabbath day , we were walking outside the gate , beside a river , where there seemed to be a prayer gathering . And sitting down , we were speaking with the women who had assembled .
44016014	And a certain woman , named Lydia , a seller of purple in the city of Thyatira , a worshiper of God , listened . And the Lord opened her heart to be receptive to what Paul was saying .
44016015	And when she had been baptized , with her household , she pleaded with us , saying : “ If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , enter into my house and lodge there . ” And she convinced us .
44016016	Then it happened that , as we were going out to prayer , a certain girl , having a spirit of divination , met with us . She was a source of great profit to her masters , through her divining .
44016017	This girl , following Paul and us , was crying out , saying : “ These men are servants of the Most High God ! They are announcing to you the way of salvation ! ”
44016018	Now she behaved in this way for many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , “ I command you , in the name of Jesus Christ , to go out from her . ” And it went away in that same hour .
44016019	But her masters , seeing that the hope of their profit went away , apprehended Paul and Silas , and they brought them to the rulers at the courthouse .
44016020	And presenting them to the magistrates , they said : “ These men are disturbing our city , since they are Jews .
44016021	And they are announcing a way which is not lawful for us to accept or to observe , since we are Romans . ”
44016022	And the people rushed together against them . And the magistrates , tearing their tunics , ordered them to be beaten with staffs .
44016023	And when they had inflicted many scourges on them , they cast them into prison , instructing the guard to watch them diligently .
44016024	And since he had received this kind of order , he cast them into the interior prison cell , and he restricted their feet with stocks .
44016025	Then , in the middle of the night , Paul and Silas were praying and praising God . And those who were also in custody were listening to them .
44016026	Yet truly , there was a sudden earthquake , so great that the foundations of the prison were moved . And immediately all the doors were opened , and the bindings of everyone were released .
44016027	Then the prison guard , having been jarred awake , and seeing the doors of the prison open , drew his sword and intended to kill himself , supposing that the prisoners had fled .
44016028	But Paul cried out with a loud voice , saying : “ Do no harm to yourself , for we are all here ! ”
44016029	Then calling for a light , he entered . And trembling , he fell before the feet of Paul and Silas .
44016030	And bringing them outside , he said , “ Sirs , what must I do , so that I may be saved ? ”
44016031	So they said , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus , and then you will be saved , with your household . ”
44016032	And they spoke the Word of the Lord to him , along with all those who were in his house .
44016033	And he , taking them in the same hour of the night , washed their scourges . And he was baptized , and next his entire household .
44016034	And when he had brought them into his own house , he set a table for them . And he was joyous , with his entire household , believing in God .
44016035	And when daylight had arrived , the magistrates sent the attendants , saying , “ Release those men . ”
44016036	But the prison guard reported these words to Paul : “ The magistrates have sent to have you released . Now therefore , depart . Go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul said to them : “ They have beaten us publicly , though we were not condemned . They have cast men who are Romans into prison . And now they would drive us away secretly ? Not so . Instead , let them come forward ,
44016038	and let us drive them away . ” Then the attendants reported these words to the magistrates . And upon hearing that they were Romans , they were afraid .
44016039	And arriving , they pleaded with them , and leading them out , they begged them to depart from the city .
44016040	And they went away from the prison and entered into the house of Lydia . And having seen the brothers , they consoled them , and then they set out .
44017001	Now when they had walked through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they arrived at Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue of the Jews .
44017002	Then Paul , according to custom , entered to them . And for three Sabbaths he disputed with them about the Scriptures ,
44017003	interpreting and concluding that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise again from the dead , and that “ this is the Jesus Christ , whom I am announcing to you . ”
44017004	And some of them believed and were joined to Paul and Silas , and a great number of these were from the worshipers and the Gentiles , and not a few were noble women .
44017005	But the Jews , being jealous , and joining with certain evildoers among the common men , caused a disturbance , and they stirred up the city . And taking up a position near the house of Jason , they sought to lead them out to the people .
44017006	And when they had not found them , they dragged Jason and certain brothers to the rulers of the city , crying out : “ For these are the ones who have stirred up the city . And they came here ,
44017007	and Jason has received them . And all these men act contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , Jesus . ”
44017008	And they incited the people . And the rulers of the city , upon hearing these things ,
44017009	and having received an explanation from Jason and the others , released them .
44017010	Yet truly , the brothers promptly sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea . And when they had arrived , they entered the synagogue of the Jews .
44017011	But these were more noble than those who were at Thessalonica . They received the Word with all enthusiasm , daily examining the Scriptures to see if these things were so .
44017012	And indeed , many believed among them , as well as not a few among the honorable Gentile men and women .
44017013	Then , when the Jews of Thessalonica had realized that the Word of God was also preached by Paul at Beroea , they went there also , stirring up and disturbing the multitude .
44017014	And then the brothers quickly sent Paul away , so that he might travel by sea . But Silas and Timothy remained there .
44017015	Then those who were leading Paul brought him as far as Athens . And having received an order from him to Silas and Timothy , that they should come to him quickly , they set out .
44017016	Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred up within him , seeing the city given over to idolatry .
44017017	And so , he was disputing with the Jews in the synagogue , and with the worshipers , and in public places , throughout each day , with whomever was there .
44017018	Now certain Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were arguing with him . And some were saying , “ What does this sower of the Word want to say ? ” Yet others were saying , “ He seems to be an announcer for new demons . ” For he was announcing to them Jesus and the Resurrection .
44017019	And apprehending him , they brought him to the Areopagus , saying : “ Are we able to know what this new doctrine is , about which you speak ?
44017020	For you bring certain new ideas to our ears . And so we would like to know what these things mean . ”
44017021	( Now all the Athenians , and arriving visitors , were occupying themselves with nothing other than speaking or hearing various new ideas . )
44017022	But Paul , standing in the middle of the Areopagus , said : “ Men of Athens , I perceive that in all things you are rather superstitious .
44017023	For as I was passing by and noticing your idols , I also found an altar , on which was written : TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Therefore , what you worship in ignorance , this is what I am preaching to you :
44017024	the God who made the world and all that is in it , the One who is the Lord of heaven and earth , who does not live in temples made with hands .
44017025	Neither is he served by the hands of men , as if in need of anything , since it is he who gives to all things life and breath and all else .
44017026	And he has made , out of one , every family of man : to live upon the face of the entire earth , determining the appointed seasons and the limits of their habitation ,
44017027	so as to seek God , if perhaps they may consider him or find him , though he is not far from each one of us .
44017028	‘ For in him we live , and move , and exist . ’ Just as some of your own poets have said . ‘ For we are also of his family . ’
44017029	Therefore , since we are of the family of God , we must not consider gold or silver or precious stones , or the engravings of art and of the imagination of man , to be a representation of what is Divine .
44017030	And indeed , God , having looked down to see the ignorance of these times , has now announced to men that everyone everywhere should do penance .
44017031	For he has appointed a day on which he will judge the world in equity , through the man whom he has appointed , offering faith to all , by raising him from the dead . ”
44017032	And when they had heard about the Resurrection of the dead , indeed , some were derisive , while others said , “ We will listen to you about this again . ”
44017033	So Paul departed from their midst .
44017034	Yet truly , certain men , adhering to him , did believe . Among these were also Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	After these things , having departed from Athens , he arrived at Corinth .
44018002	And upon finding a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , who had recently arrived from Italy with Priscilla his wife , ( because Claudius had ordered all Jews to depart from Rome , ) he met with them .
44018003	And because he was of the same trade , he lodged with them and was working . ( Now they were tentmakers by trade . )
44018004	And he was arguing in the synagogue on every Sabbath , introducing the name of the Lord Jesus . And he was persuading Jews and Greeks .
44018005	And when Silas and Timothy had arrived from Macedonia , Paul stood firm in the Word , testifying to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ .
44018006	But since they were contradicting him and blaspheming , he shook out his garments and said to them : “ Your blood is on your own heads . I am clean . From now on , I will go to the Gentiles . ”
44018007	And moving from that place , he entered into the house of a certain man , named Titus the Just , a worshiper of God , whose house was adjoined to the synagogue .
44018008	Now Crispus , a leader of the synagogue , believed in the Lord , with his entire house . And many of the Corinthians , upon hearing , believed and were baptized .
44018009	Then the Lord said to Paul , through a vision in the night : “ Do not be afraid . Instead , speak out and do not be silent .
44018010	For I am with you . And no one will take hold of you , so as to do you harm . For many of the people in this city are with me . ”
44018011	Then he settled there for a year and six months , teaching the Word of God among them .
44018012	But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jews rose up with one accord against Paul . And they brought him to the tribunal ,
44018013	saying , “ He persuades men to worship God contrary to the law . ”
44018014	Then , when Paul was beginning to open his mouth , Gallio said to the Jews : “ If this were some matter of injustice , or a wicked deed , O noble Jews , I would support you , as is proper .
44018015	Yet if truly these are questions about a word and names and your law , you should see to it yourselves . I will not be the judge of such things . ”
44018016	And he ordered them from the tribunal .
44018017	But they , apprehending Sosthenes , a leader of the synagogue , beat him in front of the tribunal . And Gallio showed no concern for these things .
44018018	Yet truly , Paul , after he had remained for many more days , having said goodbye to the brothers , sailed into Syria , and with him were Priscilla and Aquila . Now he had shaved his head in Cenchreae , for he had made a vow .
44018019	And he arrived at Ephesus , and he left them behind there . Yet truly , he himself , entering into the synagogue , was disputing with the Jews .
44018020	Then , although they were asking him to remain for a longer time , he would not agree .
44018021	Instead , saying goodbye and telling them , “ I will return to you again , God willing , ” he set out from Ephesus .
44018022	And after going down to Caesarea , he went up to Jerusalem , and he greeted the Church there , and then he descended to Antioch .
44018023	And having spent some length of time there , he set out , and he walked in order through the region of Galatia and Phrygia , strengthening all the disciples .
44018024	Now a certain Jew named Apollo , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man who was powerful with the Scriptures , arrived at Ephesus .
44018025	He was learned in the Way of the Lord . And being fervent in spirit , he was speaking and teaching the things that are of Jesus , but knowing only the baptism of John .
44018026	And so , he began to act faithfully in the synagogue . And when Priscilla and Aquila had heard him , they took him aside and expounded the Way of the Lord to him more thoroughly .
44018027	Then , since he wanted to go to Achaia , the brothers wrote an exhortation to the disciples , so that they might accept him . And when he had arrived , he held many discussions with those who had believed .
44018028	For he was vehemently and publicly reproving the Jews , by revealing through the Scriptures that Jesus is the Christ .
44019001	Now it happened that , while Apollo was at Corinth , Paul , after he had journeyed through the upper regions , arrived at Ephesus . And he met with certain disciples .
44019002	And he said to them , “ After believing , have you received the Holy Spirit ? ” But they said to him , “ We have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . ”
44019003	Yet truly , he said , “ Then with what have you been baptized ? ” And they said , “ With the baptism of John . ”
44019004	Then Paul said : “ John baptized the people with the baptism of repentance , saying that they should believe in the One who is to come after him , that is , in Jesus . ”
44019005	Upon hearing these things , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	And when Paul had imposed his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came over them . And they were speaking in tongues and prophesying .
44019007	Now the men were about twelve in all .
44019008	Then , upon entering the synagogue , he was speaking faithfully for three months , disputing and persuading them about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when certain ones became hardened and would not believe , cursing the Way of the Lord in the presence of the multitude , Paul , withdrawing from them , separated the disciples , disputing daily in a certain school of Tyrannus .
44019010	Now this was done throughout two years , so that all who were living in Asia listened to the Word of the Lord , both Jews and Gentiles .
44019011	And God was accomplishing powerful and uncommon miracles by the hand of Paul ,
44019012	so much so that even when small cloths and wrappings were brought from his body to the sick , the illnesses withdrew from them and the wicked spirits departed .
44019013	Then , even some of the traveling Jewish exorcists had attempted to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits , saying , “ I bind you by oath through Jesus , whom Paul preaches . ”
44019014	And there were certain Jews , the seven sons of Sceva , leaders among the priests , who were acting in this way .
44019015	But a wicked spirit responded by saying to them : “ Jesus I know , and Paul I know . But who are you ? ”
44019016	And the man , in whom there was a wicked spirit , leaping at them and getting the better of them both , prevailed against them , so that they fled from that house , naked and wounded .
44019017	And so , this became known to all the Jews and Gentiles who were living at Ephesus . And a fear fell over them all . And the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
44019018	And many believers were arriving , confessing , and announcing their deeds .
44019019	Then many of those who had followed odd sects brought together their books , and they burned them in the sight of all . And after determining the value of these , they found the price to be fifty thousand denarii .
44019020	In this way , the Word of God was increasing strongly and was being confirmed .
44019021	Then , when these things were completed , Paul decided in the Spirit , after crossing through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , “ Then , after I have been there , it is necessary for me to see Rome also . ”
44019022	But sending two of those who were ministering to him , Timothy and Erastus , into Macedonia , he himself remained for a time in Asia .
44019023	Now at that time , there occurred no small disturbance concerning the Way of the Lord .
44019024	For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith making silver shrines for Diana , was providing no small profit to craftsmen .
44019025	And calling them together , with those who were employed in the same way , he said : “ Men , you know that our income is from this craft .
44019026	And you are seeing and hearing that this man Paul , by persuasion , has turned away a great multitude , not only from Ephesus , but from nearly all of Asia , saying , ‘ These things are not gods which have been made by hands . ’
44019027	Thus , not only is this , our occupation , in danger of being brought into repudiation , but also the temple of the great Diana will be reputed as nothing ! Then even her majesty , whom all of Asia and the world worships , will begin to be destroyed . ”
44019028	Upon hearing this , they were filled with anger , and they cried out , saying , “ Great is Diana of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	And the city was filled with confusion . And having seized Gaius and Aristarchus of Macedonia , companions of Paul , they rushed violently , with one accord , into the amphitheatre .
44019030	Then , when Paul wanted to enter to the people , the disciples would not permit him .
44019031	And some of the leaders from Asia , who were his friends , also sent to him , requesting that he not present himself in the amphitheatre .
44019032	But others were crying out various things . For the assembly was in confusion , and most did not know the reason they had been called together .
44019033	So they dragged Alexander from the crowd , while the Jews were propelling him forward . And Alexander , gesturing with his hand for silence , wanted to give the people an explanation .
44019034	But as soon as they realized him to be a Jew , all with one voice , for about two hours , were crying out , “ Great is Diana of the Ephesians ! ”
44019035	And when the scribe had calmed the crowds , he said : “ Men of Ephesus , now what man is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is in the service of the great Diana and of the offspring of Jupiter ?
44019036	Therefore , since these things are not able to be contradicted , it is necessary for you to be calm and to do nothing rash .
44019037	For you have brought forward these men , who are neither sacrilegious nor blasphemers against your goddess .
44019038	But if Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a case against anyone , they can convene in the courts , and there are proconsuls . Let them accuse one another .
44019039	But if you would inquire about other things , this can be decided in a lawful assembly .
44019040	For now we are in peril of being convicted of sedition over today’s events , since there is no one guilty ( against whom we are able to provide evidence ) in this gathering . ”
44019041	And when he had said this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	Then , after the tumult ceased , Paul , calling the disciples to himself and exhorting them , said farewell . And he set out , so that he might go into Macedonia .
44020002	And when he had walked through those areas and had exhorted them with many sermons , he went into Greece .
44020003	After he had spent three months there , treacheries were planned against him by the Jews , just as he was about to sail into Syria . And having been advised of this , he return through Macedonia .
44020004	Now those accompanying him were Sopater , the son of Pyrrhus from Beroea ; and also the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timothy ; and also Tychicus and Trophimus from Asia .
44020005	These , after they had gone ahead , waited for us at Troas .
44020006	Yet truly , we sailed from Philippi , after the days of Unleavened Bread , and in five days we went to them at Troas , where we stayed for seven days .
44020007	Then , on the first Sabbath , when we had assembled together to break bread , Paul discoursed with them , intending to set out the next day . But he prolonged his sermon into the middle of the night .
44020008	Now there were plenty of lamps in the upper room , where we were gathered .
44020009	And a certain adolescent named Eutychus , sitting on the window sill , was being weighed down by a heavy drowsiness ( for Paul was preaching at length ) . Then , as he went to sleep , he fell from the third floor room downward . And when he was lifted up , he was dead .
44020010	When Paul had gone down to him , he laid himself over him and , embracing him , said , “ Do not worry , for his soul is still within him . ”
44020011	And so , going up , and breaking bread , and eating , and having spoken well on until daylight , he then set out .
44020012	Now they had brought the boy in alive , and they were more than a little consoled .
44020013	Then we climbed aboard the ship and sailed to Assos , where we were to take in Paul . For so he himself had decided , since he was making the journey by land .
44020014	And when he had joined us at Assos , we took him in , and we went to Mitylene .
44020015	And sailing from there , on the following day , we arrived opposite Chios . And next we landed at Samos . And on the following day we went to Miletus .
44020016	For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus , so that he would not be delayed in Asia . For he was hurrying so that , if it were possible for him , he might observe the day of Pentecost at Jerusalem .
44020017	Then , sending from Miletus to Ephesus , he called those greater by birth in the church .
44020018	And when they had come to him and were together , he said to them : “ You know that from the first day when I entered into Asia , I have been with you , for the entire time , in this manner :
44020019	serving the Lord , with all humility and despite the tears and trials which befell me from the treacheries of the Jews ,
44020020	how I held back nothing that was of value , how well I have preached to you , and that I have taught you publicly and throughout the houses ,
44020021	testifying both to Jews and to Gentiles about repentance in God and faith in our Lord Jesus Christ .
44020022	And now , behold , being obliged in spirit , I am going to Jerusalem , not knowing what will happen to me there ,
44020023	except that the Holy Spirit , throughout every city , has cautioned me , saying that chains and tribulations await me at Jerusalem .
44020024	But I dread none of these things . Neither do I consider my life to be more precious because it is my own , provided that in some way I may complete my own course and that of the ministry of the Word , which I received from the Lord Jesus , to testify to the Gospel of the grace of God .
44020025	And now , behold , I know that you will no longer see my face , all of you among whom I have traveled , preaching the kingdom of God .
44020026	For this reason , I call you as witnesses on this very day : that I am clean from the blood of all .
44020027	For I have not turned aside in the least from announcing every counsel of God to you .
44020028	Take care of yourselves and of the entire flock , over which the Holy Spirit has stationed you as Bishops to rule the Church of God , which he has purchased by his own blood .
44020029	I know that after my departure ravenous wolves will enter among you , not sparing the flock .
44020030	And from among yourselves , men will rise up , speaking perverse things in order to entice disciples after them .
44020031	Because of this , be vigilant , retaining in memory that throughout three years I did not cease , night and day , with tears , to admonish each and every one of you .
44020032	And now , I commend you to God and to the Word of his grace . He has the power to build up , and to give an inheritance to all who are sanctified .
44020033	I have coveted neither silver and gold , nor apparel ,
44020034	as you yourselves know . For that which was needed by me and by those who are with me , these hands have provided .
44020035	I have revealed all things to you , because by laboring in this way , it is necessary to support the weak and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	And when he had said these things , kneeling down , he prayed with all of them .
44020037	Then a great weeping occurred among them all . And , falling upon the neck of Paul , they kissed him ,
44020038	being grieved most of all over the word which he had said , that they would never see his face again . And they brought him to the ship .
44021001	And after these things had happened , having reluctantly parted from them , we sailed a direct course , arriving at Cos , and on following the day at Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	And when we had found a ship sailing across to Phoenicia , climbing aboard , we set sail .
44021003	Then , after we had caught sight of Cyprus , keeping it to the left , we sailed on to Syria , and we arrived at Tyre . For the ship was going to unload its cargo there .
44021004	Then , having found the disciples , we lodged there for seven days . And they were saying to Paul , through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
44021005	And when the days were completed , setting out , we went on ; and they all accompanied us with their wives and children , until we were outside of the city . And we kneeled down at the shore and prayed .
44021006	And when we had said farewell to one another , we climbed aboard the ship . And they returned to their own .
44021007	Yet truly , having completed our journey by boat from Tyre , we descended to Ptolemais . And greeting the brothers , we lodged with them for one day .
44021008	Then , after setting out the next day , we arrived at Caesarea . And upon entering into the house of Philip the evangelist , who was one of the seven , we stayed with him .
44021009	Now this man had four daughters , virgins , who were prophesying .
44021010	And while we were delayed for some days , a certain prophet from Judea , named Agabus , arrived .
44021011	And he , when he had come to us , took Paul’s belt , and binding his own feet and hands , he said : “ Thus says the Holy Spirit : The man whose belt this is , the Jews will bind in this way at Jerusalem . And they will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles . ”
44021012	And when we had heard this , both we and those who were from that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul responded by saying : “ What do you accomplish by weeping and afflicting my heart ? For I am prepared , not only to be bound , but also to die in Jerusalem , for the name of the Lord Jesus . ”
44021014	And since we were not able to persuade him , we quieted , saying : “ May the will of the Lord be done . ”
44021015	Then , after those days , having made preparations , we ascended to Jerusalem .
44021016	Now some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us , bringing with them a certain Cypriot named Mnason , a very old disciple , whose guests we would be .
44021017	And when we had arrived at Jerusalem , the brothers received us willingly .
44021018	Then , on the following day , Paul entered with us to James . And all the elders were assembled .
44021019	And when he had greeted them , he explained each thing that God had accomplished among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	And they , upon hearing it , magnified God and said to him : “ You understand , brother , how many thousands there are among the Jews who have believed , and they are all zealous for the law .
44021021	Now they have heard about you , that you are teaching those Jews who are among the Gentiles to withdraw from Moses , telling them that they should not circumcise their sons , nor act according to custom .
44021022	What is next ? The multitude ought to be convened . For they will hear that you have arrived .
44021023	Therefore , do this thing that we ask of you : We have four men , who are under a vow .
44021024	Take these and sanctify yourself with them , and require them to shave their heads . And then everyone will know that the things that they have heard about you are false , but that you yourself walk in keeping with the law .
44021025	But , about those Gentiles who have believed , we have written a judgment that they should keep themselves from what has been immolated to idols , and from blood , and from what has been suffocated , and from fornication . ”
44021026	Then Paul , taking the men on the next day , was purified with them , and he entered the temple , announcing the process of the days of purification , until an oblation would be offered on behalf of each one of them .
