44021027	But when the seven days were reaching completion , those Jews who were from Asia , when they had seen him in the temple , incited all the people , and they laid hands on him , crying out :
44021028	“ Men of Israel , help ! This is the man who is teaching , everyone , everywhere , against the people and the law and this place . Furthermore , he has even brought Gentiles into the temple , and he has violated this holy place . ”
44021029	( For they had seen Trophimus , an Ephesian , in the city with him , and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple . )
44021030	And the entire city was stirred up . And it happened that the people ran together . And apprehending Paul , they dragged him outside of the temple . And immediately the doors were closed .
44021031	Then , as they were seeking to kill him , it was reported to the tribune of the cohort : “ All Jerusalem is in confusion . ”
44021032	And so , immediately taking soldiers and centurions , he rushed down to them . And when they had seen the tribune and the soldiers , they ceased to strike Paul .
44021033	Then the tribune , drawing near , apprehended him and ordered that he be bound with two chains . And he was asking who he was and what he had done .
44021034	Then they were crying out various things within the crowd . And since he could not understand anything clearly because of the noise , he ordered him to be brought into the fortress .
44021035	And when he had arrived at the stairs , it happened that he was carried up by the soldiers , because of the threat of violence from the people .
44021036	For the multitude of the people were following and crying out , “ Take him away ! ”
44021037	And as Paul was beginning to be brought into the fortress , he said to the tribune , “ Is it permissible for me to say something to you ? ” And he said , “ You know Greek ?
44021038	So then , are you not that Egyptian who before these days incited a rebellion and led out into the desert four thousand murderous men ? ”
44021039	But Paul said to him : “ I am a man , indeed a Jew , from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of a well-known city . So I petition you , permit me to speak to the people . ”
44021040	And when he had given him permission , Paul , standing on the stairs , motioned with his hand to the people . And when a great silence occurred , he spoke to them in the Hebrew language , saying :
44022001	“ Noble brothers and fathers , listen to the explanation that I now give to you . ”
44022002	And when they heard him speaking to them in the Hebrew language , they offered a greater silence .
44022003	And he said : “ I am a Jewish man , born at Tarsus in Cilicia , but raised in this city beside the feet of Gamaliel , taught according to the truth of the law of the fathers , zealous for the law , just as all of you also are to this day .
44022004	I persecuted this Way , even unto death , binding and delivering into custody both men and women ,
44022005	just as the high priest and all those greater by birth bear witness to me . Having received letters from them to the brothers , I journeyed to Damascus , so that I might lead them bound from there to Jerusalem , so that they might be punished .
44022006	But it happened that , as I was traveling and was approaching Damascus at midday , suddenly from heaven a great light shone around me .
44022007	And falling to the ground , I heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	And I responded , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ And he said to me , ‘ I am Jesus the Nazarene , whom you are persecuting . ’
44022009	And those who were with me , indeed , saw the light , but they did not hear the voice of him who was speaking with me .
44022010	And I said , ‘ What should I do , Lord ? ’ Then the Lord said to me : ‘ Rise up , and go to Damascus . And there , you shall be told all that you must do . ’
44022011	And since I could not see , because of the brightness of that light , I was led by the hand by my companions , and I went to Damascus .
44022012	Then a certain Ananias , a man in accord with the law , having the testimony of all the Jews who were living there ,
44022013	drawing near to me and standing close by , said to me , ‘ Brother Saul , see ! ’ And in that same hour , I looked upon him .
44022014	But he said : ‘ The God of our fathers has preordained you , so that you would come to know his will and would see the Just One , and would hear the voice from his mouth .
44022015	For you shall be his witness to all men about those things which you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now , why do you delay ? Rise up , and be baptized , and wash away your sins , by invoking his name . ’
44022017	Then it happened that , when I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple , a mental stupor came over me ,
44022018	and I saw him saying to me : ‘ Hurry ! Depart quickly from Jerusalem ! For they will not accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	And I said : ‘ Lord , they know that I am beating and enclosing in prison , throughout every synagogue , those who have believed in you .
44022020	And when the blood of your witness Stephen was poured out , I stood nearby and was consenting , and I watched over the garments of those who put him to death . ’
44022021	And he said to me , ‘ Go forth . For I am sending you to far away nations . ’ ”
44022022	Now they were listening to him , until this word , and then they lifted up their voice , saying : “ Take this kind away from the earth ! For it is not fitting for him to live ! ”
44022023	And while they were shouting , and tossing aside their garments , and casting dust into the air ,
44022024	the tribune ordered him to be brought into the fortress , and to be scourged and tortured , in order to discover the reason that they were crying out in this way against him .
44022025	And when they had tied him with straps , Paul said to the centurion who was standing near him , “ Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman and has not been condemned ? ”
44022026	Upon hearing this , the centurion went to the tribune and reported it to him , saying : “ What do you intend to do ? For this man is a Roman citizen . ”
44022027	And the tribune , approaching , said to him : “ Tell me . Are you a Roman ? ” So he said , “ Yes . ”
44022028	And the tribune responded , “ I obtained this citizenship at great cost . ” And Paul said , “ But I was born to it . ”
44022029	Therefore , those who were going to torture him , immediately withdrew from him . The tribune was similarly afraid , after he realized that he was a Roman citizen , for he had bound him .
44022030	But on the next day , wanting to discover more diligently what the reason was that he was accused by the Jews , he released him , and he ordered the priests to convene , with the entire council . And , producing Paul , he stationed him among them .
44023001	Then Paul , gazing intently at the council , said , “ Noble brothers , I have spoken with all good conscience before God , even to this present day . ”
44023002	And the high priest , Ananias , instructed those who were standing nearby to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him : “ God shall strike you , you whitewashed wall ! For would you sit and judge me according to the law , when , contrary to the law , you order me to be struck ? ”
44023004	And those who were standing nearby said , “ Are you speaking evil about the high priest of God ? ”
44023005	And Paul said : “ I did not know , brothers , that he is the high priest . For it is written : ‘ You shall not speak evil of the leader of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Now Paul , knowing that one group were Sadducees and the other were Pharisees , exclaimed in the council : “ Noble brothers , I am a Pharisee , the son of Pharisees ! It is over the hope and resurrection of the dead that I am being judged . ”
44023007	And when he had said this , a dissension occurred between the Pharisees and the Sadducees . And the multitude was divided .
44023008	For the Sadducees claim that there is no resurrection , and neither angels , nor spirits . But the Pharisees confess both of these .
44023009	Then there occurred a great clamor . And some of the Pharisees , rising up , were fighting , saying : “ We find nothing evil in this man . What if a spirit has spoken to him , or an angel ? ”
44023010	And since a great dissension had been made , the tribune , fearing that Paul might be torn apart by them , ordered the soldiers to descend and to seize him from their midst , and to bring him into the fortress .
44023011	Then , on the following night , the Lord stood near him and said : “ Be constant . For just as you have testified about me in Jerusalem , so also it is necessary for you to testify at Rome . ”
44023012	And when daylight arrived , some of the Jews gathered together and bound themselves with an oath , saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	Now there were more than forty men who had taken this oath together .
44023014	And they approached the leaders of the priests , and the elders , and they said : “ We have sworn ourselves by an oath , so that we will taste nothing , until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Therefore , with the council , you should now give notice to the tribune , so that he may bring him to you , as if you intended to determine something else about him . But before he approaches , we have made preparations to put him to death . ”
44023016	But when Paul’s sister’s son had heard of this , about their treachery , he went and entered into the fortress , and he reported it to Paul .
44023017	And Paul , calling to him one of the centurions , said : “ Lead this young man to the tribune . For he has something to tell him . ”
44023018	And indeed , he took him and led him to the tribune , and he said , “ Paul , the prisoner , asked me to lead this young man to you , since he has something to say to you . ”
44023019	Then the tribune , taking him by the hand , withdrew with him by themselves , and he asked him : “ What is it that you have to tell me ? ”
44023020	Then he said : “ The Jews have met to ask you to bring Paul tomorrow to the council , as if they intended to question him about something else .
44023021	But truly , you should not believe them , for they would ambush him with more than forty men from among them , who have bound themselves by an oath neither to eat , nor to drink , until they have put him to death . And they are now prepared , hoping for an affirmation from you . ”
44023022	And then the tribune dismissed the young man , instructing him not to tell anyone that he had made known these things to him .
44023023	Then , having called two centurions , he said to them : “ Prepare two hundred soldiers , so that they may go as far as Caesarea , and seventy horsemen , and two hundred spearmen , for the third hour of the night .
44023024	And prepare beasts of burden to carry Paul , so that they may lead him safely to Felix , the governor . ”
44023025	For he was afraid , lest perhaps the Jews might seize him and kill him , and that afterwards he would be falsely accused , as if he had accepted a bribe . And so he wrote a letter containing the following :
44023026	“ Claudius Lysias , to the most excellent governor , Felix : greetings .
44023027	This man , having been apprehended by the Jews and being about to be put to death by them , I rescued , overwhelming them with soldiers , since I realized that he is a Roman .
44023028	And wanting to know the reason that they objected to him , I brought him into their council .
44023029	And I discovered him to be accused about questions of their law . Yet truly , nothing deserving of death or imprisonment was within the accusation .
44023030	And when I had been given news of ambushes , which they had prepared against him , I sent him to you , notifying his accusers also , so that they may plead their accusations before you . Farewell . ”
44023031	Therefore the soldiers , taking Paul according to their orders , brought him by night to Antipatris .
44023032	And the next day , sending the horsemen to go with him , they returned to the fortress .
44023033	And when they had arrived at Caesarea and had delivered the letter to the governor , they also presented Paul before him .
44023034	And when he had read it and had asked which province he was from , realizing that he was from Cilicia , he said :
44023035	“ I will hear you , when your accusers have arrived . ” And he ordered him to be kept in the praetorium of Herod .
44024001	Then , after five days , the high priest Ananias came down with some of the elders and a certain Tertullus , a speaker . And they went to the governor against Paul .
44024002	And having summoned Paul , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying : “ Most excellent Felix , since we have much peace through you , and many things may be corrected by your providence ,
44024003	we acknowledge this , always and everywhere , with acts of thanksgiving for everything .
44024004	But lest I speak at too great a length , I beg you , by your clemency , to listen to us briefly .
44024005	We have found this man to be pestilent , to be inciting seditions among all the Jews in the entire world , and to be the author of the sedition of the sect of the Nazarenes .
44024006	And he has even been attempting to violate the temple . And having apprehended him , we wanted him to be judged according to our law .
44024007	But Lysias , the tribune , overwhelming us with great violence , snatched him away from our hands ,
44024008	ordering his accusers to come to you . From them , you yourself will be able , by judging about all these things , to understand the reason that we accuse him . ”
44024009	And then the Jews interjected , saying that these things were so .
44024010	Then , since the governor had motioned for him to speak , Paul responded : “ Knowing that you have been the judge over this nation for many years , I will give an explanation of myself with an honest soul .
44024011	For , as you may realize , it has only been twelve days since I went up to worship in Jerusalem .
44024012	And they did not find me in the temple arguing with anyone , nor causing a rally of the people : neither in the synagogues , nor in the city .
44024013	And they are not able to prove to you the things about which they now accuse me .
44024014	But I confess this to you , that according to that sect , which they call a heresy , so do I serve my God and Father , believing all that is written in the Law and the Prophets ,
44024015	having a hope in God , which these others themselves also expect , that there will be a future resurrection of the just and the unjust .
44024016	And in this , I myself always strive to have a conscience that is lacking in any offence toward God and toward men .
44024017	Then , after many years , I went to my nation , bringing alms and offerings and vows ,
44024018	through which I obtained purification in the temple : neither with a crowd , nor with a commotion .
44024019	But certain Jews out of Asia are the ones who should have appeared before you to accuse me , if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or let these ones here say if they have found in me any iniquity , while standing before the council .
44024021	For while standing among them , I spoke out solely about this one matter : about the resurrection of the dead . It is about this that I am being judged today by you . ”
44024022	Then Felix , after having ascertained much knowledge about this Way , kept them waiting , by saying , “ When Lysias the tribune has arrived , I will give you a hearing . ”
44024023	And he ordered a centurion to guard him , and to take rest , and not to prohibit any of his own from ministering to him .
44024024	Then , after some days , Felix , arriving with his wife Drusilla who was a Jew , called for Paul and listened to him about the faith that is in Christ Jesus .
44024025	And after he discoursed about justice and chastity , and about the future judgment , Felix was trembling , and he responded : “ For now , go , but remain under guard . Then , at an opportune time , I will summon you . ”
44024026	He was also hoping that money might be given to him by Paul , and because of this , he frequently summoned him and spoke with him .
44024027	Then , when two years had passed , Felix was succeeded by Portius Festus . And since Felix wanted to show particular favor to the Jews , he left Paul behind as a prisoner .
44025001	And so , when Festus had arrived in the province , after three days , he ascended to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	And the leaders of the priests , and those first among the Jews , went to him against Paul . And they were petitioning him ,
44025003	asking for favor against him , so that he would order him to be led to Jerusalem , where they were maintaining an ambush in order to kill him along the way .
44025004	But Festus responded that Paul was to be kept in Caesarea , and that he himself would soon go there .
44025005	“ Therefore , ” he said , “ let those among you who are able , descend at the same time , and if there is any guilt in the man , they may accuse him . ”
44025006	Then , having stayed among them no more than eight or ten days , he descended to Caesarea . And on the next day , he sat in the judgment seat , and he ordered Paul to be led in .
44025007	And when he had been brought , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , throwing out many serious accusations , none of which they were able to prove .
44025008	Paul offered this defense : “ Neither against the law of the Jews , nor against the temple , nor against Caesar , have I offended in any matter . ”
44025009	But Festus , wanting to show greater favor to the Jews , responded to Paul by saying : “ Are you willing to ascend to Jerusalem and to be judged there about these things before me ? ”
44025010	But Paul said : “ I stand in Caesar’s tribunal , which is where I ought to be judged . I have done no harm to the Jews , as you well know .
44025011	For if I have harmed them , or if I have done anything deserving of death , I do not object to dying . But if there is nothing to these things about which they accuse me , no one is able to deliver me to them . I appeal to Caesar . ”
44025012	Then Festus , having spoken with the council , responded : “ You have appealed to Caesar , to Caesar you shall go . ”
44025013	And when some days had passed , king Agrippa and Bernice descended to Caesarea , to greet Festus .
44025014	And since they remained there for many days , Festus spoke to the king about Paul , saying : “ A certain man was left behind as a prisoner by Felix .
44025015	When I was at Jerusalem , the leaders of the priests and the elders of the Jews came to me about him , asking for condemnation against him .
44025016	I answered them that it is not the custom of the Romans to condemn any man , before he who is being accused has been confronted by his accusers and has received the opportunity to defend himself , so as to clear himself of the charges .
44025017	Therefore , when they had arrived here , without any delay , on the following day , sitting in the judgment seat , I ordered the man to be brought .
44025018	But when the accusers had stood up , they did not present any accusation about him from which I would suspect evil .
44025019	Instead , they brought against him certain disputes about their own superstition and about a certain Jesus , who had died , but whom Paul asserted to be alive .
44025020	Therefore , being in doubt about this kind of question , I asked him if he was willing go to Jerusalem and to be judged there about these things .
44025021	But since Paul was appealing to be kept for a decision before Augustus , I ordered him to be kept , until I might send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	Then Agrippa said to Festus : “ I myself also want to hear the man . ” “ Tomorrow , ” he said , “ you shall hear him . ”
44025023	And on the next day , when Agrippa and Bernice had arrived with great ostentation and had entered into the auditorium with the tribunes and the principal men of the city , Paul was brought in , at the order of Festus .
44025024	And Festus said : “ King Agrippa , and all who are present together with us , you see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews disturbed me at Jerusalem , petitioning and clamoring that he should not be allowed to live any longer .
44025025	Truly , I have discovered nothing brought forth against him that is worthy of death . But since he himself has appealed to Augustus , it was my judgment to send him .
44025026	But I have not determined what to write to the emperor about him . Because of this , I have brought him before you all , and especially before you , O king Agrippa , so that , once an inquiry has occurred , I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems to me unreasonable to send a prisoner and not to indicate the accusations set against him . ”
44026001	Yet truly , Agrippa said to Paul , “ It is permitted for you to speak for yourself . ” Then Paul , extending his hand , began to offer his defense .
44026002	“ I consider myself blessed , O king Agrippa , that I am to give my defense today before you , about everything of which I am accused by the Jews ,
44026003	especially since you know everything that pertains to the Jews , both customs and questions . Because of this , I beg you to listen to me patiently .
44026004	And certainly , all the Jews know about my life from my youth , which had its beginning among my own people in Jerusalem .
44026005	They knew me well from the beginning , ( if they would be willing to offer testimony ) for I lived according to the most determined sect of our religion : as a Pharisee .
44026006	And now , it is in the hope of the Promise which was made by God to our fathers that I stand subject to judgment .
44026007	It is the Promise that our twelve tribes , worshiping night and day , hope to see . About this hope , O king , I am accused by the Jews .
44026008	Why should it be judged so unbelievable with you all that God might raise the dead ?
44026009	And certainly , I myself formerly considered that I ought to act in many ways which are contrary to the name of Jesus the Nazarene .
44026010	This is also how I acted at Jerusalem . And so , I enclosed many holy persons in prison , having received authority from the leaders of the priests . And when they were to be killed , I brought the sentence .
44026011	And in every synagogue , frequently while punishing them , I compelled them to blaspheme . And being all the more maddened against them , I persecuted them , even to foreign cities .
44026012	Thereafter , as I was going to Damascus , with authority and permission from the high priest ,
44026013	at midday , O king , I and those who were also with me , saw along the way a light from heaven shining around me with a splendor greater than that of the sun .
44026014	And when we had all fallen down to the ground , I heard a voice speaking to me in the Hebrew language : ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? It is hard for you to kick against the goad . ’
44026015	Then I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ And the Lord said , ‘ I am Jesus , whom you are persecuting .
44026016	But rise up and stand on your feet . For I appeared to you for this reason : so that I may establish you as a minister and a witness concerning the things that you have seen , and concerning the things that I will show to you :
44026017	rescuing you from the people and the nations to which I am now sending you ,
44026018	in order to open their eyes , so that they may be converted from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan to God , so that they may receive the remission of sins and a place among the saints , through the faith that is in me . ’
44026019	From then on , O king Agrippa , I was not unbelieving to the heavenly vision .
44026020	But I preached , first to those who are at Damascus and at Jerusalem , and then to the entire region of Judea , and to the Gentiles , so that they would repent and convert to God , doing the works that are worthy of repentance .
44026021	It was for this reason that the Jews , having apprehended me when I was in the temple , attempted to kill me .
44026022	But having been aided by the help of God , even to this day , I stand witnessing to the small and the great , saying nothing beyond what the Prophets and Moses have said would be in the future :
44026023	that the Christ would suffer , and that he would be the first from the resurrection of the dead , and that he would bring light to the people and to the nations . ”
44026024	While he was speaking these things and presenting his defense , Festus said with a loud voice : “ Paul , you are insane ! Too much studying has turned you to insanity . ”
44026025	And Paul said : “ I am not insane , most excellent Festus , but rather I am speaking words of truth and sobriety .
44026026	For the king knows about these things . To him also , I am speaking with constancy . For I think that none of these things are unknown to him . And neither were these things done in a corner .
44026027	Do you believe the Prophets , O king Agrippa ? I know that you believe . ”
44026028	Then Agrippa said to Paul , “ To some extent , you persuade me to become a Christian . ”
44026029	And Paul said , “ I hope to God that , both to a small extent and to a great extent , not only you , but also all those who hear me this day will become just as I also am , except for these chains . ”
44026030	And the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and those who were sitting with them .
44026031	And when they had withdrawn , they were speaking among themselves , saying , “ This man has done nothing worthy of death , nor of imprisonment . ”
44026032	Then Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been released , if he had not appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	Then it was decided to send him by ship to Italy , and that Paul , with the others in custody , should be delivered to a centurion named Julius , of the cohort of Augusta .
44027002	After climbing aboard a ship from Adramyttium , we set sail and began to navigate along the ports of Asia , with Aristarchus , the Macedonian from Thessalonica , joining us .
44027003	And on the following day , we arrived at Sidon . And Julius , treating Paul humanely , permitted him to go to his friends and to look after himself .
44027004	And when we had set sail from there , we navigated below Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
44027005	And navigating though the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we arrived at Lystra , which is in Lycia .
44027006	And there the centurion found a ship from Alexandria sailing to Italy , and he transferred us to it .
44027007	And when we had sailed slowly for many days and had barely arrived opposite Cnidus , for the wind was hindering us , we sailed to Crete , near Salmone .
44027008	And barely being able to sail past it , we arrived at a certain place , which is called Good Shelter , next to which was the city of Lasea .
44027009	Then , after much time had passed , and since sailing would no longer be prudent because the Fast Day had now passed , Paul consoled them ,
44027010	and he said to them : “ Men , I perceive that the voyage is now in danger of injury and much damage , not only to the cargo and the ship , but also to our own lives . ”
44027011	But the centurion put more trust in the captain and the navigator of the ship , than in the things being said by Paul .
44027012	And since it was not a fitting port in which to winter , the majority opinion was to sail from there , so that somehow they might be able to arrive at Phoenicia , in order to winter there , at a port of Crete , which looks out toward the southwest and northwest .
44027013	And since the south wind was blowing gently , they thought that they might reach their goal . And after they had set out from Asson , they weighed anchor at Crete .
44027014	But not long afterward , a violent wind came against them , which is called the Northeast Wind .
44027015	And once the ship had been caught in it and was not able to strive against the wind , giving over the ship to the winds , we were driven along .
44027016	Then , being forced along a certain island , which is called the Tail , we were barely able to hold on to the ship’s lifeboat .
44027017	When this was taken up , they used it to assist in securing the ship . For they were afraid that they might run aground . And having lowered the sails , they were being driven along in this way .
44027018	Then , since we were being tossed about strongly by the tempest , on the following day , they threw the heavy items overboard .
44027019	And on the third day , with their own hands , they threw the equipment of the ship overboard .
44027020	Then , when neither sun nor stars appeared for many days , and no end to the storm was imminent , all hope for our safety was now taken away .
44027021	And after they had fasted for a long time , Paul , standing in their midst , said : “ Certainly , men , you should have listened to me and not set out from Crete , so as to cause this injury and loss .
44027022	And now , let me persuade you to be courageous in soul . For there shall be no loss of life among you , but only of the ship .
44027023	For an Angel of God , who is assigned to me and whom I serve , stood beside me this night ,
44027024	saying : ‘ Do not be afraid , Paul ! It is necessary for you to stand before Caesar . And behold , God has given to you all those who are sailing with you . ’
44027025	Because of this , men , be courageous in soul . For I trust God that this will happen in the same way that it has been told to me .
44027026	But it is necessary for us to arrive at a certain island . ”
44027027	Then , after the fourteenth night arrived , as we were navigating in the sea of Adria , about the middle of the night , the sailors believed that they saw some portion of the land .
44027028	And upon dropping a weight , they found a depth of twenty paces . And some distance from there , they found a depth of fifteen paces .
44027029	Then , fearing that we might happen upon rough places , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and they were hoping for daylight to arrive soon .
44027030	Yet truly , the sailors were seeking a way to flee from the ship , for they had lowered a lifeboat into the sea , on the pretext that they were attempting to cast anchors from the bow of the ship .
44027031	So Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , “ Unless these men remain in the ship , you will not be able to be saved . ”
44027032	Then the soldiers cut the ropes to the lifeboat , and they allowed it to fall .
44027033	And when it began to be light , Paul requested that they all take food , saying : “ This is the fourteenth day that you have been waiting and continuing to fast , taking nothing .
44027034	For this reason , I beg you to accept food for the sake of your health . For not a hair from the head of any of you shall perish . ”
44027035	And when he had said these things , taking bread , he gave thanks to God in the sight of them all . And when he had broken it , he began to eat .
44027036	Then they all became more peaceful in soul . And they also took food .
44027037	Truly , we were two hundred and seventy-six souls on the ship .
44027038	And having been nourished with food , they lightened the ship , casting the wheat into the sea .
44027039	And when day had arrived , they did not recognize the landscape . Yet truly , they caught sight of a certain narrow inlet having a shore , into which they thought it might be possible to force the ship .
44027040	And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves to the sea , at the same time loosing the restraints of the rudders . And so , raising the mainsail to the gusting wind , they pressed on toward the shore .
44027041	And when we happened upon a place open to two seas , they ran the ship aground . And indeed , the bow , being immobilized , remained fixed , but truly the stern was broken by the violence of the sea .
44027042	Then the soldiers were in agreement that they should kill the prisoners , lest anyone , after escaping by swimming , might flee .
44027043	But the centurion , wanting to save Paul , prohibited it from being done . And he ordered those who were able to swim to jump in first , and to escape , and to get to the land .
44027044	And as for the others , some they carried on boards , and others on those things that belonged to the ship . And so it happened that every soul escaped to the land .
44028001	And after we had escaped , we then realized that the island was called Malta . Yet truly , the natives offered us no small amount of humane treatment .
44028002	For they refreshed us all by kindling a fire , because rain was imminent and because of the cold .
44028003	But when Paul had gathered together a bundle of twigs , and had placed them on the fire , a viper , which had been drawn to the heat , fastened itself to his hand .
44028004	And truly , when the natives saw the beast hanging from his hand , they were saying to one another : “ Certainly , this man must be a murderer , for though he escaped from the sea , vengeance will not permit him to live . ”
44028005	But shaking off the creature into the fire , he indeed suffered no ill effects .
44028006	But they were supposing that he would soon swell up , and then would suddenly fall down and die . But having waited a long time , and seeing no ill effects in him , they changed their minds and were saying that he was a god .
44028007	Now among these places were estates owned by the ruler of the island , named Publius . And he , taking us in , showed us kind hospitality for three days .
44028008	Then it happened that the father of Publius lay ill with a fever and with dysentery . Paul entered to him , and when he had prayed and had laid his hands on him , he saved him .
44028009	When this had been done , all who had diseases on the island approached and were cured .
44028010	And then they also presented us with many honors . And when we were ready to set sail , they gave us whatever we needed .
44028011	And so , after three months , we sailed in a ship from Alexandria , whose name was ‘ the Castors , ’ and which had wintered at the island .
44028012	And when we had arrived at Syracuse , we were delayed there for three days .
44028013	From there , sailing close to the shore , we arrived at Rhegium . And after one day , with the south wind blowing , we arrived on the second day at Puteoli .
44028014	There , after locating the brothers , we were asked to remain with them for seven days . And then we went on to Rome .
44028015	And there , when the brothers had heard of us , they went to meet us as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns . And when Paul had seen them , giving thanks to God , he took courage .
44028016	And when we had arrived at Rome , Paul was given permission to stay by himself , with a soldier to guard him .
44028017	And after the third day , he called together the leaders of the Jews . And when they had convened , he said to them : “ Noble brothers , I have done nothing against the people , nor against the customs of the fathers , yet I was delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
44028018	And after they held a hearing about me , they would have released me , because there was no case for death against me .
44028019	But with the Jews speaking against me , I was constrained to appeal to Caesar , though it was not as if I had any kind of accusation against my own nation .
44028020	And so , because of this , I requested to see you and to speak to you . For it is because of the hope of Israel that I am encircled with this chain . ”
44028021	But they said to him : “ We have not received letters about you from Judea , nor have any of the other new arrivals among the brothers reported or spoken anything evil against you .
44028022	But we are asking to hear your opinions from you , for concerning this sect , we know that it is being spoken against everywhere . ”
44028023	And when they had appointed a day for him , very many persons went to him at his guest quarters . And he discoursed , testifying to the kingdom of God , and persuading them about Jesus , using the law of Moses and the Prophets , from morning until evening .
44028024	And some believed the things that he was saying , yet others did not believe .
44028025	And when they could not agree among themselves , they departed , while Paul was speaking this one word : “ How well did the Holy Spirit speak to our fathers through the prophet Isaiah ,
44028026	saying : ‘ Go to this people and say to them : Hearing , you shall hear and not understand , and seeing , you shall see and not perceive .
44028027	For the heart of this people has grown dull , and they have listened with reluctant ears , and they have closed their eyes tightly , lest perhaps they might see with the eyes , and hear with the ears , and understand with the heart , and so be converted , and I would heal them . ’
44028028	Therefore , let it be known to you , that this salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles , and they shall listen to it . ”
44028029	And when he had said these things , the Jews went away from him , though they still had many questions among themselves .
44028030	Then he remained for two whole years in his own rented lodgings . And he received all who went in to him ,
44028031	preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things which are from the Lord Jesus Christ , with all faithfulness , without prohibition .
45001001	Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called as an Apostle , separated for the Gospel of God ,
45001002	which he had promised beforehand , through his Prophets , in the Holy Scriptures ,
45001003	about his Son , who was made for him from the offspring of David according to the flesh ,
45001004	the Son of God , who was predestined in virtue according to the Spirit of sanctification from the resurrection of the dead , our Lord Jesus Christ ,
45001005	through whom we have received grace and Apostleship , for the sake of his name , for the obedience of faith among all the Gentiles ,
45001006	from whom you also have been called by Jesus Christ :
45001007	To all who are at Rome , the beloved of God , called as saints . Grace to you , and peace , from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	Certainly , I give thanks to my God , through Jesus Christ , first for all of you , because your faith is being announced throughout the entire world .
45001009	For God is my witness , whom I serve in my spirit by the Gospel of his Son , that without ceasing I have kept a remembrance of you
45001010	always in my prayers , pleading that in some way , at some time , I may have a prosperous journey , within the will of God , to come to you .
45001011	For I long to see you , so that I may impart to you a certain spiritual grace to strengthen you ,
45001012	specifically , to be consoled together with you through that which is mutual : your faith and mine .
45001013	But I want you to know , brothers , that I have often intended to come to you , ( though I have been hindered even to the present time ) so that I might obtain some fruit among you also , just as also among the other Gentiles .
45001014	To the Greeks and to the uncivilized , to the wise and to the foolish , I am in debt .
45001015	So within me there is a prompting to evangelize to you also who are at Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the Gospel . For it is the power of God unto salvation for all believers , the Jew first , and the Greek .
45001017	For the justice of God is revealed within it , by faith unto faith , just as it was written : “ For the just one lives by faith . ”
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven over every impiety and injustice among those men who fend off the truth of God with injustice .
45001019	For what is known about God is manifest in them . For God has manifested it to them .
45001020	For unseen things about him have been made conspicuous , since the creation of the world , being understood by the things that were made ; likewise his everlasting virtue and divinity , so much so that they have no excuse .
45001021	For although they had known God , they did not glorify God , nor give thanks . Instead , they became weakened in their thoughts , and their foolish heart was obscured .
45001022	For , while proclaiming themselves to be wise , they became foolish .
45001023	And they exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man , and of flying things , and of four-legged beasts , and of serpents .
45001024	For this reason , God handed them over to the desires of their own heart for impurity , so that they afflicted their own bodies with indignities among themselves .
45001025	And they exchanged the truth of God for a lie . And they worshipped and served the creature , rather than the Creator , who is blessed for all eternity . Amen .
45001026	Because of this , God handed them over to shameful passions . For example , their females have exchanged the natural use of the body for a use which is against nature .
45001027	And similarly , the males also , abandoning the natural use of females , have burned in their desires for one another : males doing with males what is disgraceful , and receiving within themselves the recompense that necessarily results from their error .
45001028	And since they did not prove to have God by knowledge , God handed them over to a morally depraved way of thinking , so that they might do those things which are not fitting :
45001029	having been completely filled with all iniquity , malice , fornication , avarice , wickedness ; full of envy , murder , contention , deceit , spite , gossiping ;
45001030	slanderous , hateful toward God , abusive , arrogant , self-exalting , devisers of evil , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	foolish , disorderly ; without affection , without fidelity , without mercy .
45001032	And these , though they had known the justice of God , did not understand that those who act in such a manner are deserving of death , and not only those who do these things , but also those who consent to what is done .
45002001	For this reason , O man , each one of you who judges is inexcusable . For by that which you judge another , you condemn yourself . For you do the same things that you judge .
45002002	For we know that the judgment of God is in accord with truth against those who do such things .
45002003	But , O man , when you judge those who do such things as you yourself also do , do you think that you will escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	Or do you despise the riches of his goodness and patience and forbearance ? Do you not know that the kindness of God is calling you to repentance ?
45002005	But in accord with your hard and impenitent heart , you store up wrath for yourself , unto the day of wrath and of revelation by the just judgment of God .
45002006	For he will render to each one according to his works :
45002007	To those who , in accord with patient good works , seek glory and honor and incorruption , certainly , he will render eternal life .
45002008	But to those who are contentious and who do not acquiesce to the truth , but instead trust in iniquity , he will render wrath and indignation .
45002009	Tribulation and anguish are upon every soul of man that works evil : the Jew first , and also the Greek .
45002010	But glory and honor and peace are for all who do what is good : the Jew first , and also the Greek .
45002011	For there is no favoritism with God .
45002012	For whoever had sinned without the law , will perish without the law . And whoever had sinned in the law , will be judged by the law .
45002013	For it is not the hearers of the law who are just before God , but rather it is the doers of the law who shall be justified .
45002014	For when the Gentiles , who do not have the law , do by nature those things which are of the law , such persons , not having the law , are a law unto themselves .
45002015	For they reveal the work of the law written in their hearts , while their conscience renders testimony about them , and their thoughts within themselves also accuse or even defend them ,
45002016	unto the day when God shall judge the hidden things of men , through Jesus Christ , according to my Gospel .
45002017	But if you are called by name a Jew , and you rest upon the law , and you find glory in God ,
45002018	and you have known his will , and you demonstrate the more useful things , having been instructed by the law :
45002019	you become confident within yourself that you are a guide to the blind , a light to those who are in darkness ,
45002020	an instructor to the foolish , a teacher to children , because you have a type of knowledge and truth in the law .
45002021	As a result , you teach others , but you do not teach yourself . You preach that men should not steal , but you yourself steal .
45002022	You speak against adultery , but you commit adultery . You abominate idols , but you commit sacrilege .
45002023	You would glory in the law , but through a betrayal of the law you dishonor God .
45002024	( For because of you the name of God is being blasphemed among the Gentiles , just as it was written . )
45002025	Certainly , circumcision is beneficial , if you observe the law . But if you are a betrayer of the law , your circumcision becomes uncircumcision .
45002026	And so , if the uncircumcised keep the justices of the law , shall not this lack of circumcision be counted as circumcision ?
45002027	And that which is by nature uncircumcised , if it fulfills the law , should it not judge you , who by the letter and by circumcision are a betrayer of the law ?
45002028	For a Jew is not he who seems so outwardly . Neither is circumcision that which seems so outwardly , in the flesh .
45002029	But a Jew is he who is so inwardly . And circumcision of the heart is in the spirit , not in the letter . For its praise is not of men , but of God .
45003001	So then , what more is the Jew , or what is the usefulness of circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way : First of all , certainly , because the eloquence of God was entrusted to them .
45003003	But what if some of them have not believed ? Shall their unbelief nullify the faith of God ? Let it not be so !
45003004	For God is truthful , but every man is deceitful ; just as it was written : “ Therefore , you are justified in your words , and you will prevail when you give judgment . ”
45003005	But if even our injustice points to the justice of God , what shall we say ? Could God be unfair for inflicting wrath ?
45003006	( I am speaking in human terms . ) Let it not be so ! Otherwise , how would God judge this world ?
45003007	For if the truth of God has abounded , through my falseness , unto his glory , why should I still be judged as such a sinner ?
45003008	And should we not do evil , so that good may result ? For so we have been slandered , and so some have claimed we said ; their condemnation is just .
45003009	What is next ? Should we try to excel ahead of them ? By no means ! For we have accused all Jews and Greeks to be under sin ,
45003010	just as it was written : “ There is no one who is just .
45003011	There is no one who understands . There is no one who seeks God .
45003012	All have gone astray ; together they have become useless . There is no one who does good ; there is not even one .
45003013	Their throat is an open sepulcher . With their tongues , they have been acting deceitfully . The venom of asps is under their lips .
45003014	Their mouth is full of curses and bitterness .
45003015	Their feet are swift to shed blood .
45003016	Grief and unhappiness are in their ways .
45003017	And the way of peace they have not known .
45003018	There is no fear of God before their eyes . ”
45003019	But we know that whatever the law speaks , it speaks to those who are in the law , so that every mouth may be silenced and the entire world may be subject to God .
45003020	For in his presence no flesh shall be justified by the works of the law . For knowledge of sin is through the law .
45003021	But now , without the law , the justice of God , to which the law and the prophets have testified , has been made manifest .
45003022	And the justice of God , though the faith of Jesus Christ , is in all those and over all those who believe in him . For there is no distinction .
45003023	For all have sinned and all are in need of the glory of God .
45003024	We have been justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus ,
45003025	whom God has offered as a propitiation , through faith in his blood , to reveal his justice for the remission of the former offenses ,
45003026	and by the forbearance of God , to reveal his justice in this time , so that he himself might be both the Just One and the Justifier of anyone who is of the faith of Jesus Christ .
45003027	So then , where is your self-exaltation ? It is excluded . Through what law ? That of works ? No , but rather through the law of faith .
45003028	For we judge a man to be justified by faith , without the works of the law .
45003029	Is God of the Jews only and not also of the Gentiles ? On the contrary , of the Gentiles also .
45003030	For One is the God who justifies circumcision by faith and uncircumcision through faith .
45003031	Are we then destroying the law through faith ? Let it not be so ! Instead , we are making the law stand .
45004001	So then , what shall we say that Abraham had achieved , who is our father according to the flesh ?
45004002	For if Abraham was justified by works , he would have glory , but not with God .
45004003	For what does Scripture say ? “ Abram believed God , and it was reputed to him unto justice . ”
45004004	But for he who works , wages are not accounted according to grace , but according to debt .
45004005	Yet truly , for he who does not work , but who believes in him who justifies the impious , his faith is reputed unto justice , according to the purpose of the grace of God .
45004006	Similarly , David also declares the blessedness of a man , to whom God brings justice without works :
45004007	“ Blessed are they whose iniquities have been forgiven and whose sins have been covered .
45004008	Blessed is the man to whom the Lord has not imputed sin . ”
45004009	Does this blessedness , then , remain only in the circumcised , or is it even in the uncircumcised ? For we say that faith was reputed to Abraham unto justice .
45004010	But then how was it reputed ? In circumcision or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
45004011	For he received the sign of circumcision as a symbol of the justice of that faith which exists apart from circumcision , so that he might be the father of all those who believe while uncircumcised , so that it might also be reputed to them unto justice ,
45004012	and he might be the father of circumcision , not only for those who are of circumcision , but even for those who follow the footsteps of that faith which is in the uncircumcision of our father Abraham .
45004013	For the Promise to Abraham , and to his posterity , that he would inherit the world , was not through the law , but through the justice of faith .
45004014	For if those who are of the law are the heirs , then faith becomes empty and the Promise is abolished .
45004015	For the law works unto wrath . And where there is no law , there is no law-breaking .
45004016	Because of this , it is from faith according to grace that the Promise is ensured for all posterity , not only for those who are of the law , but also for those who are of the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all before God ,
45004017	in whom he believed , who revives the dead and who calls those things that do not exist into existence . For it is written : “ I have established you as the father of many nations . ”
45004018	And he believed , with a hope beyond hope , so that he might become the father of many nations , according to what was said to him : “ Thus shall your posterity shall be . ”
45004019	And he was not weakened in faith , nor did he consider his own body to be dead ( though he was then almost one hundred years old ) , nor the womb of Sarah to be dead .
45004020	And then , in the Promise of God , he did not hesitate out of distrust , but instead he was strengthened in faith , giving glory to God ,
45004021	knowing most fully that whatever God has promised , he is also able to accomplish .
45004022	And for this reason , it was reputed to him unto justice .
45004023	Now this has been written , that it was reputed to him unto justice , not only for his sake ,
45004024	but also for our sake . For the same shall be reputed to us , if we believe in him who raised up our Lord Jesus Christ from the dead ,
45004025	who was handed over because of our offenses , and who rose again for our justification .
45005001	Therefore , having been justified by faith , let us be at peace with God , through our Lord Jesus Christ .
45005002	For through him we also have access by faith to this grace , in which we stand firm , and to glory , in the hope of the glory of the sons of God .
45005003	And not only that , but we also find glory in tribulation , knowing that tribulation exercises patience ,
45005004	and patience leads to proving , yet truly proving leads to hope ,
45005005	but hope is not unfounded , because the love of God is poured forth in our hearts through the Holy Spirit , who has been given to us .
45005006	Yet why did Christ , while we were still infirm , at the proper time , suffer death for the impious ?
45005007	Now someone might barely be willing to die for the sake of justice , for example , perhaps someone might dare to die for the sake of a good man .
45005008	But God demonstrates his love for us in that , while we were yet sinners , at the proper time ,
45005009	Christ died for us . Therefore , having been justified now by his blood , all the more so shall we be saved from wrath through him .
45005010	For if we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son , while we were still enemies , all the more so , having been reconciled , shall we be saved by his life .
45005011	And not only that , but we also glory in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we have now received reconciliation .
45005012	Therefore , just as through one man sin entered into this world , and through sin , death ; so also death was transferred to all men , to all who have sinned .
45005013	For even before the law , sin was in the world , but sin was not imputed while the law did not exist .
45005014	Yet death reigned from Adam until Moses , even in those who have not sinned , in the likeness of the transgression of Adam , who is a figure of him who was to come .
45005015	But the gift is not entirely like the offense . For though by the offense of one , many died , yet much more so , by the grace of one man , Jesus Christ , has the grace and gift of God abounded to many .
45005016	And the sin through one is not entirely like the gift . For certainly , the judgment of one was unto condemnation , but the grace toward many offenses is unto justification .
45005017	For though , by the one offense , death reigned through one , yet so much more so shall those who receive an abundance of grace , both of the gift and of justice , reign in life through the one Jesus Christ .
45005018	Therefore , just as through the offense of one , all men fell under condemnation , so also through the justice of one , all men fall under justification unto life .
45005019	For , just as through the disobedience of one man , many were established as sinners , so also through the obedience of one man , many shall be established as just .
45005020	Now the law entered in such a way that offenses would abound . But where offenses were abundant , grace was superabundant .
45005021	So then , just as sin has reigned unto death , so also may grace reign through justice unto eternal life , through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	So what shall we say ? Should we remain in sin , so that grace may abound ?
45006002	Let it not be so ! For how can we who have died to sin still live in sin ?
45006003	Do you not know that those of us who have been baptized in Christ Jesus have been baptized into his death ?
45006004	For through baptism we have been buried with him into death , so that , in the manner that Christ rose from the dead , by the glory of the Father , so may we also walk in the newness of life .
45006005	For if we have been planted together , in the likeness of his death , so shall we also be , in the likeness of his resurrection .
45006006	For we know this : that our former selves have been crucified together with him , so that the body which is of sin may be destroyed , and moreover , so that we may no longer serve sin .
45006007	For he who has died has been justified from sin .
45006008	Now if we have died with Christ , we believe that we shall also live together with Christ .
45006009	For we know that Christ , in rising up from the dead , can no longer die : death no longer has dominion over him .
45006010	For in as much as he died for sin , he died once . But in as much as he lives , he lives for God .
45006011	And so , you should consider yourselves to be certainly dead to sin , and to be living for God in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45006012	Therefore , let not sin reign in your mortal body , such that you would obey its desires .
45006013	Nor should you offer the parts of your body as instruments of iniquity for sin . Instead , offer yourselves to God , as if you were living after death , and offer the parts of your body as instruments of justice for God .
45006014	For sin should not have dominion over you . For you are not under the law , but under grace .
45006015	What is next ? Should we sin because we are not under the law , but under grace ? Let it not be so !
45006016	Do you not know to whom you are offering yourselves as servants under obedience ? You are the servants of whomever you obey : whether of sin , unto death , or of obedience , unto justice .
45006017	But thanks be to God that , though you used to be the servants of sin , now you have been obedient from the heart to the very form of the doctrine into which you have been received .
45006018	And having been freed from sin , we have become servants of justice .
45006019	I am speaking in human terms because of the infirmity of your flesh . For just as you offered the parts of your body to serve impurity and iniquity , for the sake of iniquity , so also have you now yielded the parts of your body to serve justice , for the sake of sanctification .
45006020	For though you were once the servants of sin , you have become the children of justice .
45006021	But what fruit did you hold at that time , in those things about which you are now ashamed ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	Yet truly , having been freed now from sin , and having been made servants of God , you hold your fruit in sanctification , and truly its end is eternal life .
45006023	For the wages of sin is death . But the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Or do you not know , brothers , ( now I am speaking to those who know the law ) that the law has dominion over a man only so long as he lives ?
45007002	For example , a woman who is subject to a husband is obligated by the law while her husband lives . But when her husband has died , she is released from the law of her husband .
45007003	Therefore , while her husband lives , if she has been with another man , she should be called an adulteress . But when her husband has died , she is freed from the law of her husband , such that , if she has been with another man , she is not an adulteress .
45007004	And so , my brothers , you also have become dead to the law , through the body of Christ , so that you may be another one who has risen from the dead , in order that we may bear fruit for God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the passions of sins , which were under the law , operated within our bodies , so as to bear fruit unto death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the law of death , by which we were being held , so that now we may serve with a renewed spirit , and not in the old way , by the letter .
45007007	What should we say next ? Is the law sin ? Let it not be so ! But I do not know sin , except through the law . For example , I would not have known about coveting , unless the law said : “ You shall not covet . ”
45007008	But sin , receiving an opportunity through the commandment , wrought in me all manner of coveting . For apart from the law , sin was dead .
45007009	Now I lived for some time apart from the law . But when the commandment had arrived , sin was revived ,
45007010	and I died . And the commandment , which was unto life , was itself found to be unto death for me .
45007011	For sin , receiving an opportunity through the commandment , seduced me , and , through the law , sin killed me .
45007012	And so , the law itself is indeed holy , and the commandment is holy and just and good .
45007013	Then was what is good made into death for me ? Let it not be so ! But rather sin , in order that it might be known as sin by what is good , wrought death in me ; so that sin , through the commandment , might become sinful beyond measure .
45007014	For we know that the law is spiritual . But I am carnal , having been sold under sin .
45007015	For I do things that I do not understand . For I do not do the good that I want to do . But the evil that I hate is what I do .
45007016	So , when I do what I do not want to do , I am in agreement with the law , that the law is good .
45007017	But I am then acting not according to the law , but according to the sin which lives within me .
45007018	For I know that what is good does not live within me , that is , within my flesh . For the willingness to do good lies close to me , but the carrying out of that good , I cannot reach .
45007019	For I do not do the good that I want to do . But instead , I do the evil that I do not want to do .
45007020	Now if I do what I am not willing to do , it is no longer I who am doing it , but the sin which lives within me .
45007021	And so , I discover the law , by wanting to do good within myself , though evil lies close beside me .
45007022	For I am delighted with the law of God , according to the inner man .
45007023	But I perceive another law within my body , fighting against the law of my mind , and captivating me with the law of sin which is in my body .
45007024	Unhappy man that I am , who will free me from this body of death ?
45007025	The grace of God , by Jesus Christ our Lord ! Therefore , I serve the law of God with my own mind ; but with the flesh , the law of sin .
45008001	Therefore , there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus , who are not walking according to the flesh .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has freed me from the law of sin and death .
45008003	For though this was impossible under the law , because it was weakened by the flesh , God sent his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and because of sin , in order to condemn sin in the flesh ,
45008004	so that the justification of the law might be fulfilled in us . For we are not walking according to the flesh , but according to the spirit .
45008005	For those who are in agreement with the flesh are mindful of the things of the flesh . But those who are in agreement with the spirit are mindful of the things of the spirit .
45008006	For the prudence of the flesh is death . But the prudence of the spirit is life and peace .
45008007	And the wisdom of the flesh is inimical to God . For it is not subject to the law of God , nor can it be .
45008008	So those who are in the flesh are not able to please God .
45008009	And you are not in the flesh , but in the spirit , if it is true that the Spirit of God lives within you . But if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ , he does not belong to him .
45008010	But if Christ is within you , then the body is indeed dead , concerning sin , but the spirit truly lives , because of justification .
45008011	But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead lives within you , then he who raised up Jesus Christ from the dead shall also enliven your mortal bodies , by means of his Spirit living within you .
45008012	Therefore , brothers , we are not debtors to the flesh , so as to live according to the flesh .
45008013	For if you live according to the flesh , you will die . But if , by the Spirit , you mortify the deeds of the flesh , you shall live .
45008014	For all those who are led by the Spirit of God are the sons of God .
45008015	And you have not received , again , a spirit of servitude in fear , but you have received the Spirit of the adoption of sons , in whom we cry out : “ Abba , Father ! ”
45008016	For the Spirit himself renders testimony to our spirit that we are the sons of God .
45008017	But if we are sons , then we are also heirs : certainly heirs of God , but also co-heirs with Christ , yet in such a way that , if we suffer with him , we shall also be glorified with him .
45008018	For I consider that the sufferings of this time are not worthy to be compared with that future glory which shall be revealed in us .
45008019	For the anticipation of the creature anticipates the revelation of the sons of God .
45008020	For the creature was made subject to emptiness , not willingly , but for the sake of the One who made it subject , unto hope .
45008021	For the creature itself shall also be delivered from the servitude of corruption , into the liberty of the glory of the sons of God .
45008022	For we know that every creature groans inwardly , as if giving birth , even until now ;
45008023	and not only these , but also ourselves , since we hold the first-fruits of the Spirit . For we also groan within ourselves , anticipating our adoption as the sons of God , and the redemption of our body .
45008024	For we have been saved by hope . But a hope which is seen is not hope . For when a man sees something , why would he hope ?
45008025	But since we hope for what we do not see , we wait with patience .
45008026	And similarly , the Spirit also helps our weakness . For we do not know how to pray as we ought , but the Spirit himself asks on our behalf with ineffable sighing .
45008027	And he who examines hearts knows what the Spirit seeks , because he asks on behalf of the saints in accordance with God .
45008028	And we know that , for those who love God , all things work together unto good , for those who , in accordance with his purpose , are called to be saints .
45008029	For those whom he foreknew , he also predestinated , in conformity with the image of his Son , so that he might be the Firstborn among many brothers .
45008030	And those whom he predestinated , he also called . And those whom he called , he also justified . And those whom he justified , he also glorified .
45008031	So , what should we say about these things ? If God is for us , who is against us ?
45008032	He who did not spare even his own Son , but handed him over for the sake of us all , how could he not also , with him , have given us all things ?
45008033	Who will make an accusation against the elect of God ? God is the One who justifies ;
45008034	who is the one who condemns ? Christ Jesus who has died , and who has indeed also risen again , is at the right hand of God , and even now he intercedes for us .
45008035	Then who will separate us from the love of Christ ? Tribulation ? Or anguish ? Or famine ? Or nakedness ? Or peril ? Or persecution ? Or the sword ?
45008036	For it is as it has been written : “ For your sake , we are being put to death all day long . We are being treated like sheep for the slaughter . ”
45008037	But in all these things we overcome , because of him who has loved us .
45008038	For I am certain that neither death , nor life , nor Angels , nor Principalities , nor Powers , nor the present things , nor the future things , nor strength ,
45008039	nor the heights , nor the depths , nor any other created thing , will be able to separate us from the love of God , which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I am speaking the truth in Christ ; I am not lying . My conscience offers testimony to me in the Holy Spirit ,
45009002	because the sadness within me is great , and there is a continuous sorrow in my heart .
45009003	For I was desiring that I myself might be anathemized from Christ , for the sake of my brothers , who are my kinsmen according to the flesh .
45009004	These are the Israelites , to whom belongs adoption as sons , and the glory and the testament , and the giving and following of the law , and the promises .
45009005	Theirs are the fathers , and from them , according to the flesh , is the Christ , who is over all things , blessed God , for all eternity . Amen .
45009006	But it is not that the Word of God has perished . For not all those who are Israelites are of Israel .
45009007	And not all sons are the offspring of Abraham : “ For your offspring will be invoked in Isaac . ”
45009008	In other words , those who are the sons of God are not those who are sons of the flesh , but those who are sons of the Promise ; these are considered to be the offspring .
45009009	For the word of promise is this : “ I will return at the proper time . And there shall be a son for Sarah . ”
45009010	And she was not alone . For Rebecca also , having conceived by Isaac our father , from one act ,
45009011	when the children had not yet been born , and had not yet done anything good or bad ( such that the purpose of God might be based on their choice ) ,
45009012	and not because of deeds , but because of a calling , it was said to her : “ The elder shall serve the younger . ”
45009013	So also it was written : “ I have loved Jacob , but I have hated Esau . ”
45009014	What should we say next ? Is there unfairness with God ? Let it not be so !
45009015	For to Moses he says : “ I will pity whomever I pity . And I will offer mercy to whomever I will pity . ”
45009016	Therefore , it is not based on those who choose , nor on those who excel , but on God who takes pity .
45009017	For Scripture says to the Pharaoh : “ I have raised you up for this purpose , so that I may reveal my power by you , and so that my name may be announced to all the earth . ”
45009018	Therefore , he takes pity on whomever he wills , and he hardens whomever he wills .
45009019	And so , you would say to me : “ Then why does he still find fault ? For who can resist his will ? ”
45009020	O man , who are you to question God ? How can the thing that has been formed say to the One who formed him : “ Why have you made me this way ? ”
45009021	And does not the potter have the authority over the clay to make , from the same material , indeed , one vessel unto honor , yet truly another unto disgrace ?
45009022	What if God , wanting to reveal his wrath and to make his power known , endured , with much patience , vessels deserving wrath , fit to be destroyed ,
45009023	so that he might reveal the wealth of his glory , within these vessels of mercy , which he has prepared unto glory ?
45009024	And so it is with those of us whom he has also called , not only from among the Jews , but even from among the Gentiles ,
45009025	just as he says in Hosea : “ I will call those who were not my people , ‘ my people , ’ and she who was not beloved , ‘ beloved , ’ and she who had not obtained mercy , ‘ one who has obtained mercy . ’
45009026	And this shall be : in the place where it was said to them , ‘ You are not my people , ’ there they shall be called the sons of the living God . ”
45009027	And Isaiah cried out on behalf of Israel : “ When the number of the sons of Israel is like the sand of the sea , a remnant shall be saved .
45009028	For he shall complete his word , while abbreviating it out of equity . For the Lord shall accomplish a brief word upon the earth . ”
45009029	And it is just as Isaiah predicted : “ Unless the Lord of hosts had bequeathed offspring , we would have become like Sodom , and we would have been made similar to Gomorrah . ”
45009030	What should we say next ? That the Gentiles who did not follow justice have attained justice , even the justice that is of faith .
45009031	Yet truly , Israel , though following the law of justice , has not arrived at the law of justice .
45009032	Why is this ? Because they did not seek it from faith , but as if it were from works . For they stumbled over a stumbling block ,
45009033	just as it was written : “ Behold , I am placing a stumbling block in Zion , and a rock of scandal . But whoever believes in him shall not be confounded . ”
45010001	Brothers , certainly the will of my heart , and my prayer to God , is for them unto salvation .
45010002	For I offer testimony to them , that they have a zeal for God , but not according to knowledge .
45010003	For , being ignorant of the justice of God , and seeking to establish their own justice , they have not subjected themselves to the justice of God .
45010004	For the end of the law , Christ , is unto justice for all who believe .
45010005	And Moses wrote , about the justice that is of the law , that the man who will have done justice shall live by justice .
45010006	But the justice that is of faith speaks in this way : Do not say in your heart : “ Who shall ascend into heaven ? ” ( that is , to bring Christ down ) ;
45010007	“ Or who shall descend into the abyss ? ” ( that is , to call back Christ from the dead ) .
45010008	But what does Scripture say ? “ The word is near , in your mouth and in your heart . ” This is the word of faith , which we are preaching .
45010009	For if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus , and if you believe in your heart that God has raised him up from the dead , you shall be saved .
45010010	For with the heart , we believe unto justice ; but with the mouth , confession is unto salvation .
45010011	For Scripture says : “ All those who believe in him shall not be confounded . ”
45010012	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek . For the same Lord is over all , richly in all who call upon him .
45010013	For all those who have called upon the name of the Lord shall be saved .
45010014	Then in what way will those who have not believed in him call upon him ? Or in what way will those who have not heard of him believe in him ? And in what way will they hear of him without preaching ?
45010015	And truly , in what way will they preach , unless they have been sent , just as it has been written : “ How beautiful are the feet of those who evangelize peace , of those who evangelize what is good ! ”
45010016	But not all are obedient to the Gospel . For Isaiah says : “ Lord , who has believed our report ? ”
45010017	Therefore , faith is from hearing , and hearing is through the Word of Christ .
45010018	But I say : Have they not heard ? For certainly : “ Their sound has gone forth throughout all the earth , and their words unto the limits of the whole world . ”
45010019	But I say : Has Israel not known ? First , Moses says : “ I will lead you into a rivalry with those who are not a nation ; in the midst of a foolish nation , I will send you into wrath . ”
45010020	And Isaiah dares to say : “ I was discovered by those who were not seeking me . I appeared openly to those who were not asking about me . ”
45010021	Then to Israel he says : “ All day long I have stretched out my hands to a people who do not believe and who contradict me . ”
45011001	Therefore , I say : Has God driven away his people ? Let it not be so ! For I , too , am an Israelite of the offspring of Abraham , from the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not driven away his people , whom he foreknew . And do you not know what Scripture says in Elijah , how he calls upon God against Israel ?
45011003	“ Lord , they have slain your Prophets . They have overturned your altars . And I alone remain , and they are seeking my life . ”
45011004	But what is the Divine response to him ? “ I have retained for myself seven thousand men , who have not bent their knees before Baal . ”
45011005	Therefore , in the same way , again in this time , there is a remnant that has been saved in accord with the choice of grace .
45011006	And if it is by grace , then it is not now by works ; otherwise grace is no longer free .
45011007	What is next ? What Israel was seeking , he has not obtained . But the elect have obtained it . And truly , these others have been blinded ,
45011008	just as it was written : “ God has given them a spirit of reluctance : eyes that do not perceive , and ears that do not hear , even until this very day . ”
45011009	And David says : “ Let their table become like a snare , and a deception , and a scandal , and a retribution for them .
45011010	Let their eyes be obscured , so that they may not see , and so that they may bow down their backs always . ”
45011011	Therefore , I say : Have they stumbled in such a way that they should fall ? Let it not be so ! Instead , by their offense , salvation is with the Gentiles , so that they may be a rival to them .
45011012	Now if their offense is the riches of the world , and if their diminution is the riches of the Gentiles , how much more is their fullness ?
45011013	For I say to you Gentiles : Certainly , as long as I am an Apostle to the Gentiles , I will honor my ministry ,
45011014	in such a way that I might provoke to rivalry those who are my own flesh , and so that I may save some of them .
45011015	For if their loss is for the reconciliation of the world , what could their return be for , except life out of death ?
45011016	For if the first-fruit has been sanctified , so also has the whole . And if the root is holy , so also are the branches .
45011017	And if some of the branches are broken , and if you , being a wild olive branch , are grafted on to them , and you become a partaker of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree ,
45011018	do not glorify yourself above the branches . For though you glory , you do not support the root , but the root supports you .
45011019	Therefore , you would say : The branches were broken off , so that I might be grafted on .
45011020	Well enough . They were broken off because of unbelief . But you stand on faith . So do not choose to savor what is exalted , but instead be afraid .
45011021	For if God has not spared the natural branches , perhaps also he might not spare you .
45011022	So then , notice the goodness and the severity of God . Certainly , toward those who have fallen , there is severity ; but toward you , there is the goodness of God , if you remain in goodness . Otherwise , you also will be cut off .
45011023	Moreover , if they do not remain in unbelief , they will be grafted on . For God is able to graft them on again .
45011024	So if you have been cut off from the wild olive tree , which is natural to you , and , contrary to nature , you are grafted on to the good olive tree , how much more shall those who are the natural branches be grafted on to their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , of this mystery ( lest you seem wise only to yourselves ) that a certain blindness has occurred in Israel , until the fullness of the Gentiles has arrived .
45011026	And in this way , all of Israel may be saved , just as it was written : “ From Zion shall arrive he who delivers , and he shall turn impiety away from Jacob .
45011027	And this will be my covenant for them , when I will take away their sins . ”
