45011028	Certainly , according to the Gospel , they are enemies for your sake . But according to the election , they are most beloved for the sake of the fathers .
45011029	For the gifts and the call of God are without regret .
45011030	And just as you also , in times past , did not believe in God , but now you have obtained mercy because of their unbelief ,
45011031	so also have these now not believed , for your mercy , so that they might obtain mercy also .
45011032	For God has enclosed everyone in unbelief , so that he may have mercy on everyone .
45011033	Oh , the depths of the richness of the wisdom and knowledge of God ! How incomprehensible are his judgments , and how unsearchable are his ways !
45011034	For who has known the mind of the Lord ? Or who has been his counselor ?
45011035	Or who first gave to him , so that repayment would be owed ?
45011036	For from him , and through him , and in him are all things . To him is glory , for all eternity . Amen .
45012001	And so , I beg you , brothers , by the mercy of God , that you offer your bodies as a living sacrifice , holy and pleasing to God , with the subservience of your mind .
45012002	And do not choose to be conformed to this age , but instead choose to be reformed in the newness of your mind , so that you may demonstrate what is the will of God : what is good , and what is well-pleasing , and what is perfect .
45012003	For I say , through the grace that has been given to me , to all who are among you : Taste no more than it is necessary to taste , but taste unto sobriety and just as God has distributed a share of the faith to each one .
45012004	For just as , within one body , we have many parts , though all the parts do not have the same role ,
45012005	so also we , being many , are one body in Christ , and each one is a part , the one of the other .
45012006	And we each have different gifts , according to the grace that has been given to us : whether prophecy , in agreement with the reasonableness of faith ;
45012007	or ministry , in ministering ; or he who teaches , in doctrine ;
45012008	he who exhorts , in exhortation ; he who gives , in simplicity ; he who governs , in solicitude ; he who shows mercy , in cheerfulness .
45012009	Let love be without falseness : hating evil , clinging to what is good ,
45012010	loving one another with fraternal charity , surpassing one another in honor :
45012011	in solicitude , not lazy ; in spirit , fervent ; serving the Lord ;
45012012	in hope , rejoicing ; in tribulation , enduring ; in prayer , ever-willing ;
45012013	in the difficulties of the saints , sharing ; in hospitality , attentive .
45012014	Bless those who are persecuting you : bless , and do not curse .
45012015	Rejoice with those who are rejoicing . Weep with those who are weeping .
45012016	Be of the same mind toward one another : not savoring what is exalted , but consenting in humility . Do not choose to seem wise to yourself .
45012017	Render to no one harm for harm . Provide good things , not only in the sight of God , but also in the sight of all men .
45012018	If it is possible , in so far as you are able , be at peace with all men .
45012019	Do not defend yourselves , dearest ones . Instead , step aside from wrath . For it is written : “ Vengeance is mine . I shall give retribution , says the Lord . ”
45012020	So if an enemy is hungry , feed him ; if he is thirsty , give him a drink . For in doing so , you will heap burning coals upon his head .
45012021	Do not allow evil to prevail , instead prevail over evil by means of goodness .
45013001	Let every soul be subject to higher authorities . For there is no authority except from God and those who have been ordained by God .
45013002	And so , whoever resists authority , resists what has been ordained by God . And those who resist are acquiring damnation for themselves .
45013003	For leaders are not a source of fear to those who work good , but to those who work evil . And would you prefer not to be afraid of authority ? Then do what is good , and you shall have praise from them .
45013004	For he is a minister of God for you unto good . But if you do what is evil , be afraid . For it is not without reason that he carries a sword . For he is a minister of God ; an avenger to execute wrath upon whomever does evil .
45013005	For this reason , it is necessary to be subject , not solely because of wrath , but also because of conscience .
45013006	Therefore , you must also offer tribute . For they are the ministers of God , serving him in this .
45013007	Therefore , render to all whatever is owed . Taxes , to whom taxes is due ; revenue , to whom revenue is due ; fear , to whom fear is due ; honor , to whom honor is due .
45013008	You should owe nothing to anyone , except so as to love one another . For whoever loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law .
45013009	For example : You shall not commit adultery . You shall not kill . You shall not steal . You shall not speak false testimony . You shall not covet . And if there is any other commandment , it is summed up in this word : You shall love your neighbor as yourself .
45013010	The love of neighbor does no harm . Therefore , love is the plenitude of the law .
45013011	And we know the present time , that now is the hour for us to rise up from sleep . For already our salvation is closer than when we first believed .
45013012	The night has passed , and the day draws near . Therefore , let us cast aside the works of darkness , and be clothed with the armor of light .
45013013	Let us walk honestly , as in the daylight , not in carousing and drunkenness , not in promiscuity and sexual immorality , not in contention and envy .
45013014	Instead , be clothed with the Lord Jesus Christ , and make no provision for the flesh in its desires .
45014001	But accept those who are weak in faith , without disputing about ideas .
45014002	For one person believes that he may eat all things , but if another is weak , let him eat plants .
45014003	He who eats should not despise him who does not eat . And he who does not eat should not judge him who eats . For God has accepted him .
45014004	Who are you to judge the servant of another ? He stands or falls by his own Lord . But he shall stand . For God is able to make him stand .
45014005	For one person discerns one age from the next . But another discerns unto every age . Let each one increase according to his own mind .
45014006	He who understands the age , understands for the Lord . And he who eats , eats for the Lord ; for he gives thanks to God . And he who does not eat , does not eat for the Lord , and he gives thanks to God .
45014007	For none of us lives for himself , and none of us dies for himself .
45014008	For if we live , we live for the Lord , and if we die , we die for the Lord . Therefore , whether we live or die , we belong to the Lord .
45014009	For Christ died and rose again for this purpose : that he might be the ruler of both the dead and the living .
45014010	So then , why do you judge your brother ? Or why do you despise your brother ? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ .
45014011	For it is written : “ As I live , says the Lord , every knee shall bend to me , and every tongue shall confess to God . ”
45014012	And so , each one of us shall offer an explanation of himself to God .
45014013	Therefore , we should no longer judge one another . Instead , judge this to a greater extent : that you should not place an obstacle before your brother , nor lead him astray .
45014014	I know , with confidence in the Lord Jesus , that nothing is unclean in and of itself . But to him who considers anything to be unclean , it is unclean to him .
45014015	For if your brother is grieved because of your food , you are not now walking according to love . Do not allow your food to destroy him for whom Christ died .
45014016	Therefore , what is good for us should not be a cause of blasphemy .
45014017	For the kingdom of God is not food and drink , but rather justice and peace and joy , in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	For he who serves Christ in this , pleases God and is proven before men .
45014019	And so , let us pursue the things that are of peace , and let us keep to the things that are for the edification of one another .
45014020	Do not be willing to destroy the work of God because of food . Certainly , all things are clean . But there is harm for a man who offends by eating .
45014021	It is good to refrain from eating meat and from drinking wine , and from anything by which your brother is offended , or led astray , or weakened .
45014022	Do you have faith ? It belongs to you , so hold it before God . Blessed is he who does not judge himself in that by which he is tested .
45014023	But he who discerns , if he eats , is condemned , because it is not of faith . For all that is not of faith is sin .
45015001	But we who are stronger must bear with the feebleness of the weak , and not so as to please ourselves .
45015002	Each one of you should please his neighbor unto good , for edification .
45015003	For even Christ did not please himself , but as it was written : “ The reproaches of those who reproached you fell upon me . ”
45015004	For whatever was written , was written to teach us , so that , through patience and the consolation of the Scriptures , we might have hope .
45015005	So may the God of patience and solace grant you to be of one mind toward one another , in accord with Jesus Christ ,
45015006	so that , together with one mouth , you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	For this reason , accept one another , just as Christ also has accepted you , in the honor of God .
45015008	For I declare that Christ Jesus was the minister of circumcision because of the truth of God , so as to confirm the promises to the fathers ,
45015009	and that the Gentiles are to honor God because of his mercy , just as it was written : “ Because of this , I will confess you among the Gentiles , O Lord , and I will sing to your name . ”
45015010	And again , he says : “ Rejoice , O Gentiles , along with his people . ”
45015011	And again : “ All Gentiles , praise the Lord ; and all peoples , magnify him . ”
45015012	And again , Isaiah says : “ There shall be a root of Jesse , and he shall rise up to rule the Gentiles , and in him the Gentiles shall hope . ”
45015013	So may the God of hope fill you with every joy and with peace in believing , so that you may abound in hope and in the virtue of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	But I am also certain about you , my brothers , that you also have been filled with love , completed with all knowledge , so that you are able to admonish one another .
45015015	But I have written to you , brothers , more boldly than to the others , as if calling you to mind again , because of the grace which has been given to me from God ,
45015016	so that I may be a minister of Christ Jesus among the Gentiles , sanctifying the Gospel of God , in order that the oblation of the Gentiles may be made acceptable and may be sanctified in the Holy Spirit .
45015017	Therefore , I have glory in Christ Jesus before God .
45015018	So I dare not speak of any of those things which Christ does not effect through me , unto the obedience of the Gentiles , in word and deed ,
45015019	with the power of signs and wonders , by power of the Holy Spirit . For in this way , from Jerusalem , throughout its surroundings , as far as Illyricum , I have replenished the Gospel of Christ .
45015020	And so I have preached this Gospel , not where Christ was known by name , lest I build upon the foundation of another ,
45015021	but just as it was written : “ Those to whom he was not announced shall perceive , and those who have not heard shall understand . ”
45015022	Because of this also , I was greatly hindered in coming to you , and I have been prevented until the present time .
45015023	Yet truly now , having no other destination in these regions , and having already had a great desire to come to you over the past many years ,
45015024	when I begin to set out on my journey to Spain , I hope that , as I pass by , I may see you , and I may be guided from there by you , after first having borne some fruit among you .
45015025	But next I will set out for Jerusalem , to minister to the saints .
45015026	For those of Macedonia and Achaia have decided to make a collection for those of the poor among the saints who are at Jerusalem .
45015027	And this has pleased them , because they are in their debt . For , since the Gentiles have become partakers of their spiritual things , they also ought to minister to them in worldly things .
45015028	Therefore , when I have completed this task , and have consigned to them this fruit , I shall set out , by way of you , to Spain .
45015029	And I know that when I come to you I shall arrive with an abundance of the blessings of the Gospel of Christ .
45015030	Therefore , I beg you , brothers , through our Lord Jesus Christ and though the love of the Holy Spirit , that you assist me with your prayers to God on my behalf ,
45015031	so that I may be freed from the unfaithful who are in Judea , and so that the oblation of my service may be acceptable to the saints in Jerusalem .
45015032	So may I come to you with joy , through the will of God , and so may I be refreshed with you .
45015033	And may the God of peace be with you all . Amen .
45016001	Now I commend to you our sister Phoebe , who is in the ministry of the church , which is at Cenchreae ,
45016002	so that you may receive her in the Lord with the worthiness of the saints , and so that you may be of assistance to her in whatever task she will have need of you . For she herself has also assisted many , and myself also .
45016003	Greet Prisca and Aquila , my helpers in Christ Jesus ,
45016004	who have risked their own necks on behalf of my life , for whom I give thanks , not I alone , but also all the churches of the Gentiles ;
45016005	and greet the church at their house . Greet Epaenetus , my beloved , who is among the first-fruits of Asia in Christ .
45016006	Greet Mary , who has labored much among you .
45016007	Greet Andronicus and Junias , my kinsmen and fellow captives , who are noble among the Apostles , and who were in Christ prior to me .
45016008	Greet Ampliatus , most beloved to me in the Lord .
45016009	Greet Urbanus , our helper in Christ Jesus , and Stachys , my beloved .
45016010	Greet Apelles , who has been tested in Christ .
45016011	Greet those who are from the household of Aristobulus . Greet Herodian , my kinsman . Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus , who are in the Lord .
45016012	Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa , who labor in the Lord . Greet Persis , most beloved , who has labored much in the Lord .
45016013	Greet Rufus , elect in the Lord , and his mother and mine .
45016014	Greet Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermas , Patrobas , Hermes , and the brothers who are with them .
45016015	Greet Philologus and Julia , Nereus and his sister , and Olympas , and all the saints who are with them .
45016016	Greet one another with a holy kiss . All the churches of Christ greet you .
45016017	But I beg you , brothers , to take note of those who cause dissensions and offenses contrary to the doctrine that you have learned , and to turn away from them .
45016018	For ones such as these do not serve Christ our Lord , but their inner selves , and , through pleasing words and skillful speaking , they seduce the hearts of the innocent .
45016019	But your obedience has been made known in every place . And so , I rejoice in you . But I want you to be wise in what is good , and simple in what is evil .
45016020	And may the God of peace quickly crush Satan under your feet . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
45016021	Timothy , my fellow laborer , greets you , and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater , my kinsmen .
45016022	I , Tertius , who wrote this epistle , greet you in the Lord .
45016023	Gaius , my host , and the entire church , greets you . Erastus , the treasurer of the city , greets you , and Quartus , a brother .
45016024	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
45016025	But to him who is able to confirm you according to my Gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ , in accord with the revelation of the mystery which has been hidden from time immemorial ,
45016026	( which now has been made clear through the Scriptures of the Prophets , in accord with the precept of the eternal God , unto the obedience of faith ) which has been made known among all the Gentiles :
45016027	to God , who alone is wise , through Jesus Christ , to him be honor and glory forever and ever . Amen .
46001001	Paul , called as an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God ; and Sosthenes , a brother :
46001002	to the Church of God which is at Corinth , to those sanctified in Christ Jesus , called to be saints with all who are invoking the name of our Lord Jesus Christ in every place of theirs and of ours .
46001003	Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
46001004	I give thanks to my God continuously for you because of the grace of God that has been given to you in Christ Jesus .
46001005	By that grace , in all things , you have become wealthy in him , in every word and in all knowledge .
46001006	And so , the testimony of Christ has been strengthened in you .
46001007	In this way , nothing is lacking to you in any grace , as you await the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001008	And he , too , will strengthen you , even until the end , without guilt , until the day of the advent of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	God is faithful . Through him , you have been called into the fellowship of his Son , Jesus Christ our Lord .
46001010	And so , I beg you , brothers , by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , that every one of you speak in the same way , and that there be no schisms among you . So may you become perfect , with the same mind and with the same judgment .
46001011	For it has been indicated to me , about you , my brothers , by those who are with Chloes , that there are contentions among you .
46001012	Now I say this because each of you is saying : “ Certainly , I am of Paul ; ” “ But I am of Apollo ; ” “ Truly , I am of Cephas ; ” as well as : “ I am of Christ . ”
46001013	Has Christ been divided ? Was Paul crucified for you ? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul ?
46001014	I give thanks to God that I have baptized none of you , except Crispus and Gaius ,
46001015	lest anyone say that you have been baptized in my name .
46001016	And I also baptized the household of Stephanus . Other than these , I do not recall if I baptized any others .
46001017	For Christ did not send me to baptize , but to evangelize : not through the wisdom of words , lest the cross of Christ become empty .
46001018	For the Word of the Cross is certainly foolishness to those who are perishing . But to those who have been saved , that is , to us , it is the power of God .
46001019	For it has been written : “ I will perish the wisdom of the wise , and I will reject the discernment of the prudent . ”
46001020	Where are the wise ? Where are the scribes ? Where are the truth-seekers of this age ? Has not God made the wisdom of this world into foolishness ?
46001021	For the world did not know God through wisdom , and so , in the wisdom of God , it pleased God to accomplish the salvation of believers , through the foolishness of our preaching .
46001022	For the Jews ask for signs , and the Greeks seek wisdom .
46001023	But we are preaching Christ crucified . Certainly , to the Jews , this is a scandal , and to the Gentiles , this is foolishness .
46001024	But to those who have been called , Jews as well as Greeks , the Christ is the virtue of God and the wisdom of God .
46001025	For what is foolishness to God is considered wise by men , and that which is weakness to God is considered strong by men .
46001026	So take care of your vocation , brothers . For not many are wise according to the flesh , not many are powerful , not many are noble .
46001027	But God has chosen the foolish of the world , so that he may confound the wise . And God has chosen the weak of the world , so that he may confound the strong .
46001028	And God has chosen the ignoble and contemptible of the world , those who are nothing , so that he may reduce to nothing those who are something .
46001029	So then , nothing that is of the flesh should glory in his sight .
46001030	But you are of him in Christ Jesus , who was made by God to be our wisdom and justice and sanctification and redemption .
46001031	And so , in the same way , it was written : “ Whoever glories , should glory in the Lord . ”
46002001	And so , brothers , when I came to you , announcing to you the testimony of Christ , I did not bring exalted words or lofty wisdom .
46002002	For I did not judge myself to know anything among you , except Jesus Christ , and him crucified .
46002003	And I was with you in weakness , and in fear , and with much trembling .
46002004	And my words and preaching were not the persuasive words of human wisdom , but were a manifestation of the Spirit and of virtue ,
46002005	so that your faith would not be based on the wisdom of men , but on the virtue of God .
46002006	Now , we do speak wisdom among the perfect , yet truly , this is not the wisdom of this age , nor that of the leaders of this age , which shall be reduced to nothing .
46002007	Instead , we speak of the wisdom of God in a mystery which has been hidden , which God predestined before this age for our glory ,
46002008	something that none of the leaders of this world have known . For if they had known it , they would never have crucified the Lord of glory .
46002009	But this is just as it has been written : “ The eye has not seen , and the ear has not heard , nor has it entered into the heart of man , what things God has prepared for those who love him . ”
46002010	But God has revealed these things to us through his Spirit . For the Spirit searches all things , even the depths of God .
46002011	And who can know the things that are of a man , except the spirit which is within that man ? So also , no one knows the things which are of God , except the Spirit of God .
46002012	But we have not received the spirit of this world , but the Spirit who is of God , so that we may understand the things that have been given to us by God .
46002013	And we are also speaking of these things , not in the learned words of human wisdom , but in the doctrine of the Spirit , bringing spiritual things together with spiritual things .
46002014	But the animal nature of man does not perceive these things that are of the Spirit of God . For it is foolishness to him , and he is not able to understand it , because it must be examined spiritually .
46002015	But the spiritual nature of man judges all things , and he himself may be judged by no man .
46002016	For who has known the mind of the Lord , so that he may instruct him ? But we have the mind of Christ .
46003001	And so , brothers , I was not able to speak to you as if to those who are spiritual , but rather as if to those who are carnal . For you are like infants in Christ .
46003002	I gave you milk to drink , not solid food . For you were not yet able . And indeed , even now , you are not able ; for you are still carnal .
46003003	And since there is still envy and contention among you , are you not carnal , and are you not walking according to man ?
46003004	For if one says , “ Certainly , I am of Paul , ” while another says , “ I am of Apollo , ” are you not men ? But what is Apollo , and what is Paul ?
46003005	We are only the ministers of him in whom you have believed , just as the Lord has granted to each of you .
46003006	I planted , Apollo watered , but God provided the growth .
46003007	And so , neither he who plants , nor he who waters , is anything , but only God , who provides the growth .
46003008	Now he who plants , and he who waters , are one . But each shall receive his proper reward , according to his labors .
46003009	For we are God’s assistants . You are God’s cultivation ; you are God’s construction .
46003010	According to the grace of God , which has been given to me , I have laid the foundation like a wise architect . But another builds upon it . So then , let each one be careful how he builds upon it .
46003011	For no one is able to lay any other foundation , in place of that which has been laid , which is Christ Jesus .
46003012	But if anyone builds upon this foundation , whether gold , silver , precious stones , wood , hay , or stubble ,
46003013	each one’s work shall be made manifest . For the day of the Lord shall declare it , because it will be revealed by fire . And this fire will test each one’s work , as to what kind it is .
46003014	If anyone’s work , which he has built upon it , remains , then he will receive a reward .
46003015	If anyone’s work is burned up , he will suffer its loss , but he himself will still be saved , but only as through fire .
46003016	Do you not know that you are the Temple of God , and that the Spirit of God lives within you ?
46003017	But if anyone violates the Temple of God , God will destroy him . For the Temple of God is holy , and you are that Temple .
46003018	Let no one deceive himself . If anyone among you seems to be wise in this age , let him become foolish , so that he may be truly wise .
46003019	For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God . And so it has been written : “ I will catch the wise in their own astuteness . ”
46003020	And again : “ The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise , that they are vain . ”
46003021	And so , let no one glory in men .
46003022	For all is yours : whether Paul , or Apollo , or Cephas , or the world , or life , or death , or the present , or the future . Yes , all is yours .
46003023	But you are Christ’s , and Christ is God’s .
46004001	Accordingly , let man consider us to be ministers of Christ and attendants of the mysteries of God .
46004002	Here and now , it is required of attendants that each one be found to be faithful .
46004003	But as for me , it is such a small thing to be judged by you , or by the age of mankind . And neither do I judge myself .
46004004	For I have nothing on my conscience . But I am not justified by this . For the Lord is the One who judges me .
46004005	And so , do not choose to judge before the time , until the Lord returns . He will illuminate the hidden things of the darkness , and he will make manifest the decisions of hearts . And then each one shall have praise from God .
46004006	And so , brothers , I have presented these things in myself and in Apollo , for your sakes , so that you may learn , through us , that no one should be inflated against one person and for another , not beyond what has been written .
46004007	For what distinguishes you from another ? And what do you have that you have not received ? But if you have received it , why do you glory , as if you had not received it ?
46004008	So , now you have been filled , and now you have been made wealthy , as if to reign without us ? But I wish that you would reign , so that we , too , might reign with you !
46004009	For I think that God has presented us as the last Apostles , as those destined for death . For we have been made into a spectacle for the world , and for Angels , and for men .
46004010	So we are fools because of Christ , but you are discerning in Christ ? We are weak , but you are strong ? You are noble , but we are ignoble ?
46004011	Even to this very hour , we hunger and thirst , and we are naked and repeatedly beaten , and we are unsteady .
46004012	And we labor , working with our own hands . We are slandered , and so we bless . We suffer and endure persecution .
46004013	We are cursed , and so we pray . We have become like the refuse of this world , like the reside of everything , even until now .
46004014	I am not writing these things in order to confound you , but in order to admonish you , as my dearest sons .
46004015	For you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ , but not so many fathers . For in Christ Jesus , through the Gospel , I have begotten you .
46004016	Therefore , I beg you , be imitators of me , just as I am of Christ .
46004017	For this reason , I have sent you Timothy , who is my dearest son , and who is faithful in the Lord . He will remind you of my ways , which are in Christ Jesus , just as I teach everywhere , in every church .
46004018	Certain persons have become inflated in thinking that I would not return to you .
46004019	But I will return to you soon , if the Lord is willing . And I will consider , not the words of those who are inflated , but the virtue .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not in words , but in virtue .
46004021	What would you prefer ? Should I return to you with a rod , or with charity and a spirit of meekness ?
46005001	Above all else , it is being said that there is fornication among you , even fornication of a such kind that is not among the Gentiles , so that someone would have the wife of his father .
46005002	And yet you are inflated , and you have not instead been grieved , so that he who has done this thing would be taken away from your midst .
46005003	Certainly , though absent in body , I am present in spirit . Thus , I have already judged , as if I were present , him who has done this .
46005004	In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , you have been gathered together with my spirit , in the power of our Lord Jesus ,
46005005	to hand over such a one as this to Satan , for the destruction of the flesh , so that the spirit may be saved in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46005006	It is not good for you to glory . Do you not know that a little leaven corrupts the entire mass ?
46005007	Purge the old leaven , so that you may become the new bread , for you are unleavened . For Christ , our Passover , has now been immolated .
46005008	And so , let us feast , not with the old leaven , not with the leaven of malice and wickedness , but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46005009	As I have written to you in an epistle : “ Do not associate with fornicators , ”
46005010	certainly not with the fornicators of this world , nor with the greedy , nor with robbers , nor with the servants of idolatry . Otherwise , you ought to depart from this world .
46005011	But now I have written to you : do not associate with anyone who is called a brother and yet is a fornicator , or greedy , or a servant of idolatry , or a slanderer , or inebriated , or a robber . With such a one as this , do not even take food .
46005012	For what have I to do with judging those who are outside ? But do not even you yourselves judge those who are inside ?
46005013	For those who are outside , God will judge . But send this evil person away from yourselves .
46006001	How is it that anyone of you , having a dispute against another , would dare to be judged before the iniquitous , and not before the saints ?
46006002	Or do you not know that the saints from this age shall judge it ? And if the world is to be judged by you , are you unworthy , then , to judge even the smallest matters ?
46006003	Do you not know that we shall judge angels ? How much more the things of this age ?
46006004	Therefore , if you have matters to judge concerning this age , why not appoint those who are most contemptible in the Church to judge these things !
46006005	But I am speaking so as to shame you . Is there no one among you wise enough , so that he might be able to judge between his brothers ?
46006006	Instead , brother contends against brother in court , and this before the unfaithful !
46006007	Now there is certainly an offense among you , beyond everything else , when you have court cases against one another . Should you not accept injury instead ? Should you not endure being cheated instead ?
46006008	But you are doing the injuring and the cheating , and this toward brothers !
46006009	Do you not know that the iniquitous will not possess the kingdom of God ? Do not choose to wander astray . For neither fornicators , nor servants of idolatry , nor adulterers ,
46006010	nor the effeminate , nor males who sleep with males , nor thieves , nor the avaricious , nor the inebriated , nor slanderers , nor the rapacious shall possess the kingdom of God .
46006011	And some of you were like this . But you have been absolved , but you have been sanctified , but you have been justified : all in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God .
46006012	All is lawful to me , but not all is expedient . All is lawful to me , but I will not be driven back by the authority of anyone .
46006013	Food is for the stomach , and the stomach is for food . But God shall destroy both the stomach and food . And the body is not for fornication , but rather for the Lord ; and the Lord is for the body .
46006014	Truly , God has raised up the Lord , and he will raise us up by his power .
46006015	Do you not know that your bodies are a part of Christ ? So then , should I take a part of Christ and make it a part of a harlot ? Let it not be so !
46006016	And do you not know that whoever is joined to a harlot becomes one body ? “ For the two , ” he said , “ shall be as one flesh . ”
46006017	But whoever is joined to the Lord is one spirit .
46006018	Flee from fornication . Every sin whatsoever that a man commits is outside of the body , but whoever fornicates , sins against his own body .
46006019	Or do you not know that your bodies are the Temple of the Holy Spirit , who is in you , whom you have from God , and that you are not your own ?
46006020	For you have been bought at a great price . Glorify and carry God in your body .
46007001	Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me : It is good for a man not to touch a woman .
46007002	But , because of fornication , let each man have his own wife , and let each woman have her own husband .
46007003	A husband should fulfill his obligation to his wife , and a wife should also act similarly toward her husband .
46007004	It is not the wife , but the husband , who has power over her body . But , similarly also , it is not the husband , but the wife , who has power over his body .
46007005	So , do not fail in your obligations to one another , except perhaps by consent , for a limited time , so that you may empty yourselves for prayer . And then , return together again , lest Satan tempt you by means of your abstinence .
46007006	But I am saying this , neither as an indulgence , nor as a commandment .
46007007	For I would prefer it if you were all like myself . But each person has his proper gift from God : one in this way , yet another in that way .
46007008	But I say to the unmarried and to widows : It is good for them , if they would remain as they are , just as I also am .
46007009	But if they cannot restrain themselves , they should marry . For it is better to marry , than to be burned .
46007010	But to those who have been joined in matrimony , it is not I who commands you , but the Lord : a wife is not to separate from her husband .
46007011	But if she has separated from him , she must remain unmarried , or be reconciled to her husband . And a husband should not divorce his wife .
46007012	Concerning the rest , I am speaking , not the Lord . If any brother has an unbelieving wife , and she consents to live with him , he should not divorce her .
46007013	And if any woman has an unbelieving husband , and he consents to live with her , she should not divorce her husband .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through the believing wife , and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through the believing husband . Otherwise , your children would be unclean , whereas instead they are holy .
46007015	But if the unbeliever departs , let him depart . For a brother or sister cannot be made subject to servitude in this way . For God has called us to peace .
46007016	And how do you know , wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or how do you know , husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46007017	However , let each one walk just as the Lord has distributed to him , each one just as God has called him . And thus do I teach in all the churches .
46007018	Has any circumcised man been called ? Let him not cover his circumcision . Has any uncircumcised man been called ? Let him not be circumcised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing , and uncircumcision is nothing ; there is only the observance of the commandments of God .
46007020	Let each and every one remain in the same calling to which he was called .
46007021	Are you a servant who has been called ? Do not be concerned about it . But if you ever have the ability to be free , make use of it .
46007022	For any servant who has been called in the Lord is free in the Lord . Similarly , any free person who has been called is a servant in Christ .
46007023	You have been bought with a price . Do not be willing to become the servants of men .
46007024	Brothers , let each one , in whatever state he was called , remain in that state with God .
46007025	Now , concerning virgins , I have no commandment from the Lord . But I give counsel , as one who has obtained the mercy of the Lord , so as to be faithful .
46007026	Therefore , I consider this to be good , because of the present necessity : that it is good for a man to be such as I am .
46007027	Are you bound to a wife ? Do not seek to be freed . Are you free of a wife ? Do not seek a wife .
46007028	But if you take a wife , you have not sinned . And if a virgin has married , she has not sinned . Even so , such as these will have the tribulation of the flesh . But I would spare you from this .
46007029	And so , this is what I say , brothers : The time is short . What remains of it is such that : those who have wives should be as if they had none ;
46007030	and those who weep , as though they were not weeping ; and those who rejoice , as if they were not rejoicing ; and those who buy , as if they possessed nothing ;
46007031	and those who use the things of this world , as if they were not using them . For the figure of this world is passing away .
46007032	But I would prefer you to be without worry . Whoever is without a wife is worried about the things of the Lord , as to how he may please God .
46007033	But whoever is with a wife is worried about the things of the world , as to how he may please his wife . And so , he is divided .
46007034	And the unmarried woman and the virgin think about the things that are of the Lord , so that she may be holy in body and in spirit . But she who is married thinks about the things that are of the world , as to how she may please her husband .
46007035	Furthermore , I am saying this for your own benefit , not in order to cast a snare over you , but toward whatever is honest and whatever may provide you with the ability to be without hindrance , so as to worship the Lord .
46007036	But if any man considers himself to seem dishonorable , concerning a virgin who is of adult age , and so it ought to be , he may do as he wills . If he marries her , he does not sin .
46007037	But if he has decided firmly in his heart , and he does not have any obligation , but only the power of his free will , and if he has judged this in his heart , to let her remain a virgin , he does well .
46007038	And so , he who joins with his virgin in matrimony does well , and he who does not join with her does better .
46007039	A woman is bound under the law for as long as her husband lives . But if her husband has died , she is free . She may marry whomever she wishes , but only in the Lord .
46007040	But she will be more blessed , if she remains in this state , in accord with my counsel . And I think that I , too , have the Spirit of God .
46008001	Now concerning those things that are sacrificed to idols : we know that we all have knowledge . Knowledge puffs up , but charity builds up .
46008002	But if anyone considers himself to know anything , he does not yet know in the way that he ought to know .
46008003	For if anyone loves God , he is known by him .
46008004	But as to the foods that are immolated to idols , we know that an idol in the world is nothing , and that no one is God , except One .
46008005	For although there are things that are called gods , whether in heaven or on earth , ( if one even considers there to be many gods and many lords )
46008006	yet we know that there is only one God , the Father , from whom all things are , and in whom we are , and one Lord Jesus Christ , through whom all things are , and by whom we are .
46008007	But knowledge is not in everyone . For some persons , even now , with consent to an idol , eat what has been sacrificed to an idol . And their conscience , being infirm , becomes polluted .
46008008	Yet food does not commend us to God . For if we eat , we will not have more , and if we do not eat , we will not have less .
46008009	But be careful not to let your liberty become a cause of sin to those who are weak .
46008010	For if anyone sees someone with knowledge sitting down to eat in idolatry , will not his own conscience , being infirm , be emboldened to eat what has been sacrificed to idols ?
46008011	And should an infirm brother perish by your knowledge , even though Christ died for him ?
46008012	So when you sin in this way against the brothers , and you harm their weakened conscience , then you sin against Christ .
46008013	Because of this , if food leads my brother to sin , I will never eat meat , lest I lead my brother to sin .
46009001	Am I not free ? Am I not an Apostle ? Have I not seen Christ Jesus our Lord ? Are you not my work in the Lord ?
46009002	And if I am not an Apostle to others , yet still I am to you . For you are the seal of my Apostleship in the Lord .
46009003	My defense with those who question me is this :
46009004	Do we not have the authority to eat and to drink ?
46009005	Do we not have the authority to travel around with a woman who is a sister , just as do the other Apostles , and the brothers of the Lord , and Cephas ?
46009006	Or is it only myself and Barnabas who do not have the authority to act in this way ?
46009007	Who has ever served as a soldier and paid his own stipend ? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat from its produce ? Who pastures a flock and does not drink from the milk of the flock ?
46009008	Am I saying these things according to man ? Or does the law not also say these things ?
46009009	For it is written in the law of Moses : “ You shall not bind the mouth of an ox , while it is treading out the grain . ” Is God here concerned with the oxen ?
46009010	Or is he saying this , indeed , for our sake ? These things were written specifically for us , because he who plows , ought to plow in hope , and he who threshes , too , in hope of receiving the produce .
46009011	If we have sown spiritual things in you , is it important if we harvest from your worldly things ?
46009012	If others are sharers in this authority over you , why are we not more entitled ? And yet we have not used this authority . Instead , we bear all things , lest we give any hindrance to the Gospel of Christ .
46009013	Do you not know that those who work in the holy place eat the things that are for the holy place , and that those who serve at the altar also share with the altar ?
46009014	So , too , has the Lord ordained that those who announce the Gospel should live by the Gospel .
46009015	Yet I have used none of these things . And I have not written so that these things may be done for me . For it is better for me to die , rather than to let anyone empty out my glory .
46009016	For if I preach the Gospel , it is not glory for me . For an obligation has been laid upon me . And woe to me , if I do not preach the Gospel .
46009017	For if I do this willingly , I have a reward . But if I do this reluctantly , a dispensation is granted to me .
46009018	And what , then , would be my reward ? So , when preaching the Gospel , I should give the Gospel without taking , so that I may not misuse my authority in the Gospel .
46009019	For when I was a free man to all , I made myself the servant of all , so that I might gain all the more .
46009020	And so , to the Jews , I became like a Jew , so that I might gain the Jews .
46009021	To those who are under the law , I became as if I were under the law , ( though I was not under the law ) so that I might gain those who were under the law . To those who were without the law , I became as if I were without the law , ( though I was not without the law of God , being in the law of Christ ) so that I might gain those who were without the law .
46009022	To the weak , I became weak , so that I might gain the weak . To all , I became all , so that I might save all .
46009023	And I do everything for the sake of the Gospel , so that I may become its partner .
46009024	Do you not know that , of those who run in a race , all of them , certainly , are runners , but only one achieves the prize . Similarly , you must run , so that you may achieve .
46009025	And one who competes in a contest abstains from all things . And they do this , of course , so that they may achieve a corruptible crown . But we do this , so that we may achieve what is incorruptible .
46009026	And so I run , but not with uncertainty . And so I fight , but not by flailing in the air .
46009027	Instead , I chastise my body , so as to redirect it into servitude . Otherwise , I might preach to others , but become myself an outcast .
46010001	For I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , that our fathers were all under the cloud , and they all went across the sea .
46010002	And in Moses , they all were baptized , in the cloud and in the sea .
46010003	And they all ate of the same spiritual food .
46010004	And they all drank of the same spiritual drink . And so , they all were drinking of the spiritual rock seeking to obtain them ; and that rock was Christ .
46010005	But with most of them , God was not well-pleased . For they were struck down in the desert .
46010006	Now these things were done as an example for us , so that we might not desire evil things , just as they desired .
46010007	And so , do not take part in idolatry , as some of them did , just as it was written : “ The people sat down to eat and to drink , and then they rose up to amuse themselves . ”
46010008	And let us not commit fornication , as some of them fornicated , and so twenty-three thousand fell on one day .
46010009	And let us not tempt Christ , as some of them tempted , and so they perished by serpents .
46010010	And you should not murmur , as some of them murmured , and so they perished by the destroyer .
46010011	Now all of these things happened to them as an example , and so they have been written for our correction , because the final age has fallen upon us .
46010012	And so , whosoever considers himself to be standing , let him be careful not to fall .
46010013	Temptation should not take hold of you , except what is human . For God is faithful , and he will not permit you to be tempted beyond your ability . Instead , he will effect his Providence , even during temptation , so that you may be able to bear it .
46010014	Because of this , most beloved of mine , flee from the worship of idols .
46010015	Since I am speaking to those who are prudent , judge what I say for yourselves .
46010016	The cup of benediction that we bless , is it not a communion in the Blood of Christ ? And the bread that we break , is it not a participation in the Body of the Lord ?
46010017	Through the one bread , we , though many , are one body : all of us who are partakers of the one bread .
46010018	Consider Israel , according to the flesh . Are not those who eat from the sacrifices partakers of the altar ?
46010019	What is next ? Should I say that what is immolated to idols is anything ? Or that the idol is anything ?
46010020	But the things that the Gentiles immolate , they immolate to demons , and not to God . And I do not want you to become partakers with demons .
46010021	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord , and the cup of demons . You cannot be partakers of the table of the Lord , and partakers of the table of demons .
46010022	Or should we provoke the Lord to jealousy ? Are we stronger than he is ? All is lawful to me , but not all is expedient .
46010023	All is lawful to me , but not all is edifying .
46010024	Let no one seek for himself , but for others .
46010025	Whatever is sold in the market , you may eat , without asking questions for the sake of conscience .
46010026	“ The earth and all its fullness belong to the Lord . ”
46010027	If you are invited by any unbelievers , and you are willing to go , you may eat whatever is set before you , without asking questions for the sake of conscience .
46010028	But if anyone says , “ This has been sacrificed to idols , ” do not eat it , for the sake of the one who told you , and for the sake of conscience .
46010029	But I am referring to the conscience of the other person , not to yours . For why should my liberty be judged by the conscience of another ?
46010030	If I partake with thanksgiving , why should I be slandered over that for which I give thanks ?
46010031	Therefore , whether you eat or drink , or whatever else you may do , do everything for the glory of God .
46010032	Be without offense toward the Jews , and toward the Gentiles , and toward the Church of God ,
46010033	just as I also , in all things , please everyone , not seeking what is best for myself , but what is best for many others , so that they may be saved .
46011001	Be imitators of me , as I also am of Christ .
46011002	Now I praise you , brothers , because you are mindful of me in everything , in such a way as to hold to my precepts as I have handed them down to you .
46011003	So I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ . But the head of woman is man . Yet truly , the head of Christ is God .
46011004	Every man praying or prophesying with his head covered disgraces his head .
46011005	But every woman praying or prophesying with her head not covered disgraces her head . For it is the same as if her head were shaven .
46011006	So if a woman is not veiled , let her hair be cut off . Truly then , if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off , or to have her head shaven , then she should cover her head .
46011007	Certainly , a man ought not to cover his head , for he is the image and glory of God . But woman is the glory of man .
46011008	For man is not of woman , but woman is of man .
46011009	And indeed , man was not created for woman , but woman was created for man .
46011010	Therefore , a woman ought to have a sign of authority on her head , because of the Angels .
46011011	Yet truly , man would not exist without woman , nor would woman exist without man , in the Lord .
46011012	For just as woman came into existence from man , so also does man exist through woman . But all things are from God .
46011013	Judge for yourselves . Is it proper for a woman to pray to God unveiled ?
46011014	Does not even nature herself teach you that , indeed , if a man grows his hair long , it is a disgrace for him ?
46011015	Yet truly , if a woman grows her hair long , it is a glory for her , because her hair has been given to her as a covering .
46011016	But if anyone has a mind to be contentious , we have no such custom , nor does the Church of God .
46011017	Now I caution you , without praising , about this : that you assemble together , and not for better , but for worse .
46011018	First of all , indeed , I hear that when you assemble together in the church , there are schisms among you . And I believe this , in part .
46011019	For there must also be heresies , so that those who have been tested may be made manifest among you .
46011020	And so , when you assemble together as one , it is no longer in order to eat the Lord’s supper .
46011021	For each one first takes his own supper to eat . And as a result , one person is hungry , while another is inebriated .
46011022	Do you not have houses , in which to eat and drink ? Or do you have such contempt for the Church of God that you would confound those who do not have such contempt ? What should I say to you ? Should I praise you ? I am not praising you in this .
46011023	For I have received from the Lord what I have also delivered to you : that the Lord Jesus , on the same night that he was handed over , took bread ,
46011024	and giving thanks , he broke it , and said : “ Take and eat . This is my body , which shall be given up for you . Do this in remembrance of me . ”
46011025	Similarly also , the cup , after he had eaten supper , saying : “ This cup is the new covenant in my blood . Do this , as often as you drink it , in remembrance of me . ”
46011026	For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup , you proclaim the death of the Lord , until he returns .
46011027	And so , whoever eats this bread , or drinks from the cup of the Lord , unworthily , shall be liable of the body and blood of the Lord .
46011028	But let a man examine himself , and , in this way , let him eat from that bread , and drink from that cup .
46011029	For whoever eats and drinks unworthily , eats and drinks a sentence against himself , not discerning it to be the body of the Lord .
46011030	As a result , many are weak and sick among you , and many have fallen asleep .
46011031	But if we ourselves were discerning , then certainly we would not be judged .
46011032	Yet when we are judged , we are being corrected by the Lord , so that we might not be condemned along with this world .
46011033	And so , my brothers , when you assemble together to eat , be attentive to one another .
46011034	If anyone is hungry , let him eat at home , so that you may not assemble together unto judgment . As for the rest , I will set it in order when I arrive .
46012001	Now concerning spiritual things , I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers .
46012002	You know that when you were Gentiles , you approached mute idols , doing what you were led to do .
46012003	Because of this , I would have you know that no one speaking in the Spirit of God utters a curse against Jesus . And no one is able to say that Jesus is Lord , except in the Holy Spirit .
46012004	Truly , there are diverse graces , but the same Spirit .
46012005	And there are diverse ministries , but the same Lord .
46012006	And there are diverse works , but the same God , who works everything in everyone .
46012007	However , the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one toward what is beneficial .
46012008	Certainly , to one , through the Spirit , is given words of wisdom ; but to another , according to the same Spirit , words of knowledge ;
46012009	to another , in the same Spirit , faith ; to another , in the one Spirit , the gift of healing ;
46012010	to another , miraculous works ; to another , prophecy ; to another , the discernment of spirits ; to another , different kinds of languages ; to another , the interpretation of words .
46012011	But one and the same Spirit works all these things , distributing to each one according to his will .
46012012	For just as the body is one , and yet has many parts , so all the parts of the body , though they are many , are only one body . So also is Christ .
46012013	And indeed , in one Spirit , we were all baptized into one body , whether Jews or Gentiles , whether servant or free . And we all drank in the one Spirit .
46012014	For the body , too , is not one part , but many .
46012015	If the foot were to say , “ Because I am not the hand , I am not of the body , ” would it then not be of the body ?
46012016	And if the ear were to say , “ Because I am not the eye , I am not of the body , ” would it then not be of the body ?
46012017	If the whole body were the eye , how would it hear ? If the whole were hearing , how would it smell ?
46012018	But instead , God has placed the parts , each one of them , in the body , just as it has pleased him .
46012019	So if they were all one part , how would it be a body ?
46012020	But instead , there are many parts , indeed , yet one body .
46012021	And the eye cannot say to the hand , “ I have no need for your works . ” And again , the head cannot say to the feet , “ You are of no use to me . ”
46012022	In fact , so much more necessary are those parts of the body which seem to be weaker .
46012023	And though we consider certain parts of the body to be less noble , we surround these with more abundant dignity , and so , those parts which are less presentable end up with more abundant respect .
46012024	However , our presentable parts have no such need , since God has tempered the body together , distributing the more abundant honor to that which has the need ,
46012025	so that there might be no schism in the body , but instead the parts themselves might take care of one another .
46012026	And so , if one part suffers anything , all the parts suffer with it . Or , if one part finds glory , all the parts rejoice with it .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and parts like any part .
46012028	And indeed , God has established a certain order in the Church : first Apostles , second Prophets , third Teachers , next miracle-workers , and then the grace of healing , of helping others , of governing , of different kinds of languages , and of the interpretation of words .
46012029	Are all Apostles ? Are all Prophets ? Are all Teachers ?
46012030	Are all workers of miracles ? Do all have the grace of healing ? Do all speak in tongues ? Do all interpret ?
46012031	But be zealous for the better charisms . And I reveal to you a yet more excellent way .
46013001	If I were to speak in the language of men , or of Angels , yet not have charity , I would be like a clanging bell or a crashing cymbal .
46013002	And if I have prophecy , and learn every mystery , and obtain all knowledge , and possess all faith , so that I could move mountains , yet not have charity , then I am nothing .
46013003	And if I distribute all my goods in order to feed the poor , and if I hand over my body to be burned , yet not have charity , it offers me nothing .
46013004	Charity is patient , is kind . Charity does not envy , does not act wrongly , is not inflated .
46013005	Charity is not ambitious , does not seek for itself , is not provoked to anger , devises no evil .
46013006	Charity does not rejoice over iniquity , but rejoices in truth .
46013007	Charity suffers all , believes all , hopes all , endures all .
46013008	Charity is never torn away , even if prophecies pass away , or languages cease , or knowledge is destroyed .
46013009	For we know only in part , and we prophesy only in part .
46013010	But when the perfect arrives , the imperfect passes away .
46013011	When I was a child , I spoke like a child , I understood like a child , I thought like a child . But when I became a man , I put aside the things of a child .
46013012	Now we see through a glass darkly . But then we shall see face to face . Now I know in part , but then I shall know , even as I am known .
46013013	But for now , these three continue : faith , hope , and charity . And the greatest of these is charity .
46014001	Pursue charity . Be zealous for spiritual things , but only so that you may prophesy .
46014002	For whoever speaks in tongues , speaks not to men , but to God . For no one understands . Yet by the Spirit , he speaks mysteries .
46014003	But whoever prophesies speaks to men for edification and exhortation and consolation .
46014004	Whoever speaks in tongues edifies himself . But whoever prophesies edifies the Church .
46014005	Now I want you all to speak in tongues , but more so to prophesy . For he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks in tongues , unless perhaps he interprets , so that the Church may receive edification .
46014006	But now , brothers , if I were to come to you speaking in tongues , how would it benefit you , unless instead I speak to you in revelation , or in knowledge , or in prophecy , or in doctrine ?
46014007	Even those things that are without a soul can make sounds , whether it is a wind or a stringed instrument . But unless they present a distinction within the sounds , how will it be known which is from the pipe and which is from the string ?
46014008	For example , if the trumpet made an uncertain sound , who would prepare himself for battle ?
46014009	So it is with you also , for unless you utter with the tongue in plain speech , how will it be known what is said ? For then you would be speaking into the air .
46014010	Consider that there are so many different kinds of languages in this world , and yet none is without a voice .
46014011	Therefore , if I do not understand the nature of the voice , then I shall be like a foreigner to the one with whom I am speaking ; and he who is speaking will be like a foreigner to me .
46014012	So it is with you also . And since you are zealous for what is spiritual , seek the edification of the Church , so that you may abound .
46014013	For this reason , too , whoever speaks in tongues , let him pray for the interpretation .
46014014	So , if I pray in tongues , my spirit prays , but my mind is without fruit .
46014015	What is next ? I should pray with the spirit , and also pray with the mind . I should sing psalms with the spirit , and also recite psalms with the mind .
46014016	Otherwise , if you have blessed only with the spirit , how can someone , in a state of ignorance , add an “ Amen ” to your blessing ? For he does not know what you are saying .
46014017	In this case , certainly , you give thanks well , but the other person is not edified .
46014018	I thank my God that I speak in tongues for all of you .
46014019	But in the Church , I prefer to speak five words from my mind , so that I may instruct others also , rather than ten thousand words in tongues .
46014020	Brothers , do not choose to have the minds of children . Instead , be free of malice like infants , but be mature in your minds .
46014021	It is written in the law : “ I will speak to this people with other tongues and other lips , and even so , they will not heed me , says the Lord . ”
46014022	And so , tongues are a sign , not for believers , but for unbelievers ; and prophecies are not for unbelievers , but for believers .
46014023	If then , the entire Church were to gather together as one , and if all were to speak in tongues , and then ignorant or unbelieving persons were to enter , would they not say that you were insane ?
46014024	But if everyone prophesies , and one who is ignorant or unbelieving enters , he may be convinced by it all , because he understands it all .
46014025	The secrets of his heart are then made manifest . And so , falling to his face , he would adore God , proclaiming that God is truly among you .
46014026	What is next , brothers ? When you gather together , each one of you may have a psalm , or a doctrine , or a revelation , or a language , or an interpretation , but let everything be done for edification .
46014027	If anyone is speaking in tongues , let there be only two , or at most three , and then in turn , and let someone interpret .
46014028	But if there is no one to interpret , he should remain silent in the church , then he may speak when he is alone with God .
46014029	And let the prophets speak , two or three , and let the others discern .
46014030	But then , if something is revealed to another who is sitting , let the first one become silent .
46014031	For you are all able to prophesy one at a time , so that all may learn and all may be encouraged .
46014032	For the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets .
46014033	And God is not of dissension , but of peace , just as I also teach in all the churches of the saints .
46014034	Women should be silent in the churches . For it is not permitted for them to speak ; but instead , they should be subordinate , as the law also says .
46014035	And if they want to learn anything , let them ask their husbands at home . For it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in church .
46014036	So now , did the Word of God proceed from you ? Or was it sent to you alone ?
46014037	If anyone seems to be a prophet or a spiritual person , he should understand these things which I am writing to you , that these things are the commandments of the Lord .
46014038	If anyone does not recognize these things , he should not be recognized .
46014039	And so , brothers , be zealous to prophesy , and do not prohibit speaking in tongues .
46014040	But let everything be done respectfully and according to proper order .
46015001	And so I make known to you , brothers , the Gospel that I preached to you , which you also received , and on which you stand .
46015002	By the Gospel , too , you are being saved , if you hold to the understanding that I preached to you , lest you believe in vain .
46015003	For I handed on to you , first of all , what I also received : that Christ died for our sins , according to the Scriptures ;
46015004	and that he was buried ; and that he rose again on the third day , according to the Scriptures ;
46015005	and that he was seen by Cephas , and after that by the eleven .
46015006	Next he was seen by more than five hundred brothers at one time , many of whom remain , even to the present time , although some have fallen asleep .
46015007	Next , he was seen by James , then by all the Apostles .
46015008	And last of all , he was seen also by me , as if I were someone born at the wrong time .
46015009	For I am the least of the Apostles . I am not worthy to be called an Apostle , because I persecuted the Church of God .
46015010	But , by the grace of God , I am what I am . And his grace in me has not been empty , since I have labored more abundantly than all of them . Yet it is not I , but the grace of God within me .
46015011	For whether it is I or they : so we preach , and so you have believed .
46015012	Now if Christ is preached , that he rose again from the dead , how is it that some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
46015013	For if there is no resurrection of the dead , then Christ has not risen .
46015014	And if Christ has not risen , then our preaching is useless , and your faith is also useless .
46015015	Then , too , we would be found to be false witnesses of God , because we would have given testimony against God , saying that he had raised up Christ , when he had not raised him up , if , indeed , the dead do not rise again .
46015016	For if the dead do not rise again , then neither has Christ risen again .
46015017	But if Christ has not risen , then your faith is vain ; for you would still be in your sins .
46015018	Then , too , those who have fallen asleep in Christ would have perished .
46015019	If we have hope in Christ for this life only , then we are more miserable than all men .
46015020	But now Christ has risen again from the dead , as the first-fruits of those who sleep .
46015021	For certainly , death came through a man . And so , the resurrection of the dead came through a man
46015022	And just as in Adam all die , so also in Christ all will be brought to life ,
46015023	but each one in his proper order : Christ , as the first-fruits , and next , those who are of Christ , who have believed in his advent .
46015024	Afterwards is the end , when he will have handed over the kingdom to God the Father , when he will have emptied all principality , and authority , and power .
46015025	For it is necessary for him to reign , until he has set all his enemies under his feet .
46015026	Lastly , the enemy called death shall be destroyed . For he has subjected all things under his feet . And although he says ,
46015027	“ All things have been subjected to him , ” without doubt he does not include the One who has subjected all things to him .
46015028	And when all things will have been subjected to him , then even the Son himself will be subjected to the One who subjected all things to him , so that God may be all in all .
46015029	Otherwise , what will those who are being baptized for the dead do , if the dead do not rise again at all ? Why then are they being baptized for them ?
46015030	Why also do we endure trials every hour ?
46015031	Daily I die , by means of your boasting , brothers : you whom I have in Christ Jesus our Lord .
46015032	If , according to man , I fought with the beasts at Ephesus , how would that benefit me , if the dead do not rise again ? “ Let us eat and drink , for tomorrow we shall die . ”
46015033	Do not be led astray . Evil communication corrupts good morals .
46015034	Be vigilant , you just ones , and do not be willing to sin . For certain persons have an ignorance of God . I say this to you with respect .
46015035	But someone may say , “ How do the dead rise again ? ” or , “ What type of body do they return with ? ”
46015036	How foolish ! What you sow cannot be brought back to life , unless it first dies .
46015037	And what you sow is not the body that will be in the future , but a bare grain , such as of wheat , or of some other grain .
46015038	For God gives it a body according to his will , and according to each seed’s proper body .
46015039	Not all flesh is the same flesh . But one is indeed of men , another truly is of beasts , another is of birds , and another is of fish .
46015040	Also , there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies . But while the one , certainly , has the glory of heaven , the other has the glory of earth .
46015041	One has the brightness of the sun , another the brightness of the moon , and another the brightness of the stars . For even star differs from star in brightness .
46015042	So it is also with the resurrection of the dead . What is sown in corruption shall rise to incorruption .
46015043	What is sown in dishonor shall rise to glory . What is sown in weakness shall rise to power .
46015044	What is sown with an animal body shall rise with a spiritual body . If there is an animal body , there is also a spiritual one .
46015045	Just as it was written that the first man , Adam , was made with a living soul , so shall the last Adam be made with a spirit brought back to life .
46015046	So what is , at first , not spiritual , but animal , next becomes spiritual .
46015047	The first man , being earthly , was of the earth ; the second man , being heavenly , will be of heaven .
46015048	Such things as are like the earth are earthly ; and such things as are like the heavens are heavenly .
46015049	And so , just as we have carried the image of what is earthly , let us also carry the image of what is heavenly .
46015050	Now I say this , brothers , because flesh and blood is not able to possess the kingdom of God ; neither will what is corrupt possess what is incorrupt .
46015051	Behold , I tell you a mystery . Certainly , we shall all rise again , but we shall not all be transformed :
46015052	in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trumpet . For the trumpet will sound , and the dead will rise up , incorruptible . And we shall be transformed .
46015053	Thus , it is necessary for this corruptibility to be clothed with incorruptibility , and for this mortality to be clothed with immortality .
46015054	And when this mortality has been clothed with immortality , then the word that was written shall occur : “ Death is swallowed up in victory . ”
46015055	“ O death , where is your victory ? O death , where is your sting ? ”
46015056	Now the sting of death is sin , and the power of sin is the law .
46015057	But thanks be to God , who has given us victory through our Lord Jesus Christ .
46015058	And so , my beloved brothers , be steadfast and unmovable , abounding always in the work of the Lord , knowing that your labor is not useless in the Lord .
46016001	Now concerning the collections which are made for the saints : just as I have arranged for the churches of Galatia , so should it also be done with you .
46016002	On the first day of the week , the Sabbath , let each one of you take from himself , setting aside what will be well-pleasing to him , so that when I arrive , the collections will not have to be made then .
46016003	And when I am present , whomever you shall approve through letters , these I shall send to bear your gifts to Jerusalem .
46016004	And if it is fitting for me to go too , they shall go with me .
46016005	Now I will visit you after I have passed through Macedonia . For I will pass through Macedonia .
46016006	And perhaps I will stay with you , and even spend the winter , so that you may lead me on my way , whenever I depart .
46016007	For I am not willing to see you now only in passing , since I hope that I may remain with you for some length of time , if the Lord permits .
46016008	But I must remain at Ephesus , even until Pentecost .
46016009	For a door , great and unavoidable , has opened to me , as well as many adversaries .
46016010	Now if Timothy arrives , see to it that he may be among you without fear . For he is doing the work of the Lord , just as I also do .
46016011	Therefore , let no one despise him . Instead , lead him on his way in peace , so that he may come to me . For I am awaiting him with the brothers .
46016012	But concerning our brother , Apollo , I am letting you know that I pleaded with him greatly to go to you with the brothers , and clearly it was not his will to go at this time . But he will arrive when there is a space of time for him .
46016013	Be vigilant . Stand with faith . Act manfully and be strengthened .
46016014	Let all that is yours be immersed in charity .
46016015	And I beg you , brothers : You know the house of Stephanus , and of Fortunatus , and of Achaicus , that they are the first-fruits of Achaia , and that they have dedicated themselves to the ministry of the saints .
46016016	So you should be subject also to persons such as this , as well as to all who are cooperating and working with them .
46016017	Now I rejoice in the presence of Stephanus and Fortunatus and Achaicus , because what was lacking in you , they have supplied .
46016018	For they have refreshed my spirit and yours . Therefore , recognize persons such as this .
46016019	The churches of Asia greet you . Aquila and Priscilla greet you greatly in the Lord , with the church of their household , where I also am a guest .
46016020	All the brothers greet you . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46016021	This is a greeting from my own hand , Paul .
46016022	If anyone does not love our Lord Jesus Christ , let him be anathema ! Maran Atha .
46016023	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all .
46016024	My charity is with all of you in Christ Jesus . Amen .
47001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , and Timothy , a brother , to the church of God which is at Corinth , with all the saints who are in all of Achaia :
47001002	Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation .
47001004	He consoles us in all our tribulation , so that we too may be able to console those who are in any kind of distress , through the exhortation by which we also are being exhorted by God .
47001005	For just as the Passion of Christ abounds in us , so also , through Christ , does our consolation abound .
47001006	So , if we are in tribulation , it is for your exhortation and salvation , or if we are in consolation , it is for your consolation , or if we are exhorted , it is for your exhortation and salvation , which results in the patience endurance of the same passion which we also endure .
47001007	So may our hope for you be made firm , knowing that , just as you are participants in the suffering , so also shall you be participants in the consolation .
47001008	For we do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , about our tribulation , which happened to us in Asia . For we were weighed down beyond measure , beyond our strength , so that we became weary , even of life itself .
47001009	But we had within ourselves the response to death , so that we would not have faith in ourselves , but in God , who raises the dead .
47001010	He has rescued us , and he is rescuing us , from great peril . In him , we hope that he will continue to rescue us .
47001011	And you are assisting , with your prayers for us , so that from many persons , by that which is a gift in us , thanks may be given through many persons , because of us .
47001012	For our glory is this : the testimony of our conscience , which is found in simplicity of heart and in sincerity toward God . And it is not with worldly wisdom , but in the grace of God , that we have conversed with this world , and more abundantly toward you .
47001013	For we write nothing else to you other than what you have read and understood . And I hope that you will continue to understand , even unto the end .
47001014	And just as you have acknowledged us in our role , that we are your glory , so also you are ours , unto the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
47001015	And with this confidence , I wanted to come to you sooner , so that you might have a second grace ,
47001016	and through you to pass into Macedonia , and to return to you again from Macedonia , and so be led by you on my way to Judea .
47001017	Then , although I had intended this , did I act lightly ? Or in the things that I consider , do I consider according to the flesh , so that there would be , with me , both Yes and No ?
47001018	But God is faithful , so our word , which was set before you , was not , in him , both Yes and No .
47001019	For the Son of God , Jesus Christ , who was preached among you through us , through myself and Sylvanus and Timothy , was not Yes , and No ; but was simply Yes in him .
47001020	For whatever promises are of God are , in him , Yes . For this reason , too , through him : Amen to God for our glory .
47001021	Now the One who confirms us with you in Christ , and who has anointed us , is God .
47001022	And he has sealed us , and he has placed the pledge of the Spirit in our hearts .
47001023	But I call God as a witness to my soul , that I was lenient with you , in that I did not return to Corinth :
47001024	not because we have dominion over your faith , but because we are assistants of your joy . For by faith you stand .
47002001	But I determined this within myself , not to return again to you in sorrow .
47002002	For if I make you sorrowful , then who is it that can make me glad , except the one who is made sorrowful by me ?
47002003	And so , I wrote this same thing to you , so that I might not , when I arrive , add sorrow to sorrow for those with whom I ought to rejoice , having confidence in you in all things , so that my joy may be entirely yours .
47002004	For with much tribulation and anguish of heart , I wrote to you with many tears : not so that you would be sorrowful , but so that you might know the charity that I have more abundantly toward you .
47002005	But if anyone has brought sorrow , he has not sorrowed me . Yet , for my part , this is so that I might not burden all of you .
47002006	Let this rebuke be sufficient for someone like this , for it has been brought by many .
47002007	So then , to the contrary , you should be more forgiving and consoling , lest perhaps someone like this may be overwhelmed with excessive sorrow .
47002008	Because of this , I beg you to confirm your charity toward him .
47002009	It was for this reason , also , that I wrote , so that I might know , by testing you , whether you would be obedient in all things .
