47002010	But anyone whom you have forgiven of anything , I also forgive . And then , too , anyone I have forgiven , if I have forgiven anything , it was done in the person of Christ for your sakes ,
47002011	so that we would not be circumvented by Satan . For we are not ignorant of his intentions .
47002012	And when I had arrived at Troas , because of the Gospel of Christ , and a door had opened to me in the Lord ,
47002013	I had no rest within my spirit , because I was not able to find Titus , my brother . So , saying goodbye to them , I set out for Macedonia .
47002014	But thanks be to God , who always brings triumph to us in Christ Jesus , and who manifests the fragrance of his knowledge through us in every place .
47002015	For we are the sweet fragrance of Christ for God , both with those who are being saved and with those who are perishing .
47002016	To the one , certainly , the fragrance is of death unto death . But to the other , the fragrance is of life unto life . And concerning these things , who is so suitable ?
47002017	For we are not like many others , adulterating the Word of God . But instead , we speak with sincerity : from God , before God , and in Christ .
47003001	Must we begin again to commend ourselves ? Or are we in need ( as some are ) of epistles of commendation for you , or from you ?
47003002	You are our Epistle , written in our hearts , which is known and read by all men .
47003003	It has been made manifest that you are the Epistle of Christ , ministered by us , and written down , not with ink , but with the Spirit of the living God , and not on tablets of stone , but on the fleshly tablets of the heart .
47003004	And we have such faith , through Christ , toward God .
47003005	It is not that we are adequate to think anything of ourselves , as if anything was from us . But our adequacy is from God .
47003006	And he has made us suitable ministers of the New Testament , not in the letter , but in the Spirit . For the letter kills , but the Spirit gives life .
47003007	But if the ministration of death , engraved with letters upon stones , was in glory , ( so much so that the sons of Israel were not able to gaze intently upon the face of Moses , because of the glory of his countenance ) even though this ministration was ineffective ,
47003008	how could the ministration of the Spirit not be in greater glory ?
47003009	For if the ministration of condemnation is with glory , so much more is the ministration of justice abundant in glory .
47003010	And neither was it glorified by means of an excellent glory , though it was made illustrious in its own way .
47003011	For if even what was temporary has its glory , then what is lasting has an even greater glory .
47003012	Therefore , having such a hope , we act with much confidence ,
47003013	and not as Moses did , in placing a veil over his face , so that the sons of Israel would not gaze intently at his face . This was ineffective ,
47003014	for their minds were obtuse . And , even until this present day , the very same veil , in the readings from the Old Testament , remains not taken away ( though , in Christ , it is taken away ) .
47003015	But even until today , when Moses is read , a veil is still set over their hearts .
47003016	But when they will have been converted to the Lord , then the veil shall be taken away .
47003017	Now the Spirit is Lord . And wherever the Spirit of the Lord is , there is liberty .
47003018	Yet truly , all of us , as we gaze upon the unveiled glory of the face of the Lord , are transfigured into the same image , from one glory to another . And this is done by the Spirit of the Lord .
47004001	Therefore , since we have this ministry , and in as much as we have obtained mercy for ourselves , we are not inadequate .
47004002	For we renounce dishonorable and hidden acts , not walking by craftiness , nor by adulterating the Word of God . Instead , by the manifestation of truth , we commend ourselves to the conscience of each man before God .
47004003	But if our Gospel is in some way hidden , it is hidden to those who are perishing .
47004004	As for them , the god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers , so that the light of the Gospel of the glory of Christ , who is the image of God , would not shine in them .
47004005	For we are not preaching about ourselves , but about Jesus Christ our Lord . We are merely your servants through Jesus .
47004006	For God , who told the light to shine out of darkness , has shined a light into our hearts , to illuminate the knowledge of the splendor of God , in the person of Christ Jesus .
47004007	But we hold this treasure in earthen vessels , so that what is sublime may be of the power of God , and not of us .
47004008	In all things , we endure tribulation , yet we are not in anguish . We are constrained , yet we are not destitute .
47004009	We suffer persecution , yet we have not been abandoned . We are thrown down , yet we do not perish .
47004010	We ever carry around the mortification of Jesus in our bodies , so that the life of Jesus may also be manifested in our bodies .
47004011	For we who live are ever handed over unto death for the sake of Jesus , so that the life of Jesus may also be manifested in our mortal flesh .
47004012	Therefore , death is at work in us , and life is at work in you .
47004013	But we have the same Spirit of faith . And just as it is written , “ I believed , and for that reason I spoke , ” so we also believe , and for that reason , we also speak .
47004014	For we know that the One who raised up Jesus will raise us up also with Jesus and will place us with you .
47004015	Thus , all is for you , so that grace , abounding through many in thanksgiving , may abound to the glory of God .
47004016	For this reason , we are not insufficient . But it is as though our outer man is corrupted , while our inner man is renewed from day to day .
47004017	For though our tribulation is , at the present time , brief and light , it accomplishes in us the weight of a sublime eternal glory , beyond measure .
47004018	And we are contemplating , not the things that are seen , but the things that are unseen . For the things that are seen are temporal , whereas the things that are not seen are eternal .
47005001	For we know that , when our earthly house of this habitation is dissolved , we have a building of God , a house not made with hands , eternal in heaven .
47005002	And for this reason also , we groan , desiring to be clothed from above with our habitation from heaven .
47005003	If we are so clothed , then we will not be found to be naked .
47005004	Then too , we who are in this tabernacle groan under the burden , because we do not want to be stripped , but rather to be clothed from above , so that what is mortal may be absorbed by life .
47005005	Now the One who accomplishes this very thing in us is God , who has given us the pledge of the Spirit .
47005006	Therefore , we are ever confident , knowing that , while we are in the body , we are on a pilgrimage in the Lord .
47005007	For we walk by means of faith , and not by sight .
47005008	So we are confident , and we have the good will to be on a pilgrimage in the body , so as to be present to the Lord .
47005009	And thus we struggle , whether absent or present , to please him .
47005010	For it is necessary for us to be manifested before the judgment seat of Christ , so that each one may receive the proper things of the body , according to his behavior , whether it was good or evil .
47005011	Therefore , having knowledge of the fear of the Lord , we appeal to men , but we are made manifest before God . Yet I hope , too , that we may be made manifest in your consciences .
47005012	We are not commending ourselves again to you , but rather we are presenting you with an opportunity to glory because of us , when you deal with those who glory in face , and not in heart .
47005013	For if we are excessive in mind , it is for God ; but if we are sober , it is for you .
47005014	For the charity of Christ urges us on , in consideration of this : that if one died for all , then all have died .
47005015	And Christ died for all , so that even those who live might not now live for themselves , but for him who died for them and who rose again .
47005016	And so , from now on , we know no one according to the flesh . And though we have known Christ according to the flesh , yet now we know him in this way no longer .
47005017	So if anyone is a new creature in Christ , what is old has passed away . Behold , all things have been made new .
47005018	But all is of God , who has reconciled us to himself through Christ , and who has given us the ministry of reconciliation .
47005019	For certainly God was in Christ , reconciling the world to himself , not charging them with their sins . And he has placed in us the Word of reconciliation .
47005020	Therefore , we are ambassadors for Christ , so that God is exhorting through us . We beseech you for Christ : be reconciled to God .
47005021	For God made him who did not know sin to be sin for us , so that we might become the justice of God in him .
47006001	But , as a help to you , we exhort you not to receive the grace of God in vain .
47006002	For he says : “ In a favorable time , I heeded you ; and on the day of salvation , I helped you . ” Behold , now is the favorable time ; behold , now is the day of salvation .
47006003	May we never give offense to anyone , so that our ministry may not be disparaged .
47006004	But in all things , let us exhibit ourselves as ministers of God with great patience : through tribulation , difficulties , and distress ;
47006005	despite wounds , imprisonment , and rebellion ; with hard work , vigilance , and fasting ;
47006006	by chastity , knowledge , and longsuffering ; in pleasantness , in the Holy Spirit , and in unfeigned charity ;
47006007	with the Word of truth , with the power of God , and with the armor of justice to the right and to the left ;
47006008	through honor and dishonor , despite good reports and bad , whether seen as deceivers or truth-tellers , whether ignored or acknowledged ;
47006009	as if dying and yet truly alive ; as if chastised and yet not subdued ;
47006010	as if sorrowful and yet always rejoicing ; as if needy and yet enriching many ; as if having nothing and possessing everything .
47006011	Our mouth is open to you , O Corinthians ; our heart is enlarged .
47006012	You are not narrowed by us , but it is by your own inner selves that you are narrowed .
47006013	But since we have the same recompense , ( I am speaking as if to my own sons ) , you , too , should be enlarged .
47006014	Do not choose to bear the yoke with unbelievers . For how can justice be a participant with iniquity ? Or how can the fellowship of light be a participant with darkness ?
47006015	And how can Christ join together with Belial ? Or what part do the faithful have with the unfaithful ?
47006016	And what consensus does the temple of God have with idols ? For you are the temple of the living God , just as God says : “ I will dwell with them , and I will walk among them . And I will be their God , and they shall be my people .
47006017	Because of this , you must depart from their midst and be separate , says the Lord . And do not touch what is unclean .
47006018	Then I will accept you . And I will be a Father to you , and you shall be sons and daughters to me , says the Lord Almighty . ”
47007001	Therefore , having these promises , most beloved , let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of the flesh and of the spirit , perfecting sanctification in the fear of God .
47007002	Consider us . We have injured no one ; we have corrupted no one ; we have defrauded no one .
47007003	I am not saying this to your condemnation . For we have told you before that you are in our hearts : to die together and to live together .
47007004	Great is my confidence in you . Great is my glorying over you . I have been filled with consolation . I have a superabundant joy throughout all our tribulation .
47007005	Then , too , when we had arrived in Macedonia , our flesh had no rest . Instead , we suffered every tribulation : exterior conflicts , interior fears .
47007006	But God , who consoles the humble , consoled us by the arrival of Titus ,
47007007	and not only by his arrival , but also by the consolation with which he was consoled among you . For he brought to us your desire , your weeping , your zeal for me , so that I rejoiced all the more .
47007008	For though I made you sorrowful by my epistle , I do not repent . And if I did repent , but only for a time , having realized that the same epistle made you sorrowful ,
47007009	now I am glad : not because you were sorrowful , but because you were sorrowful unto repentance . For you became sorrowful for God , so that you might not suffer any harm from us .
47007010	For the sorrow that is according to God accomplishes a repentance which is steadfast unto salvation . But the sorrow that is of the world accomplishes death .
47007011	So consider this same idea , being sorrowful according to God , and what great solicitude it accomplishes in you : including protection , and indignation , and fear , and desire , and zeal , and vindication . In all things , you have shown yourselves to be uncorrupted by this sorrow .
47007012	And so , though I wrote to you , it was not because of him who caused the injury , nor because of him who suffered from it , but so as to manifest our solicitude , which we have for you before God .
47007013	Therefore , we have been consoled . But in our consolation , we have rejoiced even more abundantly over the joy of Titus , because his spirit was refreshed by all of you .
47007014	And if I have gloried in anything to him about you , I have not been put to shame . But , just as we have spoken all things to you in truth , so also our glorying before Titus has been the truth .
47007015	And his feelings are now more abundant toward you , since he remembers the obedience of you all , and how you received him with fear and trembling .
47007016	I rejoice that in all things I have confidence in you .
47008001	And so we are making known to you , brothers , the grace of God that has been given in the churches of Macedonia .
47008002	For within a great experience of tribulation , they have had an abundance of joy , and their profound poverty has only increased the richness of their simplicity .
47008003	And I bear witness to them , that they were willing to accept what was in accord with their ability , and even what was beyond their ability .
47008004	For they were begging us , with great exhortation , for the grace and the communication of the ministry that is with the saints .
47008005	And this is beyond what we had hoped , since they gave themselves , first of all to the Lord , and then also to us , through the will of God ,
47008006	so much so that we petitioned Titus , that in the same manner as he had begun , he would also complete in you this same grace .
47008007	But , just as in all things you abound in faith and in word and in knowledge and in all solicitude , and even more so in your charity toward us , so also may you abound in this grace .
47008008	I am speaking , not commanding . But through the solicitude of others , I approve of the good character of your charity .
47008009	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , that though he was rich , he became poor for your sakes , so that through his poverty , you might become rich .
47008010	And about this , I give my counsel . For this is useful to those of you who , only a year earlier , had just begun to act , or even to be willing to act .
47008011	So , truly now , accomplish this in deed , so that , in the same manner as your willing mind is prompted , you may also act , out of that which you have .
47008012	For when the will is prompted , it receives according to what that person has , not according to what that person does not have .
47008013	And it is not that others should be relieved , while you are troubled , but that there should be an equality .
47008014	In this present time , let your abundance supply their need , so that their abundance may also supply your need , in order that there may be an equality , just as it was written :
47008015	“ He with more did not have too much ; and he with less did not have too little . ”
47008016	But thanks be to God , who has granted to the heart of Titus , this same solicitude for you .
47008017	For certainly , he accepted the exhortation . But since he was more solicitous , he went to you of his own free will .
47008018	And we have even sent with him a brother whose praise accompanies the Gospel throughout all the churches .
47008019	And not only that , but he was also chosen by the churches to be a companion for our sojourn in this grace , which is ministered by us with our determined will , to the glory of the Lord .
47008020	So let us avoid this , lest anyone disparage us over the abundance that is ministered by us .
47008021	For we provide for what is good , not only in the sight of God , but also in the sight of men .
47008022	And we have also sent with them our brother , whom we have proven to be frequently solicitous in many matters . But now there is a greater solicitousness , which is greatly entrusted to you ;
47008023	and whether it concerns Titus , who is a companion to me and a helper to you , or whether it concerns our brothers , the Apostles of the churches , it is to the glory of Christ .
47008024	Therefore , in the sight of the churches , show them the proof of your charity and of our glorying about you .
47009001	Now , concerning the ministry that is done toward the saints , it is not necessary for me to write to you .
47009002	For I know your willing mind . I glory about you , concerning this , to the Macedonians . For Achaia has also been prepared , for the past year . And your example has inspired very many others .
47009003	Now I have sent the brothers , so that what we glory about concerning you might be not be empty in this matter , in order that ( as I have explained ) you may be prepared .
47009004	Otherwise , if the Macedonians arrive with me and find you unprepared , we ( not to mention you ) would be ashamed in this matter .
47009005	Therefore , I considered it necessary to ask the brothers to go to you in advance and to prepare this blessing as promised , and in this way , you may be ready as a blessing , not as an excess .
47009006	But I say this : Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly . And whoever sows with blessings shall also reap from blessings :
47009007	each one giving , just as he has determined in his heart , neither out of sadness , nor out of obligation . For God loves a cheerful giver .
47009008	And God is able to make every grace abound in you , so that , always having what you need in all things , you may abound unto every good work ,
47009009	just as it was written : “ He has distributed widely , he has given to the poor ; his justice remains from age to age . ”
47009010	And he who ministers seed to the sower will offer you bread to eat , and will multiply your seed , and will increase the growth of the fruits of your justice .
47009011	So then , having been enriched in all things , you may abound in all simplicity , which works thanksgiving to God through us .
47009012	For the ministration of this office not only supplies whatever the saints need , but also abounds through many thanksgivings in the Lord .
47009013	And so , through the evidence of this ministry , you glorify God by the obedience of your confession in the Gospel of Christ , and by the simplicity of your communion with them and with everyone ,
47009014	and they offer prayers for you , being solicitous about you , because of the excellent grace of God within you .
47009015	Thanks be to God for his ineffable gift .
47010001	But I myself , Paul , am begging you , through the meekness and modesty of Christ . I am certainly , by appearances , lowly among you , yet I have confidence in you , even while I am absent .
47010002	So I am petitioning you , lest I be bold , when present , with that bold confidence that I am considered to have by certain ones who judge us as if we were walking according to the flesh .
47010003	For though we walk in the flesh , we do not battle according to the flesh .
47010004	For the weapons of our battles are not carnal , yet still they are powerful with God , unto the destruction of fortifications : tearing down every counsel
47010005	and height that extols itself contrary to the wisdom of God , and leading every intellect into the captivity of obedience to Christ ,
47010006	and standing ready to repudiate every disobedience , when your own obedience has been fulfilled .
47010007	Consider the things that are in accord with appearances . If anyone trusts that by these things he belongs to Christ , let him reconsider this within himself . For just as he belongs to Christ , so also do we .
47010008	And if I were even to glory somewhat more about our authority , which the Lord has given to us for your edification , and not for your destruction , I should not be ashamed .
47010009	But let it not be said that I am scaring you by means of epistles .
47010010	For they say : “ His epistles , indeed , are weighty and strong . But his bodily presence is weak , and his speech is contemptible . ”
47010011	Let someone like this realize that whatever we are in word through epistles , while absent : we are much the same in deed , while present .
47010012	For we would not dare to interpose or compare ourselves with certain ones who commend themselves . But we measure ourselves by ourselves , and we compare ourselves with ourselves .
47010013	Thus , we will not glory beyond our measure , but rather according to the measure of the limit which God has measured out to us , a measure which extends even to you .
47010014	For we are not overextending ourselves , as if we are not able to reach as far as you are able . For we have gone even as far as you have in the Gospel of Christ .
47010015	We are not glorying immeasurably over the labors of others . Instead , we hold on to the hope of your growing faith , so as to be magnified in you , according to our own limits , but in abundance ,
47010016	and even so as to evangelize in those places that are beyond you , not in order to glory in the measure of others , but rather in those things which have already been prepared .
47010017	But whoever glories , let him glory in the Lord .
47010018	For it is not he who commends himself who is approved , but rather he whom God commends .
47011001	I wish that you would endure a small amount of my foolishness , so as to bear with me .
47011002	For I am jealous toward you , with the jealousy of God . And I have espoused you to one husband , offering you as a chaste virgin to Christ .
47011003	But I am afraid lest , as the serpent led astray Eve by his cleverness , so your minds might be corrupted and might fall away from the simplicity which is in Christ .
47011004	For if anyone arrives preaching another Christ , one whom we have not preached ; or if you receive another Spirit , one whom you have not received ; or another Gospel , one which you have not been given : you might permit him to guide you .
47011005	For I consider that I have done nothing less than the great Apostles .
47011006	For although I may be unskilled in speech , yet I am not so in knowledge . But , in all things , we have been made manifest to you .
47011007	Or did I commit a sin by humbling myself so that you would be exalted ? For I preached the Gospel of God to you freely .
47011008	I have taken from other churches , receiving a stipend from them to the benefit of your ministry .
47011009	And when I was with you and in need , I was burdensome to no one . For the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied whatever was lacking to me . And in all things , I have kept myself , and I will keep myself , from being burdensome to you .
47011010	The truth of Christ is in me , and so this glorying shall not be broken away from me in the regions of Achaia .
47011011	Why so ? Is it because I do not love you ? God knows I do .
47011012	But what I am doing , I will continue to do , so that I may take away an opportunity from those who desire an opportunity by which they may glory , so as to be considered to be like us .
47011013	For false apostles , such as these deceitful workers , are presenting themselves as if they were Apostles of Christ .
47011014	And no wonder , for even Satan presents himself as if he were an Angel of light .
47011015	Therefore , it is no great thing if his ministers present themselves as if they were ministers of justice , for their end shall be according to their works .
47011016	I say again . And let no one consider me to be foolish . Or , at least , accept me as if I were foolish , so that I also may glory a small amount .
47011017	What I am saying is not said according to God , but as if in foolishness , in this matter of glorying .
47011018	Since so many glory according to the flesh , I will glory also .
47011019	For you freely accept the foolish , though you yourselves claim to be wise .
47011020	For you permit it when someone guides you into servitude , even if he devours you , even if he takes from you , even if he is extolled , even if he strikes you repeatedly on the face .
47011021	I speak according to disgrace , as if we had been weak in this regard . In this matter , ( I speak in foolishness ) if anyone dares , I dare also .
47011022	They are Hebrews ; so am I . They are Israelites ; so am I . They are the offspring of Abraham ; so am I .
47011023	They are the ministers of Christ ( I speak as if I were less wise ) ; more so am I : with many more labors , with numerous imprisonments , with wounds beyond measure , with frequent mortifications .
47011024	On five occasions , I received forty stripes , less one , from the Jews .
47011025	Three times , I was beaten with rods . One time , I was stoned . Three times , I was shipwrecked . For a night and a day , I was in the depths of the sea .
47011026	I have made frequent journeys , through dangerous waters , in danger of robbers , in danger from my own nation , in danger from the Gentiles , in danger in the city , in danger in the wilderness , in danger in the sea , in danger from false brothers ,
47011027	with hardships and difficulties , with much vigilance , in hunger and thirst , with frequent fasts , in cold and nakedness ,
47011028	and , in addition to these things , which are external : there is my daily earnestness and solicitude for all the churches .
47011029	Who is weak , and I am not weak ? Who is scandalized , and I am not being burned ?
47011030	If it is necessary to glory , I will glory of the things that concern my weaknesses .
47011031	The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who is blessed forever , knows that I am not lying .
47011032	At Damascus , the governor of the nation under Aretas the king , watched over the city of the Damascenes , so as to apprehend me .
47011033	And , through a window , I was let down along the wall in a basket ; and so I escaped his hands .
47012001	If it is necessary ( though certainly not expedient ) to glory , then I will next tell of visions and revelations from the Lord .
47012002	I know a man in Christ , who , more than fourteen years ago ( whether in the body , I do not know , or out of the body , I do not know : God knows ) , was enraptured to the third heaven .
47012003	And I know a certain man ( whether in the body , or out of the body , I do not know : God knows ) ,
47012004	who was enraptured into Paradise . And he heard words of mystery , which it is not permitted for man to speak .
47012005	On behalf of someone like this , I will glory . But on behalf of myself , I will not glory about anything , except my infirmities .
47012006	For even though I am willing to glory , I will not be foolish . But I will speak the truth . Yet I will do so sparingly , lest anyone may consider me to be anything more than what he sees in me , or anything more than what he hears from me .
47012007	And lest the greatness of the revelations should extol me , there was given to me a prodding in my flesh : an angel of Satan , who struck me repeatedly .
47012008	Because of this , three times I petitioned the Lord that it might be taken away from me .
47012009	And he said to me : “ My grace is sufficient for you . For virtue is perfected in weakness . ” And so , willingly shall I glory in my weaknesses , so that the virtue of Christ may live within me .
47012010	Because of this , I am pleased in my infirmity : in reproaches , in difficulties , in persecutions , in distresses , for the sake of Christ . For when I am weak , then I am powerful .
47012011	I have become foolish ; you have compelled me . For I ought to have been commended by you . For I have been nothing less than those who claim to be above the measure of Apostles , even though I am nothing .
47012012	And the seal of my Apostleship has been set over you , with all patience , with signs and wonders and miracles .
47012013	For what is there that you have had which is less than the other churches , except that I myself did not burden you ? Forgive me this injury .
47012014	Behold , this is the third time I have prepared to come to you , and yet I will not be a burden to you . For I am seeking not the things that are yours , but you yourselves . And neither should the children store up for the parents , but the parents for the children .
47012015	And so , very willingly , I will spend and exhaust myself for the sake of your souls , loving you more , while being loved less .
47012016	And so be it . I have not burdened you , but instead , being astute , I obtained you by guile .
47012017	And yet , did I defraud you by means of any of those whom I sent to you ?
47012018	I asked for Titus , and I sent a brother with him . Did Titus defraud you ? Did we not walk with the same spirit ? Did we not walk in the same steps ?
47012019	Have you ever thought that we should explain ourselves to you ? We speak in the sight of God , in Christ . But all things , most beloved , are for your edification .
47012020	Yet I fear , lest perhaps , when I have arrived , I might not find you such as I would want , and I might be found by you , such as you would not want . For perhaps there may be among you : contention , envy , animosity , dissension , detraction , whispering , self-exaltation , and rebellion .
47012021	If so , then , when I have arrived , God may again humble me among you . And so , I mourn for the many who sinned beforehand , and did not repent , over the lust and fornication and homosexuality , which they have committed .
47013001	Behold , this is the third time that I am coming to you . By the mouth of two or three witnesses , every word shall stand .
47013002	I have preached when present , and I will preach now while absent , to those who sinned before , and to all the others , because , when I arrive again , I will not be lenient with you .
47013003	Do you seek evidence that it is Christ who speaks in me , who is not weak with you , but is powerful with you ?
47013004	For although he was crucified in weakness , yet he lives by the power of God . And yes , we are weak in him . But we shall live with him by the power of God among you .
47013005	Test yourselves as to whether you are in the faith . Examine yourselves . Or do you yourselves not know whether Christ Jesus is in you ? But perhaps you are reprobates .
47013006	But I hope you know that we ourselves are not reprobates .
47013007	Now we pray to God that you shall do nothing evil , not so that we may seem to be approved , but so that you may do what is good , even if we seem like reprobates .
47013008	For we cannot do anything against the truth , but only for the truth .
47013009	For we rejoice that we are weak , while you are strong . This is also what we pray for : your perfection .
47013010	Therefore , I write these things while absent , so that , when present , I may not have to act more harshly , according to the authority which the Lord has given to me , for edification and not for destruction .
47013011	As to the rest , brothers , rejoice , be perfect , be encouraged , have the same mind , have peace . And so the God of peace and love will be with you .
47013012	Greet one another with a holy kiss .
47013013	All the saints greet you .
47013014	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , and the charity of God , and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all . Amen .
48001001	Paul , an Apostle , not from men and not through man , but through Jesus Christ , and God the Father , who raised him from the dead ,
48001002	and all the brothers who are with me : to the churches of Galatia .
48001003	Grace and peace to you from God the Father , and from our Lord Jesus Christ ,
48001004	who gave himself on behalf of our sins , so that he might deliver us from this present wicked age , according to the will of God our Father .
48001005	To him is glory forever and ever . Amen .
48001006	I wonder that you have been so quickly transferred , from him who called you into the grace of Christ , over to another gospel .
48001007	For there is no other , except that there are some persons who disturb you and who want to overturn the Gospel of Christ .
48001008	But if anyone , even we ourselves or an Angel from Heaven , were to preach to you a gospel other than the one that we have preached to you , let him be anathema .
48001009	Just as we have said before , so now I say again : If anyone has preached a gospel to you , other than that which you have received , let him be anathema .
48001010	For am I now persuading men , or God ? Or , am I seeking to please men ? If I still were pleasing men , then I would not be a servant of Christ .
48001011	For I would have you understand , brothers , that the Gospel which has been preached by me is not according to man .
48001012	And I did not receive it from man , nor did I learn it , except through the revelation of Jesus Christ .
48001013	For you have heard of my former behavior within Judaism : that , beyond measure , I persecuted the Church of God and fought against Her .
48001014	And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my equals among my own kind , having proven to be more abundant in zeal toward the traditions of my fathers .
48001015	But , when it pleased him who , from my mother’s womb , had set me apart , and who has called me by his grace ,
48001016	to reveal his Son within me , so that I might evangelize him among the Gentiles , I did not next seek the consent of flesh and blood .
48001017	Neither did I go to Jerusalem , to those who were Apostles before me . Instead , I went into Arabia , and next I returned to Damascus .
48001018	And then , after three years , I went to Jerusalem to see Peter ; and I stayed with him for fifteen days .
48001019	But I saw none of the other Apostles , except James , the brother of the Lord .
48001020	Now what I am writing to you : behold , before God , I am not lying .
48001021	Next , I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia .
48001022	But I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea , which were in Christ .
48001023	For they had only heard that : “ He , who formerly persecuted us , now evangelizes the faith which he once fought . ”
48001024	And they glorified God in me .
48002001	Next , after fourteen years , I went up again to Jerusalem , taking with me Barnabas and Titus .
48002002	And I went up according to revelation , and I debated with them about the Gospel that I am preaching among the Gentiles , but away from those who were pretending to be something , lest perhaps I might run , or have run , in vain .
48002003	But even Titus , who was with me , though he was a Gentile , was not compelled to be circumcised ,
48002004	but only because of false brothers , who were brought in unknowingly . They entered secretly to spy on our liberty , which we have in Christ Jesus , so that they might reduce us to servitude .
48002005	We did not yield to them in subjection , even for an hour , in order that the truth of the Gospel would remain with you ,
48002006	and away from those who were pretending to be something . ( Whatever they might have been once , it means nothing to me . God does not accept the reputation of a man . ) And those who were claiming to be something had nothing to offer me .
48002007	But it was to the contrary , since they had seen that the Gospel to the uncircumcised was entrusted to me , just as the Gospel to the circumcised was entrusted to Peter .
48002008	For he who was working the Apostleship to the circumcised in Peter , was also working in me among the Gentiles .
48002009	And so , when they had acknowledged the grace that was given to me , James and Cephas and John , who seemed like pillars , gave to me and to Barnabas the right hand of fellowship , so that we would go to the Gentiles , while they went to the circumcised ,
48002010	asking only that we should be mindful of the poor , which was the very thing that I also was solicitous to do .
48002011	But when Cephas had arrived at Antioch , I stood against him to his face , because he was blameworthy .
48002012	For before certain ones arrived from James , he ate with the Gentiles . But when they had arrived , he drew apart and separated himself , fearing those who were of the circumcision .
48002013	And the other Jews consented to his pretense , so that even Barnabas was led by them into that falseness .
48002014	But when I had seen that they were not walking correctly , by the truth of the Gospel , I said to Cephas in front of everyone : “ If you , while you are a Jew , are living like the Gentiles and not the Jews , how is it that you compel the Gentiles to keep the customs of the Jews ? ”
48002015	By nature , we are Jews , and not of the Gentiles , sinners .
48002016	And we know that man is not justified by the works of the law , but only by the faith of Jesus Christ . And so we believe in Christ Jesus , in order that we may be justified by the faith of Christ , and not by the works of the law . For no flesh will be justified by the works of the law .
48002017	But if , while seeking to be justified in Christ , we ourselves are also found to be sinners , would then Christ be the minister of sin ? Let it not be so !
48002018	For if I rebuild the things that I have destroyed , I establish myself as a prevaricator .
48002019	For through the law , I have become dead to the law , so that I may live for God . I have been nailed to the cross with Christ .
48002020	I live ; yet now , it is not I , but truly Christ , who lives in me . And though I live now in the flesh , I live in the faith of the Son of God , who loved me and who delivered himself for me .
48002021	I do not reject the grace of God . For if justice is through the law , then Christ died in vain .
48003001	O senseless Galatians , who has so fascinated you that you would not obey the truth , even though Jesus Christ has been presented before your eyes , crucified among you ?
48003002	I wish to know only this from you : Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
48003003	Are you so foolish that , though you began with the Spirit , you would now end with the flesh ?
48003004	Have you been suffering so much without a reason ? If so , then it is in vain .
48003005	Therefore , does he who distributes the Spirit to you , and who works miracles among you , act by the works of the law , or by the hearing of the faith ?
48003006	It is just as it was written : “ Abraham believed God , and it was reputed to him unto justice . ”
48003007	Therefore , know that those who are of faith , these are the sons of Abraham .
48003008	Thus Scripture , foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith , foretold to Abraham : “ All nations shall be blessed in you . ”
48003009	And so , those who are of faith shall be blessed with faithful Abraham .
48003010	For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse . For it has been written : “ Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all the things that have been written in the book of the Law , so as to do them . ”
48003011	And , since in the law no one is justified with God , this is manifest : “ For the just man lives by faith . ”
48003012	But the law is not of faith ; instead , “ he who does these things shall live by them . ”
48003013	Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law , since he became a curse for us . For it is written : “ Cursed is anyone who hangs from a tree . ”
48003014	This was so that the blessing of Abraham might reach the Gentiles through Christ Jesus , in order that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith .
48003015	Brothers ( I speak according to man ) , if a man’s testament has been confirmed , no one would reject it or add to it .
48003016	The promises were made to Abraham and to his offspring . He did not say , “ and to descendents , ” as if to many , but instead , as if to one , he said , “ and to your offspring , ” who is Christ .
48003017	But I say this : the testament confirmed by God , which , after four hundred and thirty years became the Law , does not nullify , so as to make the promise empty .
48003018	For if the inheritance is of the law , then it is no longer of the promise . But God bestowed it to Abraham through the promise .
48003019	Why , then , was there a law ? It was established because of transgressions , until the offspring would arrive , to whom he made the promise , ordained by Angels through the hand of a mediator .
48003020	Now a mediator is not of one , yet God is one .
48003021	So then , was the law contrary to the promises of God ? Let it not be so ! For if a law had been given , which was able to give life , truly justice would be of the law .
48003022	But Scripture has enclosed everything under sin , so that the promise , by the faith of Jesus Christ , might be given to those who believe .
48003023	But before the faith arrived , we were preserved by being enclosed under the law , unto that faith which was to be revealed .
48003024	And so the law was our guardian in Christ , in order that we might be justified by faith .
48003025	But now that faith has arrived , we are no longer under a guardian .
48003026	For you are all sons of God , through the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
48003027	For as many of you as have been baptized in Christ have become clothed with Christ .
48003028	There is neither Jew nor Greek ; there is neither servant nor free ; there is neither male nor female . For you are all one in Christ Jesus .
48003029	And if you are Christ’s , then are you the offspring of Abraham , heirs according to the promise .
48004001	But I say that , during the time an heir is a child , he is no different from a servant , even though he is the owner of everything .
48004002	For he is under tutors and caretakers , until the time which was predetermined by the father .
48004003	So also we , when we were children , were subservient to the influences of the world .
48004004	But when the fullness of time arrived , God sent his Son , formed from a woman , formed under the law ,
48004005	so that he might redeem those who were under the law , in order that we might receive the adoption of sons .
48004006	Therefore , because you are sons , God has sent the Spirit of his Son into your hearts , crying out : “ Abba , Father . ”
48004007	And so now he is not a servant , but a son . But if he is a son , then he is also an heir , through God .
48004008	But then , certainly , while ignorant of God , you served those who , by nature , are not gods .
48004009	But now , since you have known God , or rather , since you have been known by God : how can you turn away again , to weak and destitute influences , which you desire to serve anew ?
48004010	You serve the days , and months , and times , and years .
48004011	I am afraid for you , lest perhaps I may have labored in vain among you .
48004012	Brothers , I beg you . Be as I am . For I , too , am like you . You have not injured me at all .
48004013	But you know that , in the weakness of the flesh , I have preached the Gospel to you for a long time , and that your trials are in my flesh .
48004014	You did not despise or reject me . But instead , you accepted me like an Angel of God , even like Christ Jesus .
48004015	Therefore , where is your happiness ? For I offer to you testimony that , if it could be done , you would have plucked out your own eyes and would have given them to me .
48004016	So then , have I become your enemy by telling you the truth ?
48004017	They are not imitating you well . And they are willing to exclude you , so that you might imitate them .
48004018	But be imitators of what is good , always in a good way , and not only when I am present with you .
48004019	My little sons , I am giving birth to you again , until Christ is formed in you .
48004020	And I would willingly be present with you , even now . But I would alter my voice : for I am ashamed of you .
48004021	Tell me , you who desire to be under the law , have you not read the law ?
48004022	For it is written that Abraham had two sons : one by a servant woman , and one by a free woman .
48004023	And he who was of the servant was born according to the flesh . But he who was of the free woman was born by the promise .
48004024	These things are said through an allegory . For these represent the two testaments . Certainly the one , on Mount Sinai , gives birth unto servitude , which is Hagar .
48004025	For Sinai is a mountain in Arabia , which is related to the Jerusalem of the present time , and it serves with her sons .
48004026	But that Jerusalem which is above is free ; the same is our mother .
48004027	For it was written : “ Rejoice , O barren one , though you do not conceive . Burst forth and cry out , though you do not give birth . For many are the children of the desolate , even more than of her who has a husband . ”
48004028	Now we , brothers , like Isaac , are sons of the promise .
48004029	But just as then , he who was born according to the flesh persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit , so also it is now .
48004030	And what does Scripture say ? “ Cast out the woman servant and her son . For the son of a servant women shall not be an heir with the son of a free woman . ”
48004031	And so , brothers , we are not the sons of the servant woman , but rather of the free woman . And this is the freedom with which Christ has set us free .
48005001	Stand firm , and do not be willing to be again held by the yoke of servitude .
48005002	Behold , I , Paul , say to you , that if you have been circumcised , Christ will be of no benefit to you .
48005003	For I again testify , about every man circumcising himself , that he is obligated to act according to the entire law .
48005004	You are being emptied of Christ , you who are being justified by the law . You have fallen from grace .
48005005	For in spirit , by faith , we await the hope of justice .
48005006	For in Christ Jesus , neither circumcision nor uncircumcision prevails over anything , but only faith which works through charity .
48005007	You have run well . So what has impeded you , that you would not obey the truth ?
48005008	This kind of influence is not from him who is calling you .
48005009	A little leaven corrupts the whole mass .
48005010	I have confidence in you , in the Lord , that you will accept nothing of the kind . However , he who disturbs you shall bear the judgment , whomever he may be .
48005011	And as for me , brothers , if I still preach circumcision , why am I still suffering persecution ? For then the scandal of the Cross would be made empty .
48005012	And I wish that those who disturb you would be torn away .
48005013	For you , brothers , have been called to liberty . Only you must not make liberty into an occasion for the flesh , but instead , serve one another through the charity of the Spirit .
48005014	For the entire law is fulfilled by one word : “ You shall love your neighbor as yourself . ”
48005015	But if you bite and devour one another , be careful that you are not consumed by one another !
48005016	So then , I say : Walk in the spirit , and you will not fulfill the desires of the flesh .
48005017	For the flesh desires against the spirit , and the spirit against the flesh . And since these are against one another , you may not do whatever you want .
48005018	But if you are led by the Spirit , you are not under the law .
48005019	Now the works of the flesh are manifest ; they are : fornication , lust , homosexuality , self-indulgence ,
48005020	the serving of idols , drug use , hostility , contentiousness , jealousy , wrath , quarrels , dissensions , divisions ,
48005021	envy , murder , inebriation , carousing , and similar things . About these things , I continue to preach to you , as I have preached to you : that those who act in this way shall not obtain the kingdom of God .
48005022	But the fruit of the Spirit is charity , joy , peace , patience , kindness , goodness , forbearance ,
48005023	meekness , faith , modesty , abstinence , chastity . There is no law against such things .
48005024	For those who are Christ’s have crucified their flesh , along with its vices and desires .
48005025	If we live by the Spirit , we should also walk by the Spirit .
48005026	Let us not become desirous of empty glory , provoking one another , envying one another .
48006001	And , brothers , if a man has been overtaken by any offense , you who are spiritual should instruct someone like this with a spirit of leniency , considering that you yourselves might also be tempted .
48006002	Carry one another’s burdens , and so shall you fulfill the law of Christ .
48006003	For if anyone considers himself to be something , though he may be nothing , he deceives himself .
48006004	So let each one prove his own work . And in this way , he shall have glory in himself only , and not in another .
48006005	For each one shall carry his own burden .
48006006	And let him who is being taught the Word discuss it with him who is teaching it to him , in every good way .
48006007	Do not choose to wander astray . God is not to be ridiculed .
48006008	For whatever a man will have sown , that also shall he reap . For whoever sows in his flesh , from the flesh he shall also reap corruption . But whoever sows in the Spirit , from the Spirit he shall reap eternal life .
48006009	And so , let us not be deficient in doing good . For in due time , we shall reap without fail .
48006010	Therefore , while we have time , we should do good works toward everyone , and most of all toward those who are of the household of the faith .
48006011	Consider what kind of letters I have written to you with my own hand .
48006012	For as many of you as they desire to please in the flesh , they compel to be circumcised , but only so that they might not suffer the persecution of the cross of Christ .
48006013	And yet , neither do they themselves , who are circumcised , keep the law . Instead , they want you to be circumcised , so that they may glory in your flesh .
48006014	But far be it from me to glory , except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom the world is crucified to me , and I to the world .
48006015	For in Christ Jesus , neither circumcision nor uncircumcision prevails in any way , but instead there is a new creature .
48006016	And whoever follows this rule : may peace and mercy be upon them , and upon the Israel of God .
48006017	Concerning other matters , let no one trouble me . For I carry the stigmata of the Lord Jesus in my body .
48006018	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit , brothers . Amen .
49001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God , to all the saints who are at Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus .
49001002	Grace and peace to you from God the Father , and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
49001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavens , in Christ ,
49001004	just as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world , so that we would be holy and immaculate in his sight , in charity .
49001005	He has predestined us to adoption as sons , through Jesus Christ , in himself , according to the purpose of his will ,
49001006	for the praise of the glory of his grace , with which he has gifted us in his beloved Son .
49001007	In him , we have redemption through his blood : the remission of sins in accord with the riches of his grace ,
49001008	which is superabundant in us , with all wisdom and prudence .
49001009	So does he make known to us the mystery of his will , which he has set forth in Christ , in a manner well-pleasing to him ,
49001010	in the dispensation of the fullness of time , so as to renew in Christ everything that exists through him in heaven and on earth .
49001011	In him , we too are called to our portion , having been predestined in accord with the plan of the One who accomplishes all things by the counsel of his will .
49001012	So may we be , to the praise of his glory , we who have hoped beforehand in Christ .
49001013	In him , you also , after you heard and believed the Word of truth , which is the Gospel of your salvation , were sealed with the Holy Spirit of the Promise .
49001014	He is the pledge of our inheritance , unto the acquisition of redemption , to the praise of his glory .
49001015	Because of this , and hearing of your faith that is in the Lord Jesus , and of your love toward all the saints ,
49001016	I have not ceased giving thanks for you , calling you to mind in my prayers ,
49001017	so that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of glory , may give a spirit of wisdom and of revelation to you , in knowledge of him .
49001018	May the eyes of your heart be illuminated , so that you may know what is the hope of his calling , and the wealth of the glory of his inheritance with the saints ,
49001019	and the preeminent magnitude of his virtue toward us , toward we who believe in accord with the work of his powerful virtue ,
49001020	which he wrought in Christ , raising him from the dead and establishing him at his right hand in the heavens ,
49001021	above every principality and power and virtue and dominion , and above every name that is given , not only in this age , but even in the future age .
49001022	And he has subjected all things under his feet , and he has made him the head over the entire Church ,
49001023	which is his body and which is the fullness of him who accomplishes everything in everyone .
49002001	And you were once dead in your sins and offenses ,
49002002	in which you walked in times past , according to the age of this world , according to the prince of the power of this sky , the spirit who now works in the sons of distrust .
49002003	And we too were all conversant in these things , in times past , by the desires of our flesh , acting according to the will of the flesh and according to our own thoughts . And so we were , by nature , sons of wrath , even like the others .
49002004	Yet still , God , who is rich in mercy , for the sake of his exceedingly great charity with which he loved us ,
49002005	even when we were dead in our sins , has enlivened us together in Christ , by whose grace you have been saved .
49002006	And he has raised us up together , and he has caused us to sit down together in the heavens , in Christ Jesus ,
49002007	so that he may display , in the ages soon to arrive , the abundant wealth of his grace , by his goodness toward us in Christ Jesus .
49002008	For by grace , you have been saved through faith . And this is not of yourselves , for it is a gift of God .
49002009	And this is not of works , so that no one may glory .
49002010	For we are his handiwork , created in Christ Jesus for the good works which God has prepared and in which we should walk .
49002011	Because of this , be mindful that , in times past , you were Gentiles in the flesh , and that you were called uncircumcised by those who are called circumcised in the flesh , something done by man ,
49002012	and that you were , in that time , without Christ , being foreign to the way of life of Israel , being visitors to the testament , having no hope of the promise , and being without God in this world .
49002013	But now , in Christ Jesus , you , who were in times past far away , have been brought near by the blood of Christ .
49002014	For he is our peace . He made the two into one , by dissolving the intermediate wall of separation , of opposition , by his flesh ,
49002015	emptying the law of commandments by decree , so that he might join these two , in himself , into one new man , making peace
49002016	and reconciling both to God , in one body , through the cross , destroying this opposition in himself .
49002017	And upon arriving , he evangelized peace to you who were far away , and peace to those who were near .
49002018	For by him , we both have access , in the one Spirit , to the Father .
49002019	Now , therefore , you are no longer visitors and new arrivals . Instead , you are citizens among the saints in the household of God ,
49002020	having been built upon the foundation of the Apostles and of the Prophets , with Jesus Christ himself as the preeminent cornerstone .
49002021	In him , all that has been built is framed together , rising up into a holy temple in the Lord .
49002022	In him , you also have been built together into a habitation of God in the Spirit .
49003001	By reason of this grace , I , Paul , am a prisoner of Jesus Christ , for the sake of you Gentiles .
49003002	Now certainly , you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God , which has been given to me among you :
49003003	that , by means of revelation , the mystery was made known to me , just as I have written above in a few words .
49003004	Yet , by reading this closely , you might be able to understand my prudence in the mystery of Christ .
49003005	In other generations , this was unknown to the sons of men , even as it has now been revealed to his holy Apostles and Prophets in the Spirit ,
49003006	so that the Gentiles would be co-heirs , and of the same body , and partners together , by his promise in Christ Jesus , through the Gospel .
49003007	Of this Gospel , I have been made a minister , according to the gift of the grace of God , which has been given to me by means of the operation of his virtue .
49003008	Although I am the least of all the saints , I have been given this grace : to evangelize among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ ,
49003009	and to enlighten everyone concerning the dispensation of the mystery , hidden before the ages in God who created all things ,
49003010	so that the manifold wisdom of God may become well-known to the principalities and powers in the heavens , through the Church ,
49003011	according to that timeless purpose , which he has formed in Christ Jesus our Lord .
49003012	In him we trust , and so we approach with confidence , through his faith .
49003013	Because of this , I ask you not to be weakened by my tribulations on your behalf ; for this is your glory .
49003014	By reason of this grace , I bend my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
49003015	from whom all paternity in heaven and on earth takes its name .
49003016	And I ask him to grant to you to be strengthened in virtue by his Spirit , in accord with the wealth of his glory , in the inner man ,
49003017	so that Christ may live in your hearts through a faith rooted in , and founded on , charity .
49003018	So may you be able to embrace , with all the saints , what is the width and length and height and depth
49003019	of the charity of Christ , and even be able to know that which surpasses all knowledge , so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God .
49003020	Now to him who is able to do all things , more abundantly than we could ever ask or understand , by means of the virtue which is at work in us :
49003021	to him be glory , in the Church and in Christ Jesus , throughout every generation , forever and ever . Amen .
49004001	And so , as a prisoner in the Lord , I beg you to walk in a manner worthy of the vocation to which you have been called :
49004002	with all humility and meekness , with patience , supporting one another in charity .
49004003	Be anxious to preserve the unity of the Spirit within the bonds of peace .
49004004	One body and one Spirit : to this you have been called by the one hope of your calling :
49004005	one Lord , one faith , one baptism ,
49004006	one God and Father of all , who is over all , and through all , and in us all .
49004007	Yet to each one of us there has been given grace according to the measure allotted by Christ .
49004008	Because of this , he says : “ Ascending on high , he took captivity itself captive ; he gave gifts to men . ”
49004009	Now that he has ascended , what is left except for him also to descended , first to the lower parts of the earth ?
49004010	He who descended is the same one who also ascended above all the heavens , so that he might fulfill everything .
49004011	And the same one granted that some would be Apostles , and some Prophets , yet truly others evangelists , and others pastors and teachers ,
49004012	for the sake of the perfection of the saints , by the work of the ministry , in the edification of the body of Christ ,
49004013	until we all meet in the unity of faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God , as a perfect man , in the measure of the age of the fullness of Christ .
49004014	So may we then no longer be little children , disturbed and carried about by every wind of doctrine , by the wickedness of men , and by the craftiness which deceives unto error .
49004015	Instead , acting according to truth in charity , we should increase in everything , in him who is the head , Christ himself .
49004016	For in him , the whole body is joined closely together , by every underlying joint , through the function allotted to each part , bringing improvement to the body , toward its edification in charity .
49004017	And so , I say this , and I testify in the Lord : that from now on you should walk , not as the Gentiles also walk , in the vanity of their mind ,
49004018	having their intellect obscured , being alienated from the life of God , through the ignorance that is within them , because of the blindness of their hearts .
49004019	Such as these , despairing , have given themselves over to sexual immorality , carrying out every impurity with rapacity .
49004020	But this is not what you have learned in Christ .
49004021	For certainly , you have listened to him , and you have been instructed in him , according to the truth that is in Jesus :
49004022	to set aside your earlier behavior , the former man , who was corrupted , by means of desire , unto error ,
49004023	and so be renewed in the spirit of your mind ,
49004024	and so put on the new man , who , in accord with God , is created in justice and in the holiness of truth .
49004025	Because of this , setting aside lying , speak the truth , each one with his neighbor . For we are all part of one another .
49004026	“ Be angry , but do not be willing to sin . ” Do not let the sun set over your anger .
49004027	Provide no place for the devil .
49004028	Whoever was stealing , let him now not steal , but rather let him labor , working with his hands , doing what is good , so that he may have something to distribute to those who suffer need .
49004029	Let no evil words proceed from your mouth , but only what is good , toward the edification of faith , so as to bestow grace upon those who listen .
49004030	And do not be willing to grieve the Holy Spirit of God , in whom you have been sealed , unto the day of redemption .
49004031	Let all bitterness and anger and indignation and outcry and blasphemy be taken away from you , along with all malice .
49004032	And be kind and merciful to one another , forgiving one another , just as God has forgiven you in Christ .
49005001	Therefore , as most beloved sons , be imitators of God .
49005002	And walk in love , just as Christ also loved us and delivered himself for us , as an oblation and a sacrifice to God , with a fragrance of sweetness .
49005003	But let not any kind of fornication , or impurity , or rapacity so much as be named among you , just as is worthy of the saints ,
49005004	nor any indecent , or foolish , or abusive talk , for this is without purpose ; but instead , give thanks .
49005005	For know and understand this : no one who is a fornicator , or lustful , or rapacious ( for these are a kind of service to idols ) holds an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God .
49005006	Let no one seduce you with empty words . For because of these things , the wrath of God was sent upon the sons of unbelief .
49005007	Therefore , do not choose to become participants with them .
49005008	For you were darkness , in times past , but now you are light , in the Lord . So then , walk as sons of the light .
49005009	For the fruit of the light is in all goodness and justice and truth ,
49005010	affirming what is well-pleasing to God .
49005011	And so , have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness , but instead , refute them .
49005012	For the things that are done by them in secret are shameful , even to mention .
49005013	But all things that are disputed are made manifest by the light . For all that is made manifest is light .
49005014	Because of this , it is said : “ You who are sleeping : awaken , and rise up from the dead , and so shall the Christ enlighten you . ”
49005015	And so , brothers , see to it that you walk cautiously , not like the foolish ,
49005016	but like the wise : atoning for this age , because this is an evil time .
49005017	For this reason , do not choose to be imprudent . Instead , understand what is the will of God .
49005018	And do not choose to be inebriated by wine , for this is self-indulgence . Instead , be filled with the Holy Spirit ,
49005019	speaking among yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual canticles , singing and reciting psalms to the Lord in your hearts ,
49005020	giving thanks always for everything , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , to God the Father .
49005021	Be subject to one another in the fear of Christ .
49005022	Wives should be submissive to their husbands , as to the Lord .
49005023	For the husband is the head of the wife , just as Christ is the head of the Church . He is the Savior of his body .
49005024	Therefore , just as the Church is subject to Christ , so also should wives be subject to their husbands in all things .
49005025	Husbands , love your wives , just as Christ also loved the Church and handed himself over for her ,
49005026	so that he might sanctify her , washing her clean by water and the Word of life ,
49005027	so that he might offer her to himself as a glorious Church , not having any spot or wrinkle or any such thing , so that she would be holy and immaculate .
49005028	So , too , husbands should love their wives as their own bodies . He who loves his wife loves himself .
49005029	For no man has ever hated his own flesh , but instead he nourishes and cherishes it , as Christ also does to the Church .
49005030	For we are a part of his body , of his flesh and of his bones .
49005031	“ For this reason , a man shall leave behind his father and mother , and he shall cling to his wife ; and the two shall be as one flesh . ”
49005032	This is a great Sacrament . And I am speaking in Christ and in the Church .
49005033	Yet truly , each and every one of you should love his wife as himself . And a wife should fear her husband .
49006001	Children , obey your parents in the Lord , for this is just .
49006002	Honor your father and your mother . This is the first commandment with a promise :
49006003	so that it may be well with you , and so that you may have a long life upon the earth .
49006004	And you , fathers , do not provoke your children to anger , but educate them with the discipline and correction of the Lord .
49006005	Servants , be obedient to your lords according to the flesh , with fear and trembling , in the simplicity of your heart , as to Christ .
49006006	Do not serve only when seen , as if to please men , but act as servants of Christ , doing the will of God from the heart .
49006007	Serve with good will , as to the Lord , and not to men .
49006008	For you know that whatever good each one will do , the same will he receive from the Lord , whether he is servant or free .
49006009	And you , lords , act similarly toward them , setting aside threats , knowing that the Lord of both you and them is in heaven . For with him there is no favoritism toward anyone .
49006010	Concerning the rest , brothers , be strengthened in the Lord , by the power of his virtue .
49006011	Be clothed in the armor of God , so that you may be able to stand against the treachery of the devil .
49006012	For our struggle is not against flesh and blood , but against principalities and powers , against the directors of this world of darkness , against the spirits of wickedness in high places .
49006013	Because of this , take up the armor of God , so that you may be able to withstand the evil day and remain perfect in all things .
49006014	Therefore , stand firm , having been girded about your waist with truth , and having been clothed with the breastplate of justice ,
49006015	and having feet which have been shod by the preparation of the Gospel of peace .
49006016	In all things , take up the shield of faith , with which you may be able to extinguish all the fiery darts of the most wicked one .
49006017	And take up the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit ( which is the Word of God ) .
49006018	Through every kind of prayer and supplication , pray at all times in spirit , and so be vigilant with every kind of earnest supplication , for all the saints ,
49006019	and also for me , so that words may be given to me , as I open my mouth with faith to make known the mystery of the Gospel ,
49006020	in such a manner that I may dare to speak exactly as I ought to speak . For I act as an ambassador in chains for the Gospel .
49006021	Now , so that you also may know the things that concern me and what I am doing , Tychicus , a most beloved brother and a faithful minister in the Lord , will make known everything to you .
49006022	I have sent him to you for this very reason , so that you may know the things that concern us , and so that he may console your hearts .
49006023	Peace to the brothers , and charity with faith , from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49006024	May grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ , unto incorruption . Amen .
50001001	Paul and Timothy , servants of Jesus Christ , to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi , with the bishops and deacons .
50001002	Grace and peace to you , from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
50001003	I give thanks to my God , with every remembrance of you ,
50001004	always , in all my prayers , making supplication for all of you with joy ,
50001005	because of your communion in the Gospel of Christ , from the first day even until now .
50001006	I am confident of this very thing : that he who has begun this good work in you will perfect it , unto the day of Christ Jesus .
50001007	So then , it is right for me to feel this way about all of you , because I hold you in my heart , and because , in my chains and in the defense and confirmation of the Gospel , you all are partakers of my joy .
50001008	For God is my witness how , within the heart of Jesus Christ , I long for all of you .
50001009	And this I pray : that your charity may abound more and more , with knowledge and with all understanding ,
50001010	so that you may be confirmed in what is better , in order that you may be sincere and without offense on the day of Christ :
50001011	filled with the fruit of justice , through Jesus Christ , in the glory and praise of God .
50001012	Now , brothers , I want you to know that the things concerning me happened for the advancement of the Gospel ,
50001013	in such a way that my chains have become manifest in Christ in every place of judgment and in all other such places .
50001014	And many from among the brothers in the Lord , becoming confident through my chains , are now much bolder in speaking the Word of God without fear .
50001015	Certainly , some do so even because of envy and contention ; and others , too , do so because of a good will to preach Christ .
50001016	Some act out of charity , knowing that I have been appointed for the defense of the Gospel .
50001017	But others , out of contention , announce Christ insincerely , claiming that their difficulties lift them up to my chains .
50001018	But what does it matter ? As long as , by every means , whether under pretext or in truthfulness , Christ is announced . And about this , I rejoice , and moreover , I will continue to rejoice .
50001019	For I know that this will bring me to salvation , through your prayers and under the ministration of the Spirit of Jesus Christ ,
50001020	by means of my own expectation and hope . For in nothing shall I be confounded . Instead , with all confidence , now just as always , Christ shall be magnified in my body , whether by life or by death .
50001021	For to me , to live is Christ , and to die is gain .
50001022	And while I live in the flesh , for me , there is the fruit of works . But I do not know which I would choose .
50001023	For I am constrained between the two : having a desire to be dissolved and to be with Christ , which is the far better thing ,
50001024	but then to remain in the flesh is necessary for your sake .
50001025	And having this confidence , I know that I shall remain and that I shall continue to remain with all of you , for your advancement and for your joy in the faith ,
50001026	so that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus for me , through my return to you again .
50001027	Only let your behavior be worthy of the Gospel of Christ , so that , whether I return and see you , or whether , being absent , I hear about you , still you may stand firm with one spirit , with one mind , laboring together for the faith of the Gospel .
50001028	And in nothing be terrified by the adversaries . For what is to them is an occasion of perdition , is to you an occasion of salvation , and this is from God .
50001029	For this has been given to you on behalf of Christ , not only so that you may believe in him , but even so that you may suffer with him ,
50001030	engaging in the same struggle , of a kind which you also have seen in me , and which you now have heard from me .
50002001	Therefore , if there is any consolation in Christ , any solace of charity , any fellowship of the Spirit , any feelings of commiseration :
50002002	complete my joy by having the same understanding , holding to the same charity , being of one mind , with the same sentiment .
50002003	Let nothing be done by contention , nor in vain glory . Instead , in humility , let each of you esteem others to be better than himself .
50002004	Let each of you not consider anything to be your own , but rather to belong to others .
50002005	For this understanding in you was also in Christ Jesus :
50002006	who , though he was in the form of God , did not consider equality with God something to be seized .
50002007	Instead , he emptied himself , taking the form of a servant , being made in the likeness of men , and accepting the state of a man .
50002008	He humbled himself , becoming obedient even unto death , even the death of the Cross .
50002009	Because of this , God has also exalted him and has given him a name which is above every name ,
50002010	so that , at the name of Jesus , every knee would bend , of those in heaven , of those on earth , and of those in hell ,
50002011	and so that every tongue would confess that the Lord Jesus Christ is in the glory of God the Father .
50002012	And so , my most beloved , just as you have always obeyed , not only in my presence , but even more so now in my absence : work toward your salvation with fear and trembling .
50002013	For it is God who works in you , both so as to choose , and so as to act , in accord with his good will .
50002014	And do everything without murmuring or hesitation .
50002015	So may you be without blame , simple sons of God , without reproof , in the midst of a depraved and perverse nation , among whom you shine like lights in the world ,
50002016	holding to the Word of Life , until my glory in the day of Christ . For I have not run in vain , nor have I labored in vain .
50002017	Moreover , if I am to be immolated because of the sacrifice and service of your faith , I rejoice and give thanks with all of you .
50002018	And over this same thing , you also should rejoice and give thanks , together with me .
50002019	Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon , in order that I may be encouraged , when I know the things concerning you .
50002020	For I have no one else with such an agreeable mind , who , with sincere affection , is solicitous for you .
50002021	For they all seek the things that are of themselves , not the things that are of Jesus Christ .
50002022	So know this evidence of him : that like a son with a father , so has he served with me in the Gospel .
50002023	Therefore , I hope to send him to you immediately , as soon as I see what will happen concerning me .
50002024	But I trust in the Lord that I myself will also return to you soon .
50002025	Now I have considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus , my brother , and co-worker , and fellow soldier , and an attendant to my needs , but your Apostle .
50002026	For certainly , he has desired all of you , and he was saddened because you had heard that he was sick .
50002027	For he was sick , even unto death , but God took pity on him , and not only on him , but truly on myself also , so that I would not have sorrow upon sorrow .
50002028	Therefore , I sent him more readily , in order that , by seeing him again , you may rejoice , and I may be without sorrow .
50002029	And so , receive him with every joy in the Lord , and treat all those like him with honor .
50002030	For he was brought close even to death , for the sake of the work of Christ , handing over his own life , so that he might fulfill what was lacking from you concerning my service .
50003001	Concerning other things , my brothers , rejoice in the Lord . It is certainly not tiresome for me to write the same things to you , but for you , it is not necessary .
50003002	Beware of dogs ; beware of those who work evil ; beware of those who are divisive .
50003003	For we are the circumcised , we who serve God in the Spirit and who glory in Christ Jesus , having no confidence in the flesh .
50003004	Nevertheless , I might have confidence also in the flesh , for if anyone else seems to have confidence in the flesh , more so do I .
50003005	For I was circumcised on the eighth day , of the stock of Israel , from the tribe of Benjamin , a Hebrew among Hebrews . According to the law , I was a Pharisee ;
50003006	according to zeal , I persecuted the Church of God ; according to the justice that is in the law , I lived without blame .
50003007	But the things which had been to my gain , the same have I considered a loss , for the sake of Christ .
50003008	Yet truly , I consider everything to be a loss , because of the preeminent knowledge of Jesus Christ , my Lord , for whose sake I have suffered the loss of everything , considering it all to be like dung , so that I may gain Christ ,
