50003009	and so that you may be found in him , not having my justice , which is of the law , but that which is of the faith of Christ Jesus , the justice within faith , which is of God .
50003010	So shall I know him , and the power of his resurrection , and the fellowship of his Passion , having been fashioned according to his death ,
50003011	if , by some means , I might attain to the resurrection which is from the dead .
50003012	It is not as though I have already received this , or were already perfect . But rather I pursue , so that by some means I might attain , that in which I have already been attained by Christ Jesus .
50003013	Brothers , I do not consider that I have already attained this . Instead , I do one thing : forgetting those things that are behind , and extending myself toward those things that are ahead ,
50003014	I pursue the destination , the prize of the heavenly calling of God in Christ Jesus .
50003015	Therefore , as many of us as are being perfected , let us agree about this . And if in anything you disagree , God will reveal this to you also .
50003016	Yet truly , whatever point we reach , let us be of the same mind , and let us remain in the same rule .
50003017	Be imitators of me , brothers , and observe those who are walking similarly , just as you have seen by our example .
50003018	For many persons , about whom I have often told you ( and now tell you , weeping , ) are walking as enemies of the cross of Christ .
50003019	Their end is destruction ; their god is their belly ; and their glory is in their shame : for they are immersed in earthly things .
50003020	But our way of life is in heaven . And from heaven , too , we await the Savior , our Lord Jesus Christ ,
50003021	who will transform the body of our lowliness , according to the form of the body of his glory , by means of that power by which he is even able to subject all things to himself .
50004001	And so , my most beloved and most desired brothers , my joy and my crown : stand firm in this way , in the Lord , most beloved .
50004002	I ask Euodia , and I beg Syntyche , to have the same understanding in the Lord .
50004003	And I also ask you , as my genuine companion , to assist those women who have labored with me in the Gospel , with Clement and the rest of my assistants , whose names are in the Book of Life .
50004004	Rejoice in the Lord always . Again , I say , rejoice .
50004005	Let your modesty be known to all men . The Lord is near .
50004006	Be anxious about nothing . But in all things , with prayer and supplication , with acts of thanksgiving , let your petitions be made known to God .
50004007	And so shall the peace of God , which exceeds all understanding , guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus .
50004008	Concerning the rest , brothers , whatever is true , whatever is chaste , whatever is just , whatever is holy , whatever is worthy to be loved , whatever is of good repute , if there is any virtue , if there is any praiseworthy discipline : meditate on these .
50004009	All the things that you have learned and accepted and heard and seen in me , do these . And so shall the God of peace be with you .
50004010	Now I rejoice in the Lord exceedingly , because finally , after some time , your feelings for me have flourished again , just as you formerly felt . For you had been preoccupied .
50004011	I am not saying this as if out of need . For I have learned that , in whatever state I am , it is sufficient .
50004012	I know how to be humbled , and I know how to abound . I am prepared for anything , anywhere : either to be full or to be hungry , either to have abundance or to endure scarcity .
50004013	Everything is possible in him who has strengthened me .
50004014	Yet truly , you have done well by sharing in my tribulation .
50004015	But you also know , O Philippians , that at the beginning of the Gospel , when I set out from Macedonia , not a single church shared with me in the plan of giving and receiving , except you alone .
50004016	For you even sent to Thessalonica , once , and then a second time , for what was useful to me .
50004017	It is not that I am seeking a gift . Instead , I seek the fruit that abounds to your benefit .
50004018	But I have everything in abundance . I have been filled up , having received from Epaphroditus the things that you sent ; this is an odor of sweetness , an acceptable sacrifice , pleasing to God .
50004019	And may my God fulfill all your desires , according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus .
50004020	And to God our Father be glory forever and ever . Amen .
50004021	Greet every saint in Christ Jesus .
50004022	The brothers who are with me greet you . All the saints greet you , but especially those who are of Caesar’s household .
50004023	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
51001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , and Timothy , a brother ,
51001002	to the saints and faithful brothers in Christ Jesus who are at Colossae .
51001003	Grace and peace to you , from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ . We give thanks to God , the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , praying for you always .
51001004	For we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus , and of the love that you have toward all the saints ,
51001005	because of the hope that has been stored up for you in heaven , which you have heard through the Word of Truth in the Gospel .
51001006	This has reached you , just as it is present in the whole world , where it grows and bears fruit , as it has also done in you , since the day when you first heard and knew the grace of God in truth ,
51001007	just as you learned it from Epaphras , our most beloved fellow servant , who is for you a faithful minister of Christ Jesus .
51001008	And he has also manifested to us your love in the Spirit .
51001009	Then , too , from the day when we first heard it , we have not ceased praying for you and requesting that you be filled with the knowledge of his will , with all wisdom and spiritual understanding ,
51001010	so that you may walk in a manner worthy of God , being pleasing in all things , being fruitful in every good work , and increasing in the knowledge of God ,
51001011	being strengthened in every virtue , in accord with the power of his glory , with all patience and longsuffering , with joy ,
51001012	giving thanks to God the Father , who has made us worthy to have a share in the portion of the saints , in the light .
51001013	For he has rescued us from the power of darkness , and he has transferred us into the kingdom of the Son of his love ,
51001014	in whom we have redemption through his blood , the remission of sins .
51001015	He is the image of the invisible God , the first-born of every creature .
51001016	For in him was created everything in heaven and on earth , visible and invisible , whether thrones , or dominations , or principalities , or powers . All things were created through him and in him .
51001017	And he is before all , and in him all things continue .
51001018	And he is the head of his body , the Church . He is the beginning , the first-born from the dead , so that in all things he may hold primacy .
51001019	For the Father is well-pleased that all fullness reside in him ,
51001020	and that , through him , all things be reconciled to himself , making peace through the blood of his cross , for the things that are on earth , as well as the things that are in heaven .
51001021	And you , though you had been , in times past , understood to be foreigners and enemies , with works of evil ,
51001022	yet now he has reconciled you , by his body of flesh , through death , so as to offer you , holy and immaculate and blameless , before him .
51001023	So then , continue in the faith : well-founded and steadfast and immovable , by the hope of the Gospel that you have heard , which has been preached throughout all creation under heaven , the Gospel of which I , Paul , have become a minister .
51001024	For now I rejoice in my passion on your behalf , and I complete in my flesh the things that are lacking in the Passion of Christ , for the sake of his body , which is the Church .
51001025	For I have become a minister of the Church , according to the dispensation of God that has been given to me among you , so that I may fulfill the Word of God ,
51001026	the mystery which had remained hidden to past ages and generations , but which now is manifested to his saints .
51001027	To them , God willed to made known the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles , which is Christ and the hope of his glory within you .
51001028	We are announcing him , correcting every man and teaching every man , with all wisdom , so that we may offer every man perfect in Christ Jesus .
51001029	In him , too , I labor , striving according to his action within me , which he works in virtue .
51002001	For I want you to know the kind of solicitude that I have for you , and for those who are at Laodicea , as well as for those who have not seen my face in the flesh .
51002002	May their hearts be consoled and instructed in charity , with all the riches of a plenitude of understanding , with knowledge of the mystery of God the Father and of Christ Jesus .
51002003	For in him are hidden all treasures of wisdom and knowledge .
51002004	Now I say this , so that no one may deceive you with grandiose words .
51002005	For though I may be absent in body , yet I am with you in spirit . And I rejoice as I gaze upon your order and its foundation , which is in Christ , your faith .
51002006	Therefore , just as you have received the Lord Jesus Christ , walk in him .
51002007	Be rooted and continually built up in Christ . And be confirmed in the faith , just as you have also learned it , increasing in him with acts of thanksgiving .
51002008	See to it that no one deceives you through philosophy and empty falsehoods , as found in the traditions of men , in accord with the influences of the world , and not in accord with Christ .
51002009	For in him , all the fullness of the Divine Nature dwells bodily .
51002010	And in him , you have been filled ; for he is the head of all principality and power .
51002011	In him also , you have been circumcised with a circumcision not made by hand , not by the despoiling of the body of flesh , but by the circumcision of Christ .
51002012	You have been buried with him in baptism . In him also , you have risen again through faith , by the work of God , who raised him up from the dead .
51002013	And when you were dead in your transgressions and in the uncircumcision of your flesh , he enlivened you , together with him , forgiving you of all transgressions ,
51002014	and wiping away the handwriting of the decree which was against us , which was contrary to us . And he has taken this away from your midst , affixing it to the Cross .
51002015	And so , despoiling principalities and powers , he has led them away confidently and openly , triumphing over them in himself .
51002016	Therefore , let no one judge you as concerns food or drink , or a particular feast day , or feast days of new moons , or of Sabbaths .
51002017	For these are a shadow of the future , but the body is of Christ .
51002018	Let no one seduce you , preferring base things and a religion of Angels , walking according to what he has not seen , being vainly inflated by the sensations of his flesh ,
51002019	and not holding up the head , with which the whole body , by its underlying joints and ligaments , is joined together and grows with an increase that is of God .
51002020	So then , if you have died with Christ to the influences of this world , why do you still make decisions as if you were living in the world ?
51002021	Do not touch , do not taste , do not handle these things ,
51002022	which all lead to destruction by their very use , in accord with the precepts and doctrines of men .
51002023	Such ideas have at least an intention to attain to wisdom , but through superstition and debasement , not sparing the body , and they are without any honor in satiating the flesh .
51003001	Therefore , if you have risen together with Christ , seek the things that are above , where Christ is seated at the right hand of God .
51003002	Consider the things that are above , not the things that are upon the earth .
51003003	For you have died , and so your life is hidden with Christ in God .
51003004	When Christ , your life , appears , then you also will appear with him in glory .
51003005	Therefore , mortify your body , while it is upon the earth . For because of fornication , impurity , lust , evil desires , and avarice , which are a kind of service to idols ,
51003006	the wrath of God has overwhelmed the sons of unbelief .
51003007	You , too , walked in these things , in times past , when you were living among them .
51003008	But now you must set aside all these things : anger , indignation , malice , blasphemy , and indecent speech from your mouth .
51003009	Do not lie to one another . Strip yourselves of the old man , with his deeds ,
51003010	and clothe yourself with the new man , who has been renewed by knowledge , in accord with the image of the One who created him ,
51003011	where there is neither Gentile nor Jew , circumcision nor uncircumcision , Barbarian nor Scythian , servant nor free . Instead , Christ is everything , in everyone .
51003012	Therefore , clothe yourselves like the elect of God : holy and beloved , with hearts of mercy , kindness , humility , modesty , and patience .
51003013	Support one another , and , if anyone has a complaint against another , forgive one another . For just as the Lord has forgiven you , so also must you do .
51003014	And above all these things have charity , which is the bond of perfection .
51003015	And let the peace of Christ lift up your hearts . For in this peace , you have been called , as one body . And be thankful .
51003016	Let the word of Christ live in you in abundance , with all wisdom , teaching and correcting one another , with psalms , hymns , and spiritual canticles , singing to God with the grace in your hearts .
51003017	Let everything whatsoever that you do , whether in word or in deed , be done all in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ , giving thanks to God the Father through him .
51003018	Wives , be submissive to your husbands , as is proper in the Lord .
51003019	Husbands , love your wives , and do not be bitter toward them .
51003020	Children , obey your parents in all things . For this is well-pleasing to the Lord .
51003021	Fathers , do not provoke your children to indignation , lest they lose heart .
51003022	Servants , obey , in all things , your lords according to the flesh , not serving only when seen , as if to please men , but serving in simplicity of heart , fearing God .
51003023	Whatever you do , do it from the heart , as for the Lord , and not for men .
51003024	For you know that you will receive from the Lord the repayment of an inheritance . Serve Christ the Lord .
51003025	For whoever causes injury shall be repaid for what he has wrongfully done . And there no favoritism with God .
51004001	You masters , supply your servants with what is just and equitable , knowing that you , too , have a Master in heaven .
51004002	Pursue prayer . Be watchful in prayer with acts of thanksgiving .
51004003	Pray together , for us also , so that God may open a door of speech to us , so as to speak the mystery of Christ , ( because of which , even now , I am in chains )
51004004	so that I may manifest it in the manner that I ought to speak .
51004005	Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside , redeeming this age .
51004006	Let your speech be ever graceful , seasoned with salt , so that you may know how you ought to respond to each person .
51004007	As for the things that concern me , Tychicus , a most beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord , will make everything known to you .
51004008	I have sent him to you for this very purpose , so that he may know the things that concern you , and may console your hearts ,
51004009	with Onesimus , a most beloved and faithful brother , who is from among you . They shall make known to you everything that is happening here .
51004010	Aristarchus , my fellow prisoner , greets you , as does Mark , the near cousin of Barnabas , about whom you have received instructions , ( if he comes to you , receive him )
51004011	and Jesus , who is called Justus , and those who are of the circumcision . These alone are my assistants , unto the kingdom of God ; they have been a consolation to me .
51004012	Epaphras greets you , who is from among you , a servant of Christ Jesus , ever solicitous for you in prayer , so that you may stand , perfect and complete , in the entire will of God .
51004013	For I offer testimony to him , that he has labored greatly for you , and for those who are at Laodicea , and for those at Hierapolis .
51004014	Luke , a most beloved physician , greets you , as does Demas .
51004015	Greet the brothers who are at Laodicea , and Nymphas , and those who are at his house , a church .
51004016	And when this epistle has been read among you , cause it to be read also in the church of the Laodiceans , and you should read that which is from the Laodiceans .
51004017	And tell Archippus : “ See to the ministry that you have received in the Lord , in order to fulfill it . ”
51004018	The greeting of Paul by my own hand . Remember my chains . May grace be with you . Amen .
52001001	Paul and Sylvanus and Timothy , to the church of the Thessalonians , in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
52001002	Grace and peace to you . We give thanks to God always for all of you , keeping the memory of you in our prayers without ceasing ,
52001003	remembering your work of faith , and hardship , and charity , and enduring hope , in our Lord Jesus Christ , before God our Father .
52001004	For we know , brothers , beloved of God , of your election .
52001005	For our Gospel has not been among you in word alone , but also in virtue , and in the Holy Spirit , and with a great fullness , in the same manner as you know we have acted among you for your sake .
52001006	And so , you became imitators of us and of the Lord , accepting the Word in the midst of great tribulation , but with the joy of the Holy Spirit .
52001007	So have you become a pattern for all who believe in Macedonia and in Achaia .
52001008	For from you , the Word of the Lord was spread , not only in Macedonia and in Achaia , but also in every place . Your faith , which is toward God , has advanced so much so that we do not need to speak to you about anything .
52001009	For others are reporting among us of the kind of acceptance we had among you , and how you were converted from idols to God , to the service of the living and true God ,
52001010	and to the expectation of his Son from heaven ( whom he raised up from the dead ) , Jesus , who has rescued us from the approaching wrath .
52002001	For you yourselves know , brothers , that our acceptance among you was not empty .
52002002	Instead , having previously suffered and been treated shamefully , as you know , at Philippi , we had confidence in our God , so as to speak the Gospel of God to you with much solicitude .
52002003	For our exhortation was not in error , nor from impurity , nor with deception .
52002004	But , just as we have been tested by God , so that the Gospel would be entrusted to us , so also did we speak , not so as to please men , but rather to please God , who tests our hearts .
52002005	And neither did we , at any time , become flattering in speech , as you know , nor did we seek an opportunity for avarice , as God is witness .
52002006	Nor did we seek the glory of men , neither from you , nor from others .
52002007	And although we could have been a burden to you , as Apostles of Christ , instead we became like little ones in your midst , like a nurse cherishing her children .
52002008	So desirous were we for you that we were willing to hand over to you , not only the Gospel of God , but even our own souls . For you have become most beloved to us .
52002009	For you remember , brothers , our hardship and weariness . We preached the Gospel of God among you , working night and day , so that we would not be burdensome to any of you .
52002010	You are witnesses , as is God , of how holy and just and blameless we were with you who have believed .
52002011	And you know the manner , with each one of you , like a father with his sons ,
52002012	in which we were pleading with you and consoling you , bearing witness , so that you would walk in a manner worthy of God , who has called you into his kingdom and glory .
52002013	For this reason also , we give thanks to God without ceasing : because , when you had accepted from us the Word of the hearing of God , you accepted it not as the word of men , but ( as it truly is ) as the Word of God , who is working in you who have believed .
52002014	For you , brothers , have become imitators of the churches of God which are at Judea , in Christ Jesus . For you , too , have suffered the same things from your fellow countrymen as they have suffered from the Jews ,
52002015	who also killed both the Lord Jesus , and the Prophets , and who have persecuted us . But they do not please God , and so they are adversaries to all men .
52002016	They prohibit us to speak to the Gentiles , so that they may be saved , and thus do they continually add to their own sins . But the wrath of God will overtake them in the very end .
52002017	And we , brothers , having been deprived of you for a short time , in sight , but not in heart , have hurried all the more to see your face , with a great desire .
52002018	For we wanted to come to you , ( indeed , I , Paul , attempted to do so once , and then again , ) but Satan impeded us .
52002019	For what is our hope , and our joy , and our crown of glory ? Is it not you , before our Lord Jesus Christ at his return ?
52002020	For you are our glory and our joy .
52003001	Because of this , willing to wait no longer , it was pleasing to us to remain at Athens , alone .
52003002	And we sent Timothy , our brother and a minister of God in the Gospel of Christ , to confirm you and to exhort you , on behalf of your faith ,
52003003	so that no one would be disturbed during these tribulations . For you yourselves know that we have been appointed to this .
52003004	For even while we were with you , we predicted to you that we would suffer tribulations , even as it has happened , and as you know .
52003005	For this reason also , I was not willing to wait any longer , and I sent to find out about your faith , lest perhaps he who tempts may have tempted you , and our labor might have been in vain .
52003006	But then , when Timothy arrived to us from you , he reported to us your faith and charity , and that you keep a good remembrance of us always , desiring to see us , just as we likewise desire to see you .
52003007	As a result , we were consoled in you , brothers , in the midst of all our difficulties and tribulations , through your faith .
52003008	For we now live so that you may stand firm in the Lord .
52003009	For what thanks would we be able to repay to God because of you , for all the joy with which we rejoice over you before our God ?
52003010	For night and day , ever more abundantly , we are praying that we may see your face , and that we may complete those things that are lacking in your faith .
52003011	But may God our Father himself , and our Lord Jesus Christ , direct our way to you .
52003012	And may the Lord multiply you , and make you abound in your charity toward one another and toward all , just as we also do toward you ,
52003013	in order to confirm your hearts without blame , in sanctity , before God our Father , unto the return of our Lord Jesus Christ , with all his saints . Amen .
52004001	Therefore , concerning other things , brothers , we ask and beg you , in the Lord Jesus , that , just as you have received from us the way in which you ought to walk and to please God , so also may you walk , in order that you may abound all the more .
52004002	For you know what precepts I have given to you through the Lord Jesus .
52004003	For this is the will of God , your sanctification : that you should abstain from fornication ,
52004004	that each one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honor ,
52004005	not in passions of lust , like the Gentiles who do not know God ,
52004006	and that no one should overwhelm or circumvent his brother in business . For the Lord is the vindicator of all these things , just as we have preached and testified to you .
52004007	For God has not called us to impurity , but to sanctification .
52004008	And so , whoever despises these teachings , does not despise man , but God , who has even provided his Holy Spirit within us .
52004009	But concerning the charity of brotherhood , we have no need to write to you . For you yourselves have learned from God that you should love one another .
52004010	For indeed , you act in this way with all the brothers in all of Macedonia . But we petition you , brothers , so that you may abound all the more ,
52004011	to choose work that allows you to be tranquil , and to carry out your business and to do your work with your own hands , just as we have instructed you ,
52004012	and to walk honestly with those who are outside , and to desire nothing belonging to another .
52004013	And we do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , concerning those who are sleeping , so as not to be sorrowful , like these others who do not have hope .
52004014	For if we believe that Jesus has died and risen again , so also will God bring back with Jesus those who sleep in him .
52004015	For we say this to you , in the Word of the Lord : that we who are alive , who remain until the return of the Lord , will not precede those who have fallen asleep .
52004016	For the Lord himself , with a command and with the voice of an Archangel and with a trumpet of God , shall descend from heaven . And the dead , who are in Christ , shall rise up first .
52004017	Next , we who are alive , who are remaining , shall be taken up quickly together with them into the clouds to meet Christ in the air . And in this way , we shall be with the Lord always .
52004018	Therefore , console one another with these words .
52005001	But concerning dates and times , brothers , you do not need us to write to you .
52005002	For you yourselves thoroughly understand that the day of the Lord shall arrive much like a thief in the night .
52005003	For when they will say , “ Peace and security ! ” then destruction will suddenly overwhelm them , like the labor pains of a woman with child , and they will not escape .
52005004	But you , brothers , are not in darkness , so that you would be overtaken by that day as by a thief .
52005005	For all of you are sons of light and sons of daytime ; we are not of nighttime , nor of darkness .
52005006	Therefore , let us not sleep , as the rest do . Instead , we should be vigilant and sober .
52005007	For those who sleep , sleep in the night ; and those who are inebriated , are inebriated in the night .
52005008	But we , who are of the daylight , should be sober , being clothed with the breastplate of faith and of charity and having , as a helmet , the hope of salvation .
52005009	For God has not appointed us for wrath , but for the acquisition of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
52005010	who died for us , so that , whether we watch , or whether we sleep , we may live in union with him .
52005011	Because of this , console one another and build up one another , just as you are doing .
52005012	And we ask you , brothers , to recognize those who labor among you , and who preside over you in the Lord , and who admonish you ,
52005013	so that you may consider them with an abundance of charity , for the sake of their work . Be at peace with them .
52005014	And we ask you , brothers : correct the disruptive , console the weak-minded , support the sick , be patient with everyone .
52005015	See to it that no one repays evil for evil to anyone . Instead , always pursue whatever is good , with one another and with all .
52005016	Rejoice always .
52005017	Pray without ceasing .
52005018	Give thanks in everything . For this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for all of you .
52005019	Do not choose to extinguish the Spirit .
52005020	Do not spurn prophecies .
52005021	But test all things . Hold on to whatever is good .
52005022	Abstain from every kind of evil .
52005023	And may the God of peace himself sanctify you through all things , so that your whole spirit and soul and body may be preserved without blame unto the return of our Lord Jesus Christ .
52005024	He who has called you is faithful . He shall act even now .
52005025	Brothers , pray for us .
52005026	Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss .
52005027	I bind you , through the Lord , that this epistle is to be read to all the holy brothers .
52005028	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you . Amen .
53001001	Paul and Sylvanus and Timothy , to the church of the Thessalonians , in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53001002	Grace and peace to you , from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
53001003	We ought to give thanks always to God for you , brothers , in a fitting manner , because your faith is increasing greatly , and because the charity of each of you toward one another is abundant ,
53001004	so much so that we ourselves even glory in you among the churches of God , because of your patience and faith in all of your persecutions and tribulations that you endure ,
53001005	which are a sign of the just judgment of God , so that you may be held worthy of the kingdom of God , for which you also suffer .
53001006	For certainly , it is just for God to repay trouble to those who trouble you ,
53001007	and to repay you , who are being troubled , with a repose with us , when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with the Angels of his virtue ,
53001008	granting vindication , by a flame of fire , against those who do not know God and who are not obedient to the Gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53001009	These shall be given the eternal punishment of destruction , apart from the face of the Lord and apart from the glory of his virtue ,
53001010	when he arrives to be glorified in his saints , and to become a wonder in all those who have believed , in that day , because our testimony has been believed by you .
53001011	Because of this , too , we pray always for you , so that our God may make you worthy of his calling and may complete every act of his goodness , as well as his work of faith in virtue ,
53001012	in order that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you , and you in him , in accord with the grace of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ .
53002001	But we ask you , brothers , concerning the advent of our Lord Jesus Christ and of our gathering to him ,
53002002	that you not be readily disturbed or terrified in your minds , by any spirit , or word , or epistle , supposedly sent from us , claiming that the day of the Lord is close by .
53002003	Let no one deceive you in any way . For this cannot be , unless the apostasy will have arrived first , and the man of sin will have been revealed , the son of perdition ,
53002004	who is an adversary to , and who is lifted up above , all that is called God or that is worshipped , so much so that he sits in the temple of God , presenting himself as if he were God .
53002005	Do you not recall that , when I was still with you , I told you these things ?
53002006	And now you know what it is that holds him back , so that he may be revealed in his own time .
53002007	For the mystery of iniquity is already at work . And only one now holds back , and will continue to hold back , until he is taken from our midst .
53002008	And then that iniquitous one shall be revealed , the one whom the Lord Jesus shall bring to ruin with the spirit of his mouth , and shall destroy at the brightness of his return :
53002009	him whose advent is accompanied by the works of Satan , with every kind of power and signs and false miracles ,
53002010	and with every seduction of iniquity , toward those who are perishing because they have not accepted the love of truth , so that they may be saved .
53002011	For this reason , God will send to them works of deception , so that they may believe in lies ,
53002012	in order that all those who have not believed in the truth , but who have consented to iniquity , may be judged .
53002013	Yet we must always give thanks to God for you , brothers , beloved of God , because God has chosen you as first-fruits for salvation , by the sanctification of the Spirit and by faith in the truth .
53002014	He has also called you into truth through our Gospel , unto the acquisition of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53002015	And so , brothers , stand firm , and hold to the traditions that you have learned , whether by word or by our epistle .
53002016	So may our Lord Jesus Christ himself , and God our Father , who has loved us and who has given us an everlasting consolation and good hope in grace ,
53002017	exhort your hearts and confirm you in every good word and deed .
53003001	Concerning other things , brothers , pray for us , so that the Word of God may advance and be glorified , just as it is among you ,
53003002	and so that we may be freed from pertinacious and evil men . For not everyone is faithful .
53003003	But God is faithful . He will strengthen you , and he will guard you from evil .
53003004	And we have confidence about you in the Lord , that you are doing , and will continue to do , just as we have instructed .
53003005	And may the Lord direct your hearts , in the charity of God and with the patience of Christ .
53003006	But we strongly caution you , brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , to draw yourselves away from every brother who is walking in disorder and not according to the tradition that they received from us .
53003007	For you yourselves know the manner in which you ought to imitate us . For we were not disorderly among you .
53003008	Nor did we eat bread from anyone for free , but rather , we worked night and day , in hardship and weariness , so as not to be burdensome to you .
53003009	It was not as if we had no authority , but this was so that we might present ourselves as an example to you , in order to imitate us .
53003010	Then , too , while we were with you , we insisted on this to you : that if anyone was not willing to work , neither should he eat .
53003011	For we have heard that there are some among you who act disruptively , not working at all , but eagerly meddling .
53003012	Now we charge those who act in this way , and we beg them in the Lord Jesus Christ , that they work in silence and eat their own bread .
53003013	And you , brothers , do not grow weak in doing good .
53003014	But if anyone does not obey our word by this epistle , take note of him and do not keep company with him , so that he may be ashamed .
53003015	But do not be willing to consider him as an enemy ; instead , correct him as a brother .
53003016	Then may the Lord of peace himself give you an everlasting peace , in every place . May the Lord be with all of you .
53003017	The greeting of Paul with my own hand , which is the seal in every epistle . So do I write .
53003018	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
54001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ by the authority of God our Savior and Christ Jesus our hope ,
54001002	to Timothy , beloved son in the faith . Grace , mercy , and peace , from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord .
54001003	Now I asked you to remain at Ephesus , while I went into Macedonia , so that you would speak strongly against certain ones who have been teaching a different way ,
54001004	against those who have been paying attention to fables and endless genealogies . These things present questions as if they were greater than the edification that is of God , which is in faith .
54001005	Now the goal of instruction is charity from a pure heart , and a good conscience , and an unfeigned faith .
54001006	Certain persons , wandering away from these things , have been turned aside to empty babbling ,
54001007	desiring to be teachers of the law , but understanding neither the things that they themselves are saying , nor what they are affirming about these things .
54001008	But we know that the law is good , if one makes use of it properly .
54001009	Knowing this , that the law was not set in place for the just , but for the unjust and the insubordinate , for the impious and sinners , for the wicked and the defiled , for those who commit patricide , matricide , or homicide ,
54001010	for fornicators , for males who sleep with males , for kidnappers , for liars , for perjurers , and whatever else is contrary to sound doctrine ,
54001011	which is in accord with the Gospel of the glory of the blessed God , the Gospel which has been entrusted to me .
54001012	I give thanks to him who has strengthened me , Christ Jesus our Lord , because he has considered me faithful , placing me in the ministry ,
54001013	though previously I was a blasphemer , and a persecutor , and contemptuous . But then I obtained the mercy of God . For I had been acting ignorantly , in unbelief .
54001014	And so the grace of our Lord has abounded greatly , with the faith and love that is in Christ Jesus .
54001015	It is a faithful saying , and worthy of acceptance by everyone , that Christ Jesus came into this world to bring salvation to sinners , among whom I am first .
54001016	But it was for this reason that I obtained mercy , so that in me as first , Christ Jesus would display all patience , for the instruction of those who would believe in him unto eternal life .
54001017	So then , to the King of ages , to the immortal , invisible , solitary God , be honor and glory forever and ever . Amen .
54001018	This precept I commend to you , my son Timothy , in accord with the prophets who preceded you : that you serve among them like a soldier in a good war ,
54001019	holding to faith and good conscience , against those who , by rejecting these things , have made a shipwreck of the faith .
54001020	Among these are Hymenaeus and Alexander , whom I have handed over to Satan , so that they may learn not to blaspheme .
54002001	And so I beg you , first of all , to make supplications , prayers , petitions , and thanksgivings for all men ,
54002002	for kings , and for all who are in high places , so that we may lead a quiet and tranquil life in all piety and chastity .
54002003	For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior ,
54002004	who wants all men to be saved and to arrive at an acknowledgment of the truth .
54002005	For there is one God , and one mediator of God and of men , the man Christ Jesus ,
54002006	who gave himself as a redemption for all , as a testimony in its proper time .
54002007	Of this testimony , I have been appointed a preacher and an Apostle , ( I speak the truth , I do not lie ) as a teacher of the Gentiles , in faith and in truth .
54002008	Therefore , I want men to pray in every place , lifting up pure hands , without anger or dissension .
54002009	Similarly also , women should be dressed fittingly , adorning themselves with compunction and restraint , and not with plaited hair , nor gold , nor pearls , nor costly attire ,
54002010	but in a manner proper for women who are professing piety by means of good works .
54002011	Let a woman learn in silence with all subjection .
54002012	For I do not permit a woman to teach , nor to be in authority over a man , but to be in silence .
54002013	For Adam was formed first , then Eve .
54002014	And Adam was not seduced , but the woman , having been seduced , was in transgression .
54002015	Yet she will be saved by bearing children , if she has continued in faith and love , and in sanctification accompanied by self-restraint .
54003001	It is a faithful saying : if a man desires the episcopate , he desires a good work .
54003002	Therefore , it is necessary for a bishop to be beyond reproach , the husband of one wife , sober , prudent , gracious , chaste , hospitable , a teacher ,
54003003	not a drunkard , not combative but restrained , not quarrelsome , not covetous ;
54003004	but a man who leads his own house well , having children who are subordinate with all chastity .
54003005	For if a man does not know how to lead his own house , how will he take care of the Church of God ?
54003006	He must not be a new convert , lest , being elated by pride , he may fall under the sentence of the devil .
54003007	And it is necessary for him also to have good testimony from those who are outside , so that he may not fall into disrepute and the snare of the devil .
54003008	Similarly , deacons must be chaste , not double-tongued , not given to much wine , not pursuing tainted profit ,
54003009	holding to the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience .
54003010	And these things should be proven first , and then they may minister , being without offense .
54003011	Similarly , the women must be chaste , not slanderers , sober , faithful in all things .
54003012	Deacons should be the husband of one wife , men who lead their own children and their own houses well .
54003013	For those who have ministered well will acquire for themselves a good position , and much confidence in the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
54003014	I am writing these things to you , with the hope that I will come to you soon .
54003015	But , if I am delayed , you should know the manner in which it is necessary to conduct yourself in the house of God , which is the Church of the living God , the pillar and the foundation of truth .
54003016	And it is clearly great , this mystery of piety , which was manifested in the flesh , which was justified in the Spirit , which has appeared to Angels , which has been preached to the Gentiles , which is believed in the world , which has been taken up in glory .
54004001	Now the Spirit has clearly said that , in the end times , some persons will depart from the faith , paying attention to spirits of error and the doctrines of devils ,
54004002	speaking lies in hypocrisy , and having their consciences seared ,
54004003	prohibiting marriage , abstaining from foods , which God has created to be accepted with thanksgiving by the faithful and by those who have understood the truth .
54004004	For every creature of God is good , and nothing is to be rejected which is received with thanksgiving ;
54004005	for it has been sanctified by the Word of God and by prayer .
54004006	By proposing these things to the brothers , you will be a good minister of Christ Jesus , nourished by words of faith , and by the good doctrine that you have secured .
54004007	But avoid the silly fables of old women . And exercise yourself so as to advance in piety .
54004008	For the exercise of the body is somewhat useful . But piety is useful in all things , holding the promise of life , in the present and in the future .
54004009	This is a faithful saying and worthy of full acceptance .
54004010	For this reason we labor and are maligned : because we hope in the living God , who is the Savior of all men , most especially of the faithful .
54004011	Instruct and teach these things .
54004012	Let no one despise your youth , but be an example among the faithful in word , in behavior , in charity , in faith , in chastity .
54004013	Until I arrive , attend to reading , to exhortation , and to doctrine .
54004014	Do not be willing to neglect the grace that is within you , which was given to you through prophecy , with the imposition of the hands of the priesthood .
54004015	Meditate on these things , so that your progress may be manifest to all .
54004016	Pay attention to yourself and to doctrine . Pursue these things . For in doing so , you will save both yourself and those who listen to you .
54005001	You should not rebuke an old man , but rather plead with him , as if he were your father ; with young men , like brothers ;
54005002	with old women , like mothers ; with young women , in all chastity , like sisters .
54005003	Honor those widows who are true widows .
54005004	But if any widow has children or grandchildren , let her first learn to manage her own household , and to fulfill , in turn , her own obligation to her parents ; for this is acceptable before God .
54005005	But she who is truly a widow and is destitute , let her hope in God , and let her be urgent in supplications and prayers , night and day .
54005006	For she who is living in pleasures is dead , while living .
54005007	And give instruction in this , so that they may be beyond reproach .
54005008	But if anyone has no concern for his own , and especially for those of his own household , he has denied the faith , and he is worse than an unbeliever .
54005009	Let a widow be chosen who is no less than sixty years of age , who was the wife of one husband ,
54005010	who has testimony of her good works : whether she has educated children , or has provided hospitality , or has washed the feet of the saints , or has ministered to those suffering tribulation , or has pursued any kind of good work .
54005011	But avoid the younger widows . For once they have flourished in Christ , they will want to marry ,
54005012	resulting in damnation , because they have disregarded the primacy of faith .
54005013	And being at the same time also idle , they learn to go from house to house , being not only idle , but also talkative and curious , speaking of things which do not concern them .
54005014	Therefore , I want the younger women to marry , to procreate children , to be mothers of families , to provide no ready opportunity for the adversary to speak evil .
54005015	For certain ones have already been turned back to Satan .
54005016	If any among the faithful have widows , let him minister to them and not burden the Church , so that there may be enough for those who are true widows .
54005017	Let priests who lead well be held worthy of twice the honor , especially those who labor in the Word and in doctrine .
54005018	For Scripture says : “ You shall not muzzle an ox as it is treading out the grain , ” and , “ The worker is worthy of his pay . ”
54005019	Do not be willing to accept an accusation against a priest , except under two or three witnesses .
54005020	Reprove sinners in the sight of everyone , so that the others may have fear .
54005021	I testify before God and Christ Jesus and the elect Angels , that you should observe these things without prejudgment , doing nothing which shows favoritism to either side .
54005022	You should not be quick to impose hands on anyone , nor should you take part in the sins of outsiders . Keep yourself chaste .
54005023	Do not continue to drink only water , but make use of a little wine , for the sake of your stomach and your frequent infirmities .
54005024	The sins of some men have been made manifest , preceding them to judgment , but those of others are manifested later .
54005025	Similarly , too , good deeds have been made manifest , but even when they are not , they cannot remain hidden .
54006001	Whoever are servants under the yoke , let them consider their masters to be worthy of every honor , lest the name and doctrine of the Lord be blasphemed .
54006002	But those who have believing masters , let them not despise them because they are brothers , but rather serve them all the more because they are believing and beloved , participants of the same service . Teach and exhort these things .
54006003	If anyone teaches otherwise , and does not consent to the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ , and to that doctrine which is in accord with piety ,
54006004	then he is arrogant , knowing nothing , yet languishing amid the questions and quarrels of words . From these arise envy , contention , blasphemy , evil suspicions :
54006005	the conflicts of men who have been corrupted in mind and deprived of truth , who consider profit to be piety .
54006006	But piety with sufficiency is great gain .
54006007	For we brought nothing into this world , and there is no doubt that we can take nothing away .
54006008	But , having nourishment and some kind of covering , we should be content with these .
54006009	For those who want to become rich fall into temptation and into the snare of the devil and into many useless and harmful desires , which submerge men in destruction and in perdition .
54006010	For desire is the root of all evils . Some persons , hungering in this way , have strayed from the faith and have entangled themselves in many sorrows .
54006011	But you , O man of God , flee from these things , and truly pursue justice , piety , faith , charity , patience , meekness .
54006012	Fight the good fight of faith . Take hold of the eternal life to which you have been called , and make a good profession of faith in the sight of many witnesses .
54006013	I charge you , in the sight of God , who enlivens all things , and in the sight of Christ Jesus , who gave the testimony of a good profession under Pontius Pilate ,
54006014	to observe the commandment , immaculately , irreproachably , unto the return of our Lord Jesus Christ .
54006015	For at the proper time , he shall reveal the blessed and only Power , the King of kings and the Lord of lords ,
54006016	who alone holds immortality , and who inhabits the inaccessible light , whom no man has seen , nor even is able to see , to whom is honor and everlasting dominion . Amen .
54006017	Instruct the wealthy of this age not to have a superior attitude , nor to hope in the uncertainty of riches , but in the living God , who offers us everything in abundance to enjoy ,
54006018	and to do good , to become rich in good works , to donate readily , to share ,
54006019	to gather for themselves the treasure of a good foundation for the future , so that they may obtain true life .
54006020	O Timothy , guard what has been deposited with you , avoiding the voice of profane novelties and of opposing ideas , which are falsely called knowledge .
54006021	Certain persons , promising these things , have perished from the faith . May grace be with you . Amen .
55001001	Paul , an Apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God , in accord with the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus ,
55001002	to Timothy , most beloved son . Grace , mercy , peace , from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord .
55001003	I give thanks to God , whom I serve , as my forefathers did , with a pure conscience . For without ceasing I hold the remembrance of you in my prayers , night and day ,
55001004	desiring to see you , recalling your tears so as to be filled with joy ,
55001005	calling to mind the same faith , which is in you unfeigned , which also first dwelt in your grandmother , Lois , and in your mother , Eunice , and also , I am certain , in you .
55001006	Because of this , I admonish you to revive the grace of God , which is in you by the imposition of my hands .
55001007	For God has not given us a spirit of fear , but of virtue , and of love , and of self-restraint .
55001008	And so , do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord , nor of me , his prisoner . Instead , collaborate with the Gospel in accord with the virtue of God ,
55001009	who has freed us and has called us to his holy vocation , not according to our works , but according to his own purpose and grace , which was given to us in Christ Jesus , before the ages of time .
55001010	And this has now been made manifest by the illumination of our Savior Jesus Christ , who certainly has destroyed death , and who has also illuminated life and incorruption through the Gospel .
55001011	Of this Gospel , I have been appointed a preacher , and an Apostle , and a teacher of the Gentiles .
55001012	For this reason , I also suffer these things . But I am not confounded . For I know in whom I have believed , and I am certain that he has the power to preserve what was entrusted to me , unto that day .
55001013	Hold to the kind of sound words that you have heard from me in the faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
55001014	Guard the good entrusted to you through the Holy Spirit , who lives within us .
55001015	Know this : that all those who are in Asia have turned away from me , among whom are Phigellus and Hermogenes .
55001016	May the Lord have mercy on the house of Onesiphorus , because he has often refreshed me , and he has not been ashamed of my chains .
55001017	Instead , when he had arrived in Rome , he anxiously sought me and found me .
55001018	May the Lord grant to him to obtain mercy from the Lord in that day . And you know well in how many ways he has ministered to me at Ephesus .
55002001	And as for you , my son , be strengthened by the grace which is in Christ Jesus ,
55002002	and by the things which you have heard from me through many witnesses . These things encourage faithful men , who shall then be suitable to teach others also .
55002003	Labor like a good soldier of Christ Jesus .
55002004	No man , acting as a soldier for God , entangles himself in worldly matters , so that he may be pleasing to him for whom he has proven himself .
55002005	Then , too , whoever strives in a competition is not crowned , unless he has competed lawfully .
55002006	The farmer who labors ought to be the first to share in the produce .
55002007	Understand what I am saying . For the Lord will give you understanding in all things .
55002008	Be mindful that the Lord Jesus Christ , who is the offspring of David , has risen again from the dead , according to my Gospel .
55002009	I labor in this Gospel , even while chained like an evildoer . But the Word of God is not bound .
55002010	I endure all things for this reason : for the sake of the elect , so that they , too , may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus , with heavenly glory .
55002011	It is a faithful saying : that if we have died with him , we will also live with him .
55002012	If we suffer , we will also reign with him . If we deny him , he will also deny us .
55002013	If we are unfaithful , he remains faithful : he is not able to deny himself .
55002014	Insist on these things , testifying before the Lord . Do not be contentious about words , for this is useful for nothing but the subversion of listeners .
55002015	Be solicitous in the task of presenting yourself before God as a proven and unashamed worker who has handled the Word of Truth correctly .
55002016	But avoid profane or empty talk . For these things advance one greatly in impiety .
55002017	And their word spreads like a cancer : among these are Hymenaeus and Philetus ,
55002018	who have fallen away from the truth by saying that the resurrection is already complete . And so they have subverted the faith of certain persons .
55002019	But the firm foundation of God remains standing , having this seal : the Lord knows those who are his own , and all who know the name of the Lord depart from iniquity .
55002020	But , in a large house , there are not only vessels of gold and of silver , but also those of wood and of clay ; and certainly some are held in honor , but others in dishonor .
55002021	If anyone , then , will have cleansed himself from these things , he shall be a vessel held in honor , sanctified and useful to the Lord , prepared for every good work .
55002022	So then , flee from the desires of your youth , yet truly , pursue justice , faith , hope , charity , and peace , along with those who call upon the Lord from a pure heart .
55002023	But avoid foolish and undisciplined questions , for you know that these produce strife .
55002024	For the servant of the Lord must not be contentious , but instead he must be meek toward everyone , teachable , patient ,
55002025	correcting with self-restraint those who resist the truth . For at any time God may give them repentance , so as to recognize the truth ,
55002026	and then they may recover from the snares of the devil , by whom they are held captive at his will .
55003001	And know this : that in the last days perilous times will press near .
55003002	Men will be lovers of themselves , greedy , self-exalting , arrogant , blasphemers , disobedient to parents , ungrateful , wicked ,
55003003	without affection , without peace , false accusers , unchaste , cruel , without kindness ,
55003004	traitorous , reckless , self-important , loving pleasure more than God ,
55003005	even having the appearance of piety while rejecting its virtue . And so , avoid them .
55003006	For among these are ones who penetrate houses and lead away , like captives , foolish women burdened with sins , who are led away by means of various desires ,
55003007	always learning , yet never achieving knowledge of the truth .
55003008	And in the same manner that Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses , so also will these resist the truth , men corrupted in mind , reprobates from the faith .
55003009	But they will not advance beyond a certain point . For the folly of the latter shall be made manifest to all , just as that of the former .
55003010	But you have fully comprehended my doctrine , instruction , purpose , faith , longsuffering , love , patience ,
55003011	persecutions , afflictions ; such things as happened to me at Antioch , at Iconium , and at Lystra ; how I endured persecutions , and how the Lord rescued me from everything .
55003012	And all those who willingly live the piety in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution .
55003013	But evil men and deceivers will advance in evil , erring and sending into error .
55003014	Yet truly , you should remain in those things which you have learned and which have been entrusted to you . For you know from whom you have learned them .
55003015	And , from your infancy , you have known the Sacred Scriptures , which are able to instruct you toward salvation , through the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
55003016	All Scripture , having been divinely inspired , is useful for teaching , for reproof , for correction , and for instruction in justice ,
55003017	so that the man of God may be perfect , having been trained for every good work .
55004001	I testify before God , and before Jesus Christ , who shall judge the living and the dead through his return and his kingdom :
55004002	that you should preach the word urgently , in season and out of season : reprove , entreat , rebuke , with all patience and doctrine .
55004003	For there shall be a time when they will not endure sound doctrine , but instead , according to their own desires , they will gather to themselves teachers , with itching ears ,
55004004	and certainly , they will turn their hearing away from the truth , and they will be turned toward fables .
55004005	But as for you , truly , be vigilant , laboring in all things . Do the work of an Evangelist , fulfilling your ministry . Show self-restraint .
55004006	For I am already being worn away , and the time of my dissolution presses close .
55004007	I have fought the good fight . I have completed the course . I have preserved the faith .
55004008	As for the remainder , a crown of justice has been reserved for me , one which the Lord , the just judge , will render to me in that day , and not only to me , but also to those who look forward to his return . Hurry to return to me soon .
55004009	For Demas has abandoned me , out of love for this age , and he has departed for Thessalonica .
55004010	Crescens has gone to Galatia ; Titus to Dalmatia .
55004011	Luke alone is with me . Take Mark and bring him with you ; for he is useful to me in the ministry .
55004012	But Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus .
55004013	When you return , bring with you the supplies that I left with Carpus at Troas , and the books , but especially the parchments .
55004014	Alexander the coppersmith has shown me much evil ; the Lord will repay him according to his works .
55004015	And you should also avoid him ; for he has strongly resisted our words .
55004016	At my first defense , no one stood by me , but everyone abandoned me . May it not be counted against them !
55004017	But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me , so that through me the preaching would be accomplished , and so that all the Gentiles would hear . And I was freed from the mouth of the lion .
55004018	The Lord has freed me from every evil work , and he will accomplish salvation by his heavenly kingdom . To him be glory forever and ever . Amen .
55004019	Greet Prisca , and Aquila , and the household of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus remained at Corinth . And Trophimus I left sick at Miletus .
55004021	Hurry to arrive before winter . Eubulus , and Pudens , and Linus , and Claudia , and all the brothers greet you .
55004022	May the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . May grace be with you . Amen .
56001001	Paul , a servant of God and an Apostle of Jesus Christ , in accord with the faith of God’s elect and in acknowledgment of the truth which is accompanied by piety ,
56001002	in the hope of the eternal life that God , who does not lie , promised before the ages of time ,
56001003	which , at the proper time , he has manifested by his Word , in the preaching that has been entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior ;
56001004	to Titus , beloved son according to the common faith . Grace and peace , from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Savior .
56001005	For this reason , I left you behind in Crete : so that those things which are lacking , you would correct , and so that you would ordain , throughout the communities , priests , ( just as I also ordained you )
56001006	if such a man is without offense , the husband of one wife , having faithful children , not accused of self-indulgence , nor of insubordination .
56001007	And a bishop , as a steward of God , must be without offense : not arrogant , not short-tempered , not a drunkard , not violent , not desiring tainted profit ,
56001008	but instead : hospitable , kind , sober , just , holy , chaste ,
56001009	embracing faithful speech which is in agreement with doctrine , so that he may be able to exhort in sound doctrine and to argue against those who contradict .
56001010	For there are , indeed , many who are disobedient , who speak empty words , and who deceive , especially those who are of the circumcision .
56001011	These must be reproved , for they subvert entire houses , teaching things which should not be taught , for the favor of shameful gain .
56001012	A certain one of these , a prophet of their own kind , said : “ The Cretans are ever liars , evil beasts , lazy gluttons . ”
56001013	This testimony is true . Because of this , rebuke them sharply , so that they may be sound in the faith ,
56001014	not paying attention to Jewish fables , nor to the rules of men who have turned themselves away from the truth .
56001015	All things are clean to those who are clean . But to those who are defiled , and to unbelievers , nothing is clean ; for both their mind and their conscience have been polluted .
56001016	They claim that they know God . But , by their own works , they deny him , since they are abominable , and unbelieving , and reprobate , toward every good work .
56002001	But you are to speak the things that befit sound doctrine .
56002002	Old men should be sober , chaste , prudent , sound in faith , in love , in patience .
56002003	Old women , similarly , should be in holy attire , not false accusers , not given to much wine , teaching well ,
56002004	so that they may teach prudence to the young women , so that they may love their husbands , love their children ,
56002005	be sensible , chaste , restrained , have concern for the household , be kind , be subordinate to their husbands : so that the Word of God may be not blasphemed .
56002006	Exhort young men similarly , so that they may show self-restraint .
56002007	In all things , present yourself as an example of good works : in doctrine , with integrity , with seriousness ,
56002008	with sound words , irreproachably , so that he who is an opponent may dread that he has nothing evil to say about us .
56002009	Exhort servants to be submissive to their masters , in all things pleasing , not contradicting ,
56002010	not cheating , but in all things showing good fidelity , so that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things .
56002011	For the grace of God our Savior has appeared to all men ,
56002012	instructing us to reject impiety and worldly desires , so that we may live soberly and justly and piously in this age ,
56002013	looking forward to the blessed hope and the advent of the glory of the great God and of our Savior Jesus Christ .
56002014	He gave himself for our sake , so that he might redeem us from all iniquity , and might cleanse for himself an acceptable people , pursuers of good works .
56002015	Speak and exhort and argue these things with all authority . Let no one despise you .
56003001	Admonish them to be subordinate to the rulers and authorities , to obey their dictates , to be prepared for every good work ,
56003002	to speak evil of no one , not to be litigious , but to be reserved , displaying all meekness toward all men .
56003003	For , in times past , we ourselves were also unwise , unbelieving , erring , servants of various desires and pleasures , acting with malice and envy , being hateful and hating one another .
56003004	But then the kindness and humanity of God our Savior appeared .
56003005	And he saved us , not by works of justice that we had done , but , in accord with his mercy , by the washing of regeneration and by the renovation of the Holy Spirit ,
56003006	whom he has poured out upon us in abundance , through Jesus Christ our Savior ,
56003007	so that , having been justified by his grace , we may become heirs according to the hope of eternal life .
56003008	This is a faithful saying . And I want you to confirm these things , so that those who believe in God may take care to excel in good works . These things are good and useful to men .
56003009	But avoid foolish questions , and genealogies , and contentions , as well as arguments against the law . For these are useless and empty .
56003010	Avoid a man who is a heretic , after the first and second correction ,
56003011	knowing that one who is like this has been subverted , and that he offends ; for he has been condemned by his own judgment .
56003012	When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you , hurry to return to me at Nicopolis . For I have decided to winter there .
56003013	Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollo ahead with care , and let nothing be lacking to them .
56003014	But let our men also learn to excel in good works pertaining to the necessities of life , so that they may not be unfruitful .
56003015	All those who are with me greet you . Greet those who love us in the faith . May the grace of God be with you all . Amen .
57001001	Paul , a prisoner of Christ Jesus , and Timothy , a brother , to Philemon , our beloved fellow laborer ,
57001002	and to Apphia , most beloved sister , and to Archippus , our fellow soldier , and to the church which is in your house .
57001003	Grace and peace to you , from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ .
57001004	I give thanks to my God , always keeping remembrance of you in my prayers ,
57001005	( for I am hearing of your charity and faith , which you have in the Lord Jesus and with all the saints )
57001006	so that the participation of your faith may become evident by the recognition of every good work which is in you in Christ Jesus .
57001007	For I have found great joy and consolation in your charity , because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you , brother .
57001008	Because of this , I have enough confidence in Christ Jesus to command you concerning certain things ,
57001009	but I beg you instead , for the sake of charity , since you are so much like Paul : an old man and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ .
57001010	I beg you , on behalf of my son , whom I have begotten in my chains , Onesimus .
57001011	In times past , he was useless to you , but now he is useful both to me and to you .
57001012	So I have sent him back to you . And may you receive him like my own heart .
57001013	I myself wanted to retain him with me , so that he might minister to me , on your behalf , while I am in the chains of the Gospel .
57001014	But I was willing to do nothing without your counsel , so as not to make use of your good deed as if out of necessity , but only willingly .
57001015	So perhaps , then , he departed from you for a time , so that you might receive him again for eternity ,
57001016	no longer as a servant , but , in place of a servant , a most beloved brother , especially to me : but how much so more to you , both in the flesh and in the Lord !
57001017	Therefore , if you hold me to be a companion , receive him as you would me .
57001018	But if he has harmed you in any way , or if he is in your debt , charge it to me .
57001019	I , Paul , have written this with my own hand : I will repay . And I need not tell you , that you are also in debt yourself , to me .
57001020	So it is , brother . May I delight with you in the Lord ! Refresh my heart in Christ .
57001021	I have written to you , trusting in your obedience , knowing , too , that you will do even more than what I say .
57001022	But also , at once , prepare a lodging for me . For I am hoping , through your prayers , to present myself to you .
57001023	Greet Epaphras , my fellow captive in Christ Jesus ,
57001024	and Mark , Aristarchus , Demas , and Luke , my helpers .
57001025	May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
58001001	In many places and in many ways , in past times , God spoke to the fathers through the Prophets ;
58001002	lastly , in these days , he has spoken to us through the Son , whom he appointed as the heir of all things , and through whom he made the world .
58001003	And since the Son is the brightness of his glory , and the figure of his substance , and is carrying all things by the Word of his virtue , thereby accomplishing a purging of sins , he sits at the right hand of Majesty on high .
58001004	And having been made so much better than the Angels , he has inherited a name so much greater than theirs .
58001005	For to which of the Angels has he ever said : “ You are my Son ; today have I begotten you ? ” Or again : “ I will be a Father to him , and he shall be a Son to me ? ”
58001006	And again , when he brings the only-begotten Son into the world , he says : “ And let all the Angels of God adore him . ”
58001007	And about the Angels , certainly , he says : “ He makes his Angels spirits , and his ministers a flame of fire . ”
58001008	But about the Son : “ Your throne , O God , is forever and ever . The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of equity .
58001009	You have loved justice , and you have hated iniquity . Because of this , God , your God , has anointed you with the oil of exultation , above your companions . ”
58001010	And : “ In the beginning , O Lord , you founded the earth . And the heavens are the work of your hands .
58001011	These shall pass away , but you will remain . And all will grow old like a garment .
58001012	And you will change them like a cloak , and they shall be changed . Yet you are ever the same , and your years will not diminish . ”
58001013	But to which of the Angels has he ever said : “ Sit at my right hand , until I make your enemies your footstool ? ”
58001014	Are they not all spirits of ministration , sent to minister for the sake of those who shall receive the inheritance of salvation ?
58002001	For this reason , it is necessary for us to observe more thoroughly the things that we have heard , lest we let them slip away .
58002002	For if a word that was spoken through the Angels has been made firm , and every transgression and disobedience has received the recompense of a just retribution ,
58002003	in what way might we escape , if we neglect such a great salvation ? For though initially it had begun to be described by the Lord , it was confirmed among us by those who heard him ,
58002004	with God testifying to it by signs and wonders , and by various miracles , and by the pouring out of the Holy Spirit , in accord with his own will .
58002005	For God did not subject the future world , about which we are speaking , to the Angels .
58002006	But someone , in a certain place , has testified , saying : “ What is man , that you are mindful of him , or the Son of man , that you visit him ?
58002007	You have reduced him to a little less than the Angels . You have crowned him with glory and honor , and you have set him over the works of your hands .
58002008	You have subjected all things under his feet . ” For in as much as he has subjected all things to him , he has left nothing not subject to him . But in the present time , we do not yet perceive that all things have been made subject to him .
58002009	Yet we understand that Jesus , who was reduced to a little less than the Angels , was crowned with glory and honor because of his Passion and death , in order that , by the grace of God , he might taste death for all .
58002010	For it was fitting for him , because of whom and through whom all things exist , who had led many children into glory , to complete the authorship of their salvation through his Passion .
58002011	For he who sanctifies , and those who are sanctified , are all from One . For this reason , he is not ashamed to call them brothers , saying :
58002012	“ I will announce your name to my brothers . In the midst of the Church , I will praise you . ”
58002013	And again : “ I will be faithful in him . ” And again : “ Behold , I and my children , whom God has given to me . ”
58002014	Therefore , because children have a common flesh and blood , he himself also , in like manner , has shared in the same , so that through death , he might destroy him who held the dominion of death , that is , the devil ,
58002015	and so that he might free those who , through the fear of death , had been condemned to servitude throughout their entire life .
58002016	For at no time did he take hold of the Angels , but instead he took hold of the offspring of Abraham .
58002017	Therefore , it is fitting for him to be made similar to his brothers in all things , so that he might become a merciful and faithful High Priest before God , in order that he might bring forgiveness to the offenses of the people .
58002018	For in as much as he himself has suffered and has been tempted , he also is able to assist those who are tempted .
58003001	Therefore , holy brothers , sharers in the heavenly calling , consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession : Jesus .
58003002	He is faithful to the One who made him , just as Moses also was , with his entire house .
58003003	For this Jesus was considered worthy of greater glory than Moses , so much so that the house which he has built holds a greater honor than the former one .
58003004	For every house is built by someone , but God is the One who has created all things .
58003005	And certainly Moses was faithful , with his entire house , like any servant , as a testimony to those things that would soon be said .
58003006	Yet truly , Christ is like a Son in his own house . We are that house , if we firmly retain the faithfulness and the glory of hope , even unto the end .
58003007	Because of this , it is just as the Holy Spirit says : “ If today you hear his voice ,
58003008	harden not your hearts , as in the provocation , the very day of temptation , in the desert ,
58003009	where your fathers tested me , even though they had seen and examined my works for forty years .
58003010	For this reason , I was enraged against this generation , and I said : They always wander astray in heart . For they have not known my ways .
58003011	So it is as I swore in my wrath : They shall not enter into my rest ! ”
58003012	Be cautious , brothers , lest perhaps there may be , in any of you , an evil heart of unbelief , turning aside from the living God .
58003013	Instead , exhort one another every day , while it is still called ‘ today , ’ so that none of you may become hardened through the falseness of sin .
58003014	For we have been made participants in Christ . This is only so , if we firmly retain the beginning of his substance , even unto the end .
58003015	For it has been said : “ If today you hear his voice , harden not your hearts , in the same manner as in the former provocation . ”
58003016	For some of those listening did provoke him . But not all of these had set forth from Egypt through Moses .
58003017	So against whom was he angry for forty years ? Was it not those who had sinned , whose dead bodies lay prostrate in the desert ?
58003018	But to whom did he swear that they would not enter into his rest , except to those who were incredulous ?
58003019	And so , we perceive that they were not able to enter because of unbelief .
58004001	Therefore , we should be afraid , lest the promise of entering into his rest may be relinquished , and some of you may be judged to be lacking .
58004002	For this was announced to us in a similar manner as to them . But the mere hearing of the word did not benefit them , since it was not joined together with a faith in those things that they heard .
58004003	For we who have believed shall enter into rest , in the same manner as he said : “ So it is as I have sworn in my wrath : They shall not enter into my rest ! ” And certainly , this is when the works from the foundation of the world have been finished .
58004004	For , in a certain place , he spoke about the seventh day in this manner : “ And God rested on the seventh day from all his works . ”
58004005	And in this place again : “ They shall not enter into my rest ! ”
58004006	Therefore , this is because certain ones remain who are to enter into it , and those to whom it was announced first did not enter into it , because of unbelief .
58004007	Again , he defines a certain day , after so much time , saying in David , “ Today , ” just as it was stated above , “ If today you hear his voice , harden not your hearts . ”
58004008	For if Jesus had offered them rest , he would never have spoken , afterward , about another day .
58004009	And so , there remains a Sabbath of rest for the people of God .
58004010	For whoever has entered into his rest , the same has also rested from his works , just as God did from his .
58004011	Therefore , let us hasten to enter into that rest , so that no one may fall into the same example of unbelief .
58004012	For the Word of God is living and effective : more piercing than any two-edged sword , reaching to the division even between the soul and the spirit , even between the joints and the marrow , and so it discerns the thoughts and intentions of the heart .
58004013	And there is no created thing that is invisible to his sight . For all things are naked and open to the eyes of him , about whom we are speaking .
58004014	Therefore , since we have a great High Priest , who has pierced the heavens , Jesus the Son of God , we should hold to our confession .
58004015	For we do not have a high priest who is unable to have compassion on our infirmities , but rather one who was tempted in all things , just as we are , yet without sin .
58004016	Therefore , let us go forth with confidence toward the throne of grace , so that we may obtain mercy , and find grace , in a helpful time .
58005001	For every high priest , having been taken from among men , is appointed on behalf of men toward the things which pertain to God , so that he may offer gifts and sacrifices on behalf of sins ;
